Reviews.Title: “A little tired but.....”
Reviews.Author: Sanches55
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for 7 nights in mid March. The hotels decor and furnishings may be a touch tired but the location, staff (particularly Wilson the door man) and cleanliness of the bedding, towels etc were perfect for our needs. We stayed in a junior suite on the top floor which was spacious, our only criticism would be the second fridge in the room was not very cold. We were able to regulate the heating in the room as it was unusually warm during our stay. My only other moan would be that I wish I was still there. So I'm saving up to go back one day.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with potential, but falls short”
Reviews.Author: Chicagohoosier07
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, I was not given the junior suite I booked. Then, after one night in a tiny room, they moved us to a proper room. Overall, the staff was friendly and courteous. The hotel haas European decor and style, but the furnishings are crap. The tables and desks are not real wood and unsteady. And the elevator is the oldest and slowest system I've literally ever encountered. If you stay higher up, you might have to wait 5 minutes or longer. The location its great, near plenty of shopping, cabs, restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Thieves in hotel; Management unresponsive”
Reviews.Author: NeepaNYC
Reviews.Content: During the week my friends were staying here they had family jewelry stolen from their hotel room. The hotel promised they would launch an investigation and give them a report in the week after they had to return to their country. My friends heard nothing. I called repeatedly on their behalf, asked to speak with the manager handling the case, who NEVER called me back. The assistant manager told me they had tried to contact my friends but my friends heard NOTHING; even though they had given the hotel several contact phones, contact emails. The assistant manager could tell me nothing, yet the manager refused to call me. I have traveled and stayed in many hotels in New York, the US, and overseas and NEVER have I received such bad communication, such irresponsible people. They should be so ashamed of the image and disrespect they present to guests. My advice to you is absolutely never ever stay in the Avalon hotel. It is the absolute worse, and the management have zero respect for people.

Reviews.Title: “A very good located hotel”
Reviews.Author: 190479Ann
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Avalon for three nights in March. The hotel is excellent located. The Empire State Bld is in the close neighbourhood and you can easily walk to Times Square, Union Station, Penn Station etc. When we checked in they would give us a room with one king bed, with the explanation that that was according to our reservation. The personnell at the desk were at first not willing to accept that we had ordered a room with two beds, even if we showed them the voucher stating it clearly. They offered to make up the sofa-bed in the room and try to move us to another room the day after, if available. We were not willing to accept that, and after checking the booking system once again, a room with two beds was available after all! The room was on the 5th floor facing the back-yard, and surprisingly quiet to be situated in the middle of NYC. The room was spacious with two flat-screen TVs and the bathroom was ok, but both were in need of a refurbishment. Dark wallpaper and brown curtains made it very dark and the lightning was not sufficient. Our reservation was for a deluxe suite. I am sure our room was not in that category, but we did not bother to further argumentation. Plus for wooden floor in the room and for an extra fridge, since the mini-bar was was of the automatic type, in which you cannot move anything withoug being charged for it. Comfortable beds, a spacious wardrobe and a safe were also a plus. All-in-all we enjoyed staying at this hotel and will definitely consider to stay there again later.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, excellent location.”
Reviews.Author: bigcraigScotland
Reviews.Content: Dont quite understand a recent reviewer saying that the location of this hotel was not good?? About 60 yards east of 5th Avenue and about a 4 minute walk to Empire State building? Anyway.......stayed here in February 2012 for a 4 night break with my wife. My first time in New York and I loved every second of it! Hotel was difficult to see when we were dropped off, but they now have a canopy fitted outside, so should be much easier to find. The hotel is really nice inside.......we asked for a high floor and we got this. Our room (1209) was a junior suite overlooking the rear of the hotel......not much to see on the streets below but a nice view at night through the gaps of the buildings opposite. Room had 2 double beds, which we would have normally pushed together to create a super king size, but a pole in the middle of the beds prevented this. Room had 2 flatscreen TV's on the wall and the room was huge (17 paces from room door to far window). Bathroom was a good size and shower and bath worked perfectly. There was a mini bar (very expensive) in the room and also a small fridge, which didnt get very cool, but did the job. The down side of the hotel was that there was no communal bar area downstairs. Apparently it is under new management (and changed names from 'Vincci Avalon' to 'Avalon') so that might be the reason why. Interior decor of the hotel is very nice, especially on the higher floors - rooms are clean and spacious. All staff, especially door staff, (Wilson in particular) are very friendly and helpful. Free computers to use in a private area, near reception, is a nice touch. In summary we really liked this hotel. IF they can keep the prices to what we paid this time, then there is no doubt that we would stay here again. Loved New York, and would return in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Weak hotel”
Reviews.Author: traveltoomuchToronto
Reviews.Content: Tremendously beat up rooms, paint chipping everywhere, looking over a fire escape (perhaps a typical NYC hotel view), no hotel restaurant or bar, A/C does not get turned kn until legally required in Manahttan, so in 80 dgree weather last week heat only was available, indifferent staff, overall a real wast of money in a poor location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Brianluxury
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel! Fantastic location! We will defintely stay with Avalon again. Tip: Ask for a room away from the street.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: angel1265
Reviews.Content: great location with very spacious rooms , we stayed in 1005 , it is a junior suite and really worth having a bigger space so worth the extra dollars , the hotel is well kept , warm and staffed with really friendly and efficient people , the bed was comfy and the shower fantastic , overall I would recommend this hotel for its great central location but with that comes the noise of the city but hey that is what makes New York such a fantastic place to visit

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: Roadkillbob
Reviews.Content: Great location and very spacy suite(junior). We were allowed to keep our bikes in the room, great service!

Reviews.Title: “Great location / Met expectations / Great price”
Reviews.Author: TallVermonter Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Down for long weekend, 2 night stay. Drove right there from VT, pulled in front, unloaded the car with help of quick to react doorman. They park your car after you fill out some car retrieval forms. Check in was easy, threw stuff in room. And off to visit with our oldest son who lived ~12 blocks away. Room was plenty big enough, had a sitting area. Bathroom was bigger than any in my house. Bed was great... only issue, one of the 2 nights was noisy outside in the street. We were close to restaurants, 1 block from the Empire St bldg (Go up @ 8 to 8:30am and it was very uncrowded). 4 or 5 blocks from MSG, where we caught a Bruins/Rangers game. Wilson, the doorman was great and helpful in many ways. Met expectations, great loction, great price.

Reviews.Title: “No wifi, and they had dirty sheets, yuck!”
Reviews.Author: VF79Ams
Reviews.Content: This hotel should not advertise that they have wifi. In a week-long stay I was NEVER able to make a connection strong enough to send an email out. (At Starbucks around the corner I could send things out fine, so it's not my device.) The wired connection is just as bad, or worse, as the plug on the internet cable is broken en you need to hold it and shimmy it constantly to make it function. I would've rated it with 2 stars if it wasn't for the last night and finding out the cleanliness was worse than I thought. They don't give you new sheets unless you specifically ask for it by putting a card on the bed. I did so and when I went to bed that night I noticed that they had just flipped the sheets instead of cleaned them/given me new ones. (I recognized a couple of stains.) Also, after the 3rd day I didn't receive washcloths anymore. I choose a hotel based on 2 things, they need to have free wifi and be clean. The Avalon had neither. Will never go there again and will advise co-workers/clients to avoid this hotel as well!

Reviews.Title: “Very good choice”
Reviews.Author: Black_Mamb4
Reviews.Content: We stayed 10 days in the Avalon hotel and it was a very good choice. We got a good deal for a junior suite, so we had a large room at the price of a normal one (very rare in ny!). The hotel is so well located that we didn't need to wake up very early in the morning to reach any place!It is everything behind the corner, underground, museums, good restaurants, malls! The rooms are old fashion, not very modern at all...but the personnel keeps them very clean. The towels and the sheets were changed every day. The only negative aspects were the views (not that great!) and the hitting system (very noisy). The persons working there were always very helpful and kind. There is no additional services like swimming pool or fitness center, but the wi-fi is for free. Overall it was very good choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Percypeanuts
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel all round. Friendly staff, huge rooms and an excellent location. We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely be staying here again. Best hotel we have used in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Beds most comfortable hotel beds ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: paulh8280
Reviews.Content: I had read mixed reviews on the Vincci Avalon prior to arrival in New York, but I am happy to say that the hotel was lovely. Check in was super smooth, with very friendly and charismatic staff. I found Melody to be particularly friendly and efficient. Our room was a Junior Suite on the 9th floor. The bathroom was nicely presented with twin sinks, separate tub and shower and was always very clean. The view from the room was not great, but to be honest we were never there to see the view. Mini bar prices were extremely high, but again a minor detail. We had 2 large flat screen Sony tv's in our room which was a lovely touch. Then there was the bed!!! What a bed it was too. Massive, with the most luxurious cotton sheets and lovely warm duvet. It was the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in. The hotel itself is located on 32nd street. It is just round the corner from the Empire State Building and a few blocks from Macy's. Closest subway is 33rd street which offers easy connections to midtown, uptown and downtown Manhattan. Overall a wonderful stay in NYC, with some great staff and a hotel in a great location, that is close enough to touch all of the sites, but far enough away not to wake you up in the morning!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and great staff”
Reviews.Author: Luanne S
Reviews.Content: We happened upon the hotel on a web search and booked because of the great price. We stayed this past week for the Westminster Dog Show and can not say enough great things about the staff and hotel. Everyone was exceptionally polite and helpful. The price got us to book this hotel but the staff will keep us coming back. We usually pick a different hotel everytime we travel to New York but will only stay at the Vincci Avalon from now on. It is convenient and the excellent service makes the stay truly enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic and have Recommended to Friends!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stephen1981
Reviews.Content: My partner and i travelled to New York and stayed at the Vincci Avalon for my 30th Birthday in January this year. We had read many good reviews and after a long tiring journey we arrived in New York late and very tired. The receptionist was very polite and upgraded our room to a suite which was very nice, we entered the room and were immediately struck by the generous size of the room, very clean and crisp appearance and modern. The bed was literally the most comfortable bed we had slept in and the bathroom was clean and the marble was a nice touch. After having a fantastic break in New York and staying at the Vincci Avalon 2 nights we checked out around midday, and saw the last of what we could see before our airport taxi picked us up from outside the Vincci Avalon at 6pm. We got back to the hotel around 5.30pm and it was so cold outside that the kind staff at the Vincci Avalon let us wait in the lobby until 6pm. Overall our experience at the Vincci Avalon was excellent. Impeccable service, fantastic and spacious rooms and a warm welcoming atmosphere, being our first time in New York we were so impressed and vowed to return again in the Summer. Thanks again for making our First visit to New York and my 30th Birthday Truly memorable and we both hope to stay at the Vincci Avalon again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - quiet”
Reviews.Author: rtrain4
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night for business. Booked the room only a few daythe s before stay and the price was very reasonable. Spoke directly to the hotel and felt that the staff really wanted me to stay with them. Very welcoming. Good room rate for a last minute booking. Arrived late on Tuesday night. Check in was very easy and night clerk was very hospitable. Empire Pizza is a block away on 5th ave. for good late night food. I used to have an office a few blocks away so I knew the neighborhood. Room was clean and very old style NY. Big windows and hard wood floors and over stated trim. Floor was warm and did not creak. Stayed on 5th floor facing the street. Room was quiet and comfortable. Bed was very comfortable. WiFi in the room was a little flaky. Breakfast buffet is expensive for what you get and caters to European travelers as well as American. Better breakfast for my needs is available down the street. The Library / Business center was very comfortable and a good place to work. All the hotel staff were very helpful and gracious. Rumor is the building has been sold to a new investor group that will try and turn the Avalon into a 5 star hotel. I will definitely try them again.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in New York”
Reviews.Author: Cara O Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, staff could not have been nicer, even let us check in 3 hours before official check in time. Storage of bags no problems with no obligatory costs charged. Free internet access in rooms and tea and coffee in reception, refreshing change from Hilton hotel chain we stayed in previously. Easy 10 minute walk from Penn Station. Overall lovely stay and will return.

Reviews.Title: “Cold showers, rude staff, slow wifi, silly room design”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. The biggest problem with this hotel is the luke warm "hot" water. Hotel staff would not admit there was a problem. I was shivering while showering. I asked other customers at the hotel if they also had cold showers and they did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Room!”
Reviews.Author: Posted by a cheaprooms.com traveler
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with the rooms at this hotel. When I looked up the hotel and found pictures of the room, I was pleasantly suprised to find the room exactly like the picture. The room was spacious, wood floors (which I loved) and clean! The only problem we found was that we were the only Americans at this hotel, guest or employees, so the language barrier was a little tough. Overall, very nice hotel and would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome localization!”
Reviews.Author: Grzegorz1983
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, good value. I had problems with internet in my room but they fixed it. Friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: Gracielas
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for walking around Midtown and close to Times Sq. By Empire State Building. Close to subway. The area is know as Korean and so are many of the restaurants in the area. Great for noodles and sushi! Complimentary coffe Helpfull staff

Reviews.Title: “Huge room size for New York, great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: LoaFinn
Reviews.Content: Huge room (especially coming from Ramada New Yorker closet sized room), wood floors instead of carpet was nice, good pillows and bedding. Slight downside was water pressure in the shower although the bathroom was very nice and spacious. Decor is slightly dated, but had a nice not too formal feel to it. Really enjoyed the area, had a great walk down to Eataly on Madison Square Park - very nice spot. Hotel was very quiet, and right near Heartland Brewery - had a great dinner there - amazing service and reasonable prices. Make sure to go up Empire State building at night it was amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location & Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: andrewh8698
Reviews.Content: Really good location just off 5th avenue at the Empire States Building. Staff were helpful with everything we asked of them. Close enought to transport link to everywhere in Manhattan and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Fab retreat and good value for money”
Reviews.Author: C P
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in an executive suite. Lots of room to relax with separate living room to bedroom. Nice having a lobby to store coats and wet shoes. Wooden floors throughout other than bathroom which was marble. Great location, close enough to the action but far away enough to not feel crowded. Approx 15min walk to Times Sq and shopping. Housekeeping hit and miss. Went out for hours and room still not done when returned mid-afternoon. Some items changed / replenished, some not?? Free wi-fi which had good signal strength even on 7th floor, better than other hotels stayed in. Let down was no kettle, tea or coffee in room and limited library coffee hours (11:00 - 22:00). Guess to encourage you to have breakfast, didn't as Cafe M a few doors down was perfect for what we needed. Most importantly, bed super comfy. Would stay again especially as now know the few pitfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: marcie5785
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Friendly and clean! Rooms are a great size too, compared to others in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Return Visit”
Reviews.Author: Alice A
Reviews.Content: This was the fourth time we have stayed here as we have always been very pleased with the service & the location is perfect. The staff were always friendly & helpful. I was a little disappointed this time with some of the reception staff who didn't come up to the previous standard but the doorman was the same one who we have met on our previous stay there was his usual charming self, very helpful. I found this time that the rooms could do with updating, the tap kept falling off the bath each time it was used & the sanitary ware had seen better days, cracked wash basin & tatty shower curtain & ours was not the only room like it. Other than that the room was comfortable very clean. I would go back again but with the hope that they have brought the rooms up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected!”
Reviews.Author: tiramisulover
Reviews.Content: I was a little skeptical about this hotel, however, the bed changed my mind. It was very comfortable. The shower, however didn't have any room whatsoever, but the bath tub had a shower attachment that was perfect. The suite was roomy, we had a king bed and a queen sofa bed, a refrigerator, and safe. We were on the 7th floor and it was really surprisingly quiet. The staff was nice, especially the bartender, Sergio. He made the effort to get us some fresh olives for our vodka, and he chatted with us as well. I liked the location. close to the subway at Herald Square and close to bus routes uptown on Madison. The cafe M, a couple of doors down, had great espresso and croissants! What more could you ask for? Oh yeah, Aveda products in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “shop till we drop holiday”
Reviews.Author: manutd186605
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location.....very friendly staff.....our 4th year in a row to stay in this hotel and wouldn't stay anywhere else in NYC.....staff could not do enough for you.....I would highly recommend this hotel....walking distance to Time Square and the wonderful Macy's and a visit to the Empire State Building is just around the corner.......rooms are spotless and beds are very comfortable

Reviews.Title: “family week break”
Reviews.Author: priscillaq
Reviews.Content: My family and I spent a week over the Christmas in a family room. The location of the hotel wa wonderful,evertthing within easy reach in a very safe surroundings. The rooms were very clean and the cleaning staff efficient and unobtrusive. The reception staff were very pleasant and helpful as indeed the porters and all other syaff encountered. Rooms really quiet and beds and duvets lovely and comfy. The complementary coffee facilities in the lobby were a nice touch and also two complementary computers for residents use also a bonus. We had breakfast one morning but used the nearby cafe the other mornings. Had drinks in the bar one night but thought it was expensive. Overall, a really enjoyable place to stay,my only negative comment would be that there was no kettle in the room which I would have liked but otherwise iron,hairdryer,tvs,fridges etc all worked perfectly. Would definately recommend and like to stay again when in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, good location, good size room for the price”
Reviews.Author: shelley636
Reviews.Content: As I speak we still have a couple of nights left at this hotel, booked in for 7 days, but have to leave early for an unforeseen event. I spoke to the front staff regarding the problem, very helpful and polite. The space you get for the price in NYC is very good, we are staying in a junior suite with a seating area and a comfortable bed. I had to call maintenance for a small problem and he was with me within 5 mins. Minutes away from the Empire State and Times Square, very good location. Didn't eat at the hotel as next door is a couple of breakfast bars which are nice. I have visited New York a few times and this hotel is by far best value for money :-)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: CindyM2
Reviews.Content: My BFF and I stayed at the Vincci Avalon for a long weekend. She recommended it because she'd stayed there several years ago when it was under different management and was very impressed. We were both disappointed. She said the decor was dated and shabby compared to the classy, minimalist Asian decor she'd seen when she'd stayed there before. The mini fridge wasn't working when we checked in, they fixed that for us. However, there were so many other things wrong we didn't even bother to mention them: the thermostat was stuck at 75 degrees F (we had to open a window in December) and we were both drenched in sweat when we woke up in the mornings. the TV in the bedroom didn't work at all; the cable on the sitting room TV didn't have sound for most of the channels; they never gave us face cloths for the bathroom; the chamber maid interrupted us even though we'd put the "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. My friend insisted on leaving a tip for the maids. Personally, I don't think they deserved it. I wouldn't stay there again. I paid over $1700.00 for three nights in a deluxe queen suite (two beds) and it wasn't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Num_Tee
Reviews.Content: Top location for exploring Manhattan. We walked to Times Square within minutes and we were never far from a subway station to take us further. The staff were friendly and the breakfast set us up every day with plenty of energy. The bathroom was a little tired but the rest of the room was ok even if the view out the back of the hotel was uninspiring. As somewhere to put our heads down while seeing the sights this hotel was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, strange food”
Reviews.Author: joan j
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located within walking distance of Penn Station, had a stunning lobby and friendly staff. The room was big (with a lovely, usable tub) and a view of the Empire State Building. It was quiet and the heating was perfect, even though the outside temp changed at least 20 degrees during our stay. I would highly recommend the hotel. The restaurant, where we ordered breakfast, was not good. The service was friendly but very incompetent and the food was so-so, at best. For some reason, they served a hotdog and french fries (NOT roasted potatoes) with our eggs benedict. Perhaps it was the wiener that made them think they could charge $15 for a truly sub-par breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice people but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: rs1127
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a king room, and when we arrived requested an upgrade. The upgrade was a down grade to 2 double beds. The decor of the room was dated, the bathtub filled with water while we showered and the water ran weakly. The view was to the back of old dilapidated buildings. It was overly hot in the room, we tried to turn off the heat and open the windows but odors from a chinese restaurant below wafted into the room. And there was a big square column right between the two beds which made getting in and out of it difficult. For almost $400 a night, this was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Loaded with Character and Romantic European Charm”
Reviews.Author: USAPascual
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is wonderful! What a break from the Hyatts, and JW Marriotts, (the latter had always been my favorite.) This boutique hotel was nothing short of charming. The staff, was wonderful, attentive, and catering. Was offered a complimentary upgrade to a junior suite upon checking in. Hotel had a wonderful Mediterranean Bar and restaurant within it. The bartender graciously uncorked a bottle of wine for me (that I had bought elsewhere for my room), and then insisted I take a wine glass upstairs to my room, so I could drink it civilized. The lobby was gorgeous, with a wonderful, quaint sitting area, inviting one to visit, and or just read. The room, was fabulous, extremely clean, and charming. Huge for Manhattan! The bathroom was all marble, his and her sinks, separate tub and shower stall, (great shower!) Hard wood floors, and wonderful bed. I wish I could have stayed longer. Location is fabulous, walking distance from Grand Central, Hotel is right off Madison Avenue (between Park and 5th.) Thanks to all at the Vincci Avalon for my wonderful break!!! Can't wait to go back!! Muchisimas Gracias!

Reviews.Title: “Noisy and hot”
Reviews.Author: eguy949
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel, and everyone was very friendly. It is also in a very good location - around the corner from the Empire State Building and near subway stops. However, we were on the 5th floor, which was not high enough to get away from the constant noise of the street. The room was also too hot, and we could not turn the temperature down enough. We did not sleep well for the 2 nights we were there. We asked to change rooms, but told there was nothing else - it was a busy weekend - but I wouldn't stay here again. I paid a lot of money to get no sleep!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but lacking in some areas”
Reviews.Author: Victoria M
Reviews.Content: Good Points: I do agree that this Hotel has a great location. You are walking distance from Broadway shows and lots of places to shop nearby. Train stations close by as well. There area also many great places to dine nearby (especially in the Korean strip). Nice Cuban food (Tina's) near by and many delis, Pizza, the usual. The hotel is also pretty unique in it's style but I did see some wear an tear on the bed skirt and bathroom fixtures. Overall, though, very nice. Really comfortable bed. I like that you are near the hustle and bustle and yet, on a street where you are somewhat removed. Bad Points: I agree w/ some of the comments below. Service was average at best. I asked for a wake up call and didn't get it. I asked for an iron (the one in the room was not working) it was never delivered. They did help out with train directions though but I wouldn't say they were over the top friendly. Big Pet Peeve with me... No coffee maker in the room! What? That is the first time I have experienced that and I travel a lot. They claim to have a coffee bar next to the computer room but they only have it available from 11am - 10pm. I would think having it first thing in the morning would make more sense. They told me I could purchase coffee from the restaurant? What? Very strange. Pretty big turn off for me. Also, you cannot control the temperature from your room. It was really hot in our room. It wasn't typical NY Weather but the heater kept pumping anyway. I had to keep my window open so we wouldn't sweat too much at night. It was nice to try but I think we will be trying other places next time. I still can't get over the "no coffee" in the rooms or downstairs bit. Very strange.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room, but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: ARL2601
Reviews.Content: A 10min walk to Penn Station, a 5 minute walk to 4-5-6 trains. Safe neighborhood. Lobby is beautiful, hotel has lots of character and is definitely not a boring old beige chain hotel. But it is on the older side and our room showed some wear and tear. Scuff marks on all the floorboards, chips on all the furniture, etc. A bit of mold in the very corner of the shower ceiling, but not enough to bother us. Toiletry bottles were a bit dirty. Otherwise pretty clean, beds and pillows comfy, lots of room in the suites. Hairdryer sucked. View is not much to speak of (but what is in Manhattan unless you pay mucho $$$) and the windows were pretty drafty with noticeable temp difference on that side of the room. Service was hit or miss, with some desk staff being good and others finishing their gossip conversations before helping you. A couple computers with free internet 24-7 in the lobby. Overall, I would stay here again, but it's not my favorite.

Reviews.Title: “BEST IN MANHATTAN”
Reviews.Author: mang0es
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at the Vincci Avalon hotel for the past 9 years, every time we go that's where we stay. The hotel is located in an amazing part of NYC, close to everything, walking, cabs and subways. The rooms are large, bathrooms great,.clean and the beds comfy as can be. The service is great, the staff know us now so they are always welcoming and friendly, especially Carolina, last time I was there I got a bout of food poisoning from some bad sushi I ate outside, and she got me into a cab and to a doctor right away. Thats something great especially in Manhattan. so i will always stay there, as long as I can!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room - really central”
Reviews.Author: VooDooTravelPro
Reviews.Content: beautifully appointed room - large and comfy. Excellent central location midtown. Good front desk staff. Plenty of good value restaurants nearby and plenty of nicer restaurants for client meetings or night out also nearby. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Family hotel”
Reviews.Author: matilde47
Reviews.Content: The vincci Avalon Hotel in New York is a very good hotel: clean, quiet, confortable and reformed. It has two things very important: 1.- It is very good situated, It´s possible to go walking to somewhere in Manhattan 2.- The personal is wonderfull: Jasmine, Javier and Winston always want to help you. Also they speak Spanish. This personal make the hotel excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location. friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: itsssssmeeeeeeeeeee
Reviews.Content: Went for 4 days travelling from England. Cant fault the Hotel lovely clean rooms and the beds were so comfortable!! Bar/Restaurant staff were great very helpful, all staff friendly. And location perfect in the centre of everything. Will be going back next year and will definitely stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Nice but !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Stevec418
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend ..... The rooms were nice and clean... the bar and restaurant are ok also .. .Its a really good location. We found that the front desk and management were not as helpful as they could of or should have been. They weren’t nasty, they were just aloof didn’t seem to go the extra effort as we have experienced in other Manhattan hotels. There are so many other hotels in the city next time I would rather just try another one….

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: GerryScotland49
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night at the beginning of November and was really impressed by this almost boutique setting. Got upgraded on arrival and the size of the room was very large and the bathroom included a jacuzzi bath which was great to relax in after a hard day sightseeing in New York and all the walking. The staff were excellent and very helpful whatever we asked for or needed. I would have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: jimmy61Madrid
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well located, just aside 5th ave, very near to 34st where all the shopping can be made, and equal distance to downtown and uptown. Having said that, rooms are bit old, need refurbishing, particularly the bathroom. At least, there is no dirty old carpet in the room, as typical in NY. Breakfast is very good, by the way, and spaniards are well treated, as this is a spanish hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Vincci Avalon exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: merylemishkin
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights in a Junior Suite. I am a native New Yorker, so wasn't expecting a lot. The room was very clean, extremely large by New York standards. The staff was very helpful. There is a restaurant downstairs. Anything we asked for was brought instantly. HUGE bathroom. We paid $275 per night which is a bargain in Manhattan in such a great location. The bedding was excellent, and I am picky. Very comfortable bed. Awesome location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice!”
Reviews.Author: so_simple_2000
Reviews.Content: We visited New York for the first time for our honey-trip and we stayed at the hotel for 7 nights. Without asking for it, they gave us an upgrade and we got a better room than the one we had paid for. The room was really big and the amenities it offered were just perfect! Each little problem that may occured during our stay, was fixed immediately after we told the reception. Also the position of the hotel is great for visiting the main sightseeings of the city. In general, it was a great choice!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dinkG
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience at the hotel. The hotel is centrally located and close to a main Subway line. Our room was very nice and clean, lots of windows that provided plenty of light, very comfy beds and was spacious. There were three adults and an infant, the hotel brought up a crib and it fit nicely in the room as well. The hotel staff were friendly after the first day, they seemed to need some warming up to you. When we arrived the bell man didn't come out to help with our luggage but watched from inside and we had to ask them twice to send up the crib. After that day, all the staff were excellent to work with, friendly and helpful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “we loved it !”
Reviews.Author: Roland D
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the hotel from 29. of july for 4 days. we had a complementary upgrade to a suite and it was beautiful even we discovered manhatten and didn´t even spend to much time in the rooms. we definatly come back when we visit nyc.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint European Elegance”
Reviews.Author: VFan2z
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel for the amazing price of $418 + tax for 2 nights in a junior suite. Well worth the excellent cost. The hotel is between 5th and 6th Ave, on 32nd street. Noise level was pretty low - we were on the 11th floor and I'm a light sleeper. The bed was comfortable, the floors absolutely gleamed, and the marble bathroom was beautiful. Front desk was very pleasant and well-managed. The room had very subtle decor and was nicely-appointed with crown moulding and heavy doors. The only noticeable flaw were the towels; a little thin and not very many - and no robes. No paper delivered to the door, but that wasn't a deal breaker. I'd come back again - very nice place! Also convenient to public transportation.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: JUAN G
Reviews.Content: It's very well placed. Rooms are bigger than in other hotels in NY. Staff are efficient and friendly. So helpful! Specially Jasmine, who provided us a lot of useful information. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Two Doubles! Great Price...”
Reviews.Author: FortMacLoves2Travel
Reviews.Content: As alot of people know and some are about to find out....finding a hotel with two doubles in NYC can be a little difficult. That was one of the biggest reasons we chose this hotel and it was a great choice. The beds were comfy and the room was quite large for NYC. It had a nice little sitting area with a couch. We found the room to be clean and very quiet. The people were friendly and helpful. The only issue we had was a very minor one and became almost comical.......they didn't seem to have enough facecloths and we had to constantly ask for them and they were given out one at a time. We really liked the location as it was close to lots of attractions without being in an extremely busy spot. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Suesuesayshi
Reviews.Content: Stayed here many times in the city.Rooms are cozy,clean and modern. Definitely a good staff,location and not over crowed or noisy..

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location, Good Price, Large Room”
Reviews.Author: WeBDivin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights in July 2011. This hotel is in a great location between 5th & Madison on 32nd street. Just a few blocks from Penn Station and the subway. the Empire State Building is just 5 minutes away. The rooms are also very large for the price. They are a little tired around the edges..but so what! I have to laugh at the close up pictures of furniture with scratches, etc. If that bothers you..you need to go uptown for a room that's half the size and twice the price.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and good Location”
Reviews.Author: kp72
Reviews.Content: Very good location. 5th avenue, Macys etc and + bus station to the Woodbury Mall is just steps away. Good breakfast, friendly staff . We got winter special promotion rate Jan. 2011. We'll visit again...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: KevinMKelly
Reviews.Content: I just completed a business trip to New York City and stayed at the Hotel Vincci Avalon for the first time. The hotel has everything you would expect (like clean and spacious rooms) and the staff has an eye for the details that make things easier for the traveler. The most memorable experience actually occurred after I had checked out. In the security line at the airport, I realized that my iPad was still in the hotel room. After speaking with the front desk, I was put in touch with the front desk manager, Aylin Gonzalez, who was wonderful. After the initial search for the iPad was not successful, she reviewed the room unlock/lock activity and spoke to the housekeeping staff members that had been in the room. By taking that extra step, she found the unit and was able to send it back to me. I am glad she didn't stop after the initial room review! Three cheers for Aylin Gonzalez and the staff at Vincci Avalon! I will stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and so central”
Reviews.Author: sokriw
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stay at this hotel and also the second time I feel safe with the fact that every time I return to the room it will be clean. Plus points for the linoleum flooring; really hate the disgusting wall-to-wall-carpets at many hotels in NYC. No problems at check-in or check-out. Last time I stayed we had asked for separate beds which we got, this time around we didn’t so the room was a bit smaller, but still airy. There was an extra refrigerator in the room which you could use for e.g. keeping your drinks cold. One negative is that the bathroom didn’t have any shelves besides the one on top of the sink which was really small and crooked so there’s no place to put the toilet bag and necessities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and large rooms”
Reviews.Author: GANJJ
Reviews.Content: We booked a junior suite which was approx £900 for 4 nights in May. Not cheap but then it seems not many hotels in central New York are! The room was very spacious indeed, had 2 TVs, 2 double beds, fridge and separate minibar, setee, desk and not much of a view. Despite not having much of a view it meant that the room was quiet (we were on the 6th floor). Bathroom was very large, with 2 sinks, with separate bath and shower. Hotel also had free wifi. Reception desk staff were friendly enough although they did claim that we had breakfast when we did not (they had to verify receipts to confirm that I was not lying). This did aggrieve me a little but their general demeanour and approachfulness was fine. We did not have breakfast at the hotel ($20 each) as there are so many places to get breakfast at a fraction of the price. We did have some drinks in the bar/restaurant and the staff and manager were very nice and gave us free chips (it's not often you get something for free in NYC!). Checking in only took a couple of mins and the guy in front of us got a free upgrade. You could chance getting a free upgrade but as the price difference was only about £60 over 4 nights (in total), I would ensure that you get a nice junior suite.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for price”
Reviews.Author: sydcarnie
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 9 nights recently. The check in was smooth and the staff on the front desk were polite and always able to help if you had questions about booking tours or anything. They spoke English and Spanish (this is a Spanish hotel chain). The room we were allocated was very roomie and had two queen beds (very comfortable), a lounge area (with pull out sofa bed). The bathroom was very large also. There was good hanging space in the cupboards and ample mirrors in the room which was a hit when we were getting dressed to head out. There was free wi-fi in the rooms and two public computers available in the library with free internet. There was also a restauarnt attached although we did not use it at all. The only negative comment I have was the room was extremely hot and we couldn't adjust the temperature. We were told it was because the room was set for the colder weather. We were able to open a window and the temperature was fixed on the final day. Location was good for first time NYers. I had been a few times and generally prefer lower Manhattan, however this hotel was far enough away from the hassles of Times Square, but still close enough to other attractions in midtown. Would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: SwissMagnolia
Reviews.Content: We travel to NYC once to twice a year, both with and without our young children and I have to say I would stay here again in a heartbeat! The staff, including both bellmen, front desk staff and even the general staff at the hotel, were friendly and helpful every step of the way. They made the kids feel at home (Eloise at the The Plaza never had such a wonderful stay as my kids did at the Vincci) and, obviously, we felt at home. Everything is within walking distance including a wonderful little ¨french patisserie¨ a half block down called ¨Cafe M¨ with amazing Cafe Latte and Pain au Chocolat. This trip was the best we have ever had in NYC and it is due in large part to the hotel and the staff! Oh, and the rooms ARE amazing - larger than most we have ever stayed and with continental charm.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Hotel for Shopping”
Reviews.Author: Mary G
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights in March in the Executive Jacuzzi Suite which was huge. We needed this space as our little man of 7 months does not travel light! The bed was enormous and the biggest I have ever stayed in. It was also extremely comfortable. It was lovely to have the little sitting room so we could watch TV ourselves in the evening while he slept. This hotel is just off 5th Avenue and is the perfect location for shopping. For the size of the room and it's location I would consider this hotel to be excellent value for money. Free internet access in the library was also a great perk. I would definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel with certain issues”
Reviews.Author: fabulous58
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my 5 night stay at this well located hotel. Very comfortable beds and suite reasonably large.Lack of tea and coffee maker in room is a big deal for me and lack of fasteningmoving floor boards annoying to walk on. Staff very friendly which is appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice boutiqe hotel with the largest rooms in NYC”
Reviews.Author: njfunguy
Reviews.Content: At first glance the Avalon might seem a bit dated, but somewhere along your stay you will soon realize that it is cultural historic gem that will make you feel like you're a true native New Yorker or that you just stepped into in a Woody Allen Movie. Many boutique hotels in NYC (as well as regular hotels) are quite old and really only a rare few will possess that old-world tacky charm that just makes you feel like you're a piece of the history. The Avalon truly delivers on this cultural aspect. Many hotels in NYC are on the borderline of being dated and broken down so choosing one can be a daunting task. The Avalon has some of the largest rooms in all of NYC (mine was 475 square feet with a separate office) It was again a bit "old world" but it has that special charm, was very clean and comfortable and is by far the best value I have ever found in all of NYC. If you want a 5 star gem hotel at $500 a night or more then the Avalon is not for you but if you want a very spacious room and an old world feeling at around $200, then do not look elsewhere. The area is unique as well with little Korea just a block away. You can get to midtown or the village (downtown) in a short 5 to 10 minute cab ride. I would stay here again "in a New York Minute"!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Only minor points to complaints about.”
Reviews.Author: naffyGB
Reviews.Content: It is rare that the hotel interior and room photos match what they look like in real life. In this case we were expecting to be let down and were almost speechless at the size and finish of the hotel and room. Minor points: Room: A/C was very loud. Also difficult to regulate the temperature. The room was too hot most of the time and we visited NYC in the middle of the freezing snow storms. The heat in the room affected sleep quality. Shower was a little weak but we both have short hair so not too much of a problem. Sleep quality: The beds were soooo good we nearly spent more time in bed than walking in the city! However, AC issues affected sleep quality. Value: The buffet breakfast seems a little overpriced especially when you will never have more than one round. The hotel advertises a private car service to the airport for $70 not including toll ($6.50) and 20% gratuity guide (which you may as well add anyway! $14). This means that a ride to the airport works out at $90.50! If you ring Carmel Cars --- the flat rate is $48 before toll and 20% gratuity. They have been about since 1978 and are reliable. All in all, you can't get a better hotel in a better part of town with better doormen (this particular service made the stay all the more enjoyable)!

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: Terry2727
Reviews.Content: Really good hotel in brilliant location , could not do more for you. Definately would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Leogursky
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Vincci Avalon for a week in January and it was just perfect and offered fantastic valve for money. The junior suite was roomy clean and comfortable. The room was quiet and modern with a big comfortable bed. Excellent location and great staff particularly Carolina on the reception who looked after some property I left behind and helped make sure I got it back. Very fond memories of this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: TAnewcomer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has really spacious rooms, at least the one we stayed in. It had 2 queen size beds, a sofa, desk, chair and a marble bathroom. I was really impressed because most of the New York City hotels are small. It was convenient to everything. You can walk from Penn Station to the hotel and there are subways nearby. The room was spotless. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: tigerhawke
Reviews.Content: I found the Vincci Avalon on the internet and what a find! Greeted by very friendly hotel staff, i received a complimentary upgrade and spent 4 nights in a beautiful room! Spacious, quiet, clean, and an extremely comfortable bed. The hotel is in a perfect location, 5th Ave for loads of shopping, close to Empire State building, restaurants, and Times Square is about a 10min walk. I went for a few days R&R and that's exactly what the hotel provided, I will stay there again next time!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: AmsterdamNL
Reviews.Content: We got a very warm welcome at the Avalon. We entered the hotel and the entrance looked wonderful and we were kindly greated by the door man who took our bags to our room. When checking in we were giving an upgrade. Instead of double queen, we got a deluxed suite with a living room. We had two flatscreens in our room, two sinks and a bath and shower. Carolina of the front desk thanks for that!! We loved it! The beds were really nice too and the free wifi is a plus. The hotel is right around the corner of The Empire State Building, close to Macy's, Victoria Secret, Sephora, Lord & Taylor and many other great stores to shop. Great places tot eat: Chipotle (Mexican fast but fresh food, great part is organic on corner 34th street/ 5th avenue), have your breakfast at the great staff of Starbucks on 33nd/ 5th avenue. This staff of this Starbucks really makes you enjoy your stay even more. They are enthousiastic about running their store and are so friendly. The subway (Herald Square) is also nearby which connects you to the entire city. Thanks Vincci Avalon for a wonderful time. We are looking forward to staying with you again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful birthday stay”
Reviews.Author: Dravid2
Reviews.Content: We actually went in Jan 2010 to celebrate my 50th birthday. From the moment we arrived we were more tham madde to feel welcome. Check-in was so quick and efficient. The room itself was very spacious with all that was needed and maintained and cleaned well throughout our stay. The safe in the wardrobe was a real bonus. Plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for all our clothes. With there being 2 TVs no arguments of what to watch. The facilities in the bathroom very adequate. With free access to the Internet a further bonus. The hotel is literaly yards from 5th Avenue with easy access to the Empire State Building and all other attractions. For breakfast we opted to eat out and ate every day at the Oxford Cafe on 5th Avenue between 35th and 36th streets. The food and service wer great and highly recommended. Getting around is each individuals choice though we tended either to use the metro or walk. A visit to the Statue of Liberty and Ellis Islandis also recommended though if visiting the crown be prepared for a long climb up the steps.We took in a show on Broadway - Phantom of the Opera and of course up the Empire State. For all these we booked in advance on various websited so no problems with having to queue or be disappointed. Transfers to and from JFK we booked the Airport Shuttle Service and again used the Internet in advance. All in all a wonderful week.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location with comfy beds!”
Reviews.Author: nicolac34
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Vincci Avalon after staying 5 nights with a goup of 8 of us. The hotel met our requests for rooms (2 doubles & 2 twins) and we were able to check in early which was very helpful. The rooms were nice and large, we had a sitting area and spacious bathroom. Unlike previous reviewers we didn't have any major issues so didn't have to call on the staff at all - we had lovely hot water for the whole stay! The bed was the highlight, both mattress and pillows were very comfortable and we slept very well. The Location is really good, right next to the Empire State building and within 5/10 minutes walk of all the subway stations and lines you'll need. Free Wifi in all the rooms - a must for us! My only minor gripe was that the cleaners took away a Ugg box that was not rubbish, (and something I was planning on taking home with me) and was no where near the bin and with all my other shopping. They took this yet left empty cartons and wrappers that were clearly rubbish. I asked front desk for it to be returned but no-one ever got back to me. Like I say, minor, but it still irked me!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible...”
Reviews.Author: kdutkiew
Reviews.Content: Had a recent much anticipated trip with family to NYC. Arrived at the hotel and they kindly checked our bag, told us the room wasn't quite ready. When other family members returned later after check in time they were informed that for some sketchy reason we had all been moved to a different hotel, which was terrible by the way, without warning, phone call etc. They were not at all friendly or apologetic about it until we pushed the issue the following day. Nothing comped. As stated, alternate accomodations were dissappointing. Overall created much unwanted tension during our trip. Will never recommend or return.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!! Exceeded all expectations!!! Can't wait to stay there again!”
Reviews.Author: SlimHawks
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took a "girls trip" to celebrate winning our cancer battles. We searched through an unbelievable number of hotels before deciding on the Vincci Avalon. We weren't sure what to expect. Pictures and reviews were good, but price was really reasonable so we figured there must be a catch. NOPE!!! This place was the BEST!!! By far the friendliest and most helpful staff I have ever come across. The hotel was charming and the rooms were HUGE!! And so was the bathroom. What a great surprise, especially in New York. Very clean (and thankfully quiet) rooms. Unbelievably comfortable beds. Very large flatscreen tv's (wall mounted) in front of each of our beds. Loved that. Ordered room service our first night ther and it was one of the best meals I have EVER had. Lovely view from our room. The location was perfect!!!!!!! Within walking distance or a short cab ride from everything. We also found the best cafe I've ever been to----Cafe M---just a few doors down. This cafe is a must see. Charming decor and amazing quiche, teas, coffees, baked goods, etc. We can't wait to go back to the city and stay at the Vincci Avalon again!!! Definately a hidden gem. Would recommend to ANYONE!

Reviews.Title: “In the area that suits what we want to do when in the city.”
Reviews.Author: Misskjb
Reviews.Content: On 32nd and 5 ave so close to empire stats & Macys. Subway on 34th. Large rooms with a sitting area. No kettle/coffee maker in room anymore but coffee available in the library. Wilson the door man very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing- old fashioned decor and ineffectual and rude staff.”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1560
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel following a recommendation, but it was unfortunately a let down from the very start. We had to wait for ages to check in, and when we did, found the check in staff to be facetious and pretty non plussed about the amount of time they had made us wait. The room was large but old fashioned, and a lot of the basics were wrong- hardly any coathangers, fridge/ minibar that wouldn't open, a safe that was locked shut, cold water in the shower and hardly any towels. For the amount that we were paying I expected these things at least to be right! It took 3 days to fix the water, and we found the staff throughout to be disingenuous and disinterested. It's a shame, as I had heard good things about this hotel and it is in a very good central location, but it just didn't live up to my expectations or to the price that they were charging.

Reviews.Title: “The little engine that did”
Reviews.Author: mackdriver
Reviews.Content: The most excellent hotel we've stayed at in the city , ever. The staff is beyond top shelf and the property is unrivaled.

Reviews.Title: “More than we expected”
Reviews.Author: Nandagasparini
Reviews.Content: The Vincce Avalon Hotel Is very well located, next to subway station and a lot of good stores. The room was quiet, clean and surprising big! It was really more than we expected. Next time in NYC, will stay there for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beat my Expectations”
Reviews.Author: AtlantaEd
Reviews.Content: I was given an upgrade - 2 double beds, with a sitting room. This was very nice sized room by most standards, and exceptional for Manhattan at this price level. The bathroom had a tub and a separate shower, excessive space, 2 sinks, and was very clean. If I could get this room at the rate I paid next time, I'll stay there again in a heartbeat. Minor issue - the magnifiying mirror had an issue with the hinge, and it wouldn't stay up so I could use it to put my contacts in. I told the front desk person at checkout, and it didn't seem that they were actually making a note of it or overly concerned - so I dinged them for service for that.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but lacked something”
Reviews.Author: Bigsm0ke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights wih my partner. The room was fine, had a quite luxurious feel to it, quite spacious and did the job very well, no complaints here. I dont think I spoke to or encountered any members of staff during our stay except during the check in/out process, the layout means you tend to come in the door and straight into the lift. We had 1 drink in the bar 1 night and we were the only 2 people there, which was slightly off putting. Hotels in a good location, however you do inevitably end up spending a fortune on taxis if you want to see all the tourist sights and walking your socks off, I believe this would be the case though no matter where you stayed in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant - luxury at value prices”
Reviews.Author: mightyshepherd
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. We were marooned without a place to stay, went to the Hotel Roger round the corner but they were full and the girl rang the VA as it was her favourite hotel. They had a room and what a room - it was palatial with two beds, two TVs and a bathroom with two sinks - for $199 plus taxes! The room had a view, free internet, comfy clean beds and so much space. The baby crib came on wheels so we could move it around and the breakfast the next day was excellent. The hotel is right by the Empire State and one of the best I've stayed in. VVVG

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: daffypuf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 3 nights this summer. The hotel is conveniently located, although not in a trendy area. The rooms are among the largest I've stayed in. I stayed under a summer promo and the value for the money was amazing. The staff was helpful. The only negative was that the first night, and a/c was not working correctly and it was freezing. The problem was fixed the next night.

Reviews.Title: “Exceedingly poor service”
Reviews.Author: Waynes1000
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Avalon, was a cancellation opportunity myself and my partner decided to take, as a gift for my birthday. We found the junior suite room to be very well laid out. The problem, we found was with the sanitary situation. For those who have not visited America before, it would be wise to remember that the toilets do not work as efficiently as in the UK. It would have been useful to have been made aware of this at the beginning of our stay, as the toilet blocked shortly after our arrival. We reported this to the reception, and were informed it would be dealt with, and left it at that. Unfortunately, it reoccurred again within two days, regardless of how careful we were. Again we reported it and on the second occasion, a maintenance man came to the room when we were there, and cleared the problem with what he described as a snake. He wore no gloves, and wiped or dripped on the towels in the bathroom, and across the floor, the whole way through the suite. He also touched handles we were to use, and the doors. He claimed the fist persons to deal with the problem had just used a plunger, and not done it right. (perhaps it is just me, but I didn't need that much detail) We reported this, and asked for the room to be cleaned carefully, and to speak to a manager. We were not contacted by a manager throughout our stay. On leaving the hotel, we were advised by the receptionist, that the Hotel would refund us $12, which was our mini bar bill. Although we had a couple of drinks in the bar coming to about $34,(four drinks) they could not offer this as a refund, as it was a separate company. For those of you who have not visited New York before, it is far from a cheap city, and Tips are an expected part of every bill. Up to 20% in some cases. Our taxi drivers were getting more of a tip than we were being offered for our inconvenience for a filthy suite, and having to use filthy public amenities. Some six weeks later, I am still awaiting the contact by the manager, that was promised by Eric the receptionist.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly disappointing hotel - staying here will ruin your trip”
Reviews.Author: TrickyHobby
Reviews.Content: Traveled with colleagues... and the experience was extremely disappointing. Promised a certain type of room when checking in at 10am; however, upon return in afternoon, room not available - all sold out. My party had to change rooms twice because of cleanliness issues (bad smells, smoking room, etc.). There are no blankets on the beds and the hotel told us they had no blankets for guests. No blankets? Seriously? Surly check-in staff who seem to have little to no regard for customer service. We're pretty low maintenance customers, but after the way we were treated at this hotel, I will NEVER return there again. On the plus side, the bell captains were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but So So Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chatkat_10
Reviews.Content: Proceed with caution if you are considering booking with this hotel. The Vincci Avalon is not as advertised. I was sharing a room with 3 friends and we are all on the same page with this rating. Our experience with the Vincci Hotel was very disappointing. I will start with the good. The location was very good. I could almost say that it was excellent. Located between 5th and Madison it was close and within walking distance to all kinds of landmarks. An excellent starting point to our discovery vacation. The room was quiet and the air conditioning worked well. The large bathroom was perfect for three women. The beds and bed linens were clean and comfortable. There were however no body pillows or bath robes as was advertised. And this is the start of the disappointments. The mattress of the bed chesterfield was not usable. Very warn and thin. You could definitely feel the springs. So if you are counting on using the bed chesterfield bring your own foamy. As two of us had to share a bed the additional charge for the 3rd person was not justified. The hotel is in desperate need of repair and updating. The furniture in the room and in the common areas was shabby. The drapes in the room were very worn, close to being tattered. The common areas were in desperate need of fresh paint and a really good cleaning. There were never enough towels left by housekeeping. We had to call every day for additional bath towels, hand towels and face cloths. There were not enough hangers for a group of people. Thank goodness we had brought our own. Once again the additional charge for the 3rd person was not justified. And for you morning coffee lovers beware. The complimentary coffee and pastries were definitely not as advertised. The story on the coffee differed every day. Some staff said that coffee was available from 6:00 am to 7:00 am. Some staff said that coffee was available from 7:00 am to 7:30 am and then from 11:00 am to 11:30. I only found coffee available one day out five. Fortunately there were coffee shops close by. And complimentary pastries? Non existent. The bottom line is proceed with caution when making your decision. For this group it was definitely not very good value for our dollar. We would not stay at the Vincci Avalon again. All in all the Vincci Avalon Hotel in New York was a big disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't warrant the relatively positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: MeredithChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: I wouldn't go back to the Vincci Avalon. It definitely has a European feel, and I'm sure that if it were in Brussels or Madrid or someplace like that I might actually be pleased with the Vincci. On the plus side, my room was large-ish, and the lobby was charming, if a bit scuffed-up. My bathroom was also big, and included lots of nice marble. Two big flat-screens and free wi-fi, always a plus. And of course the location is fine. But things were just a little funky/off. On closer inspection, the clear grout/caulk in the bathroom was layered over black mildew. A couple of the lamps weren't working, and the guide to the TV didn't sync up with the actual TV channels. The thing that really creeped me out, though, was the laminate flooring in my room. No rugs, no carpet--just sad, saggy Pergo-type material. I'm really surprised no one else has mentioned this as a drawback, or perhaps I have a particular phobia about bare plastic floors. But it really made me not like the room; it was loud and I felt I needed to have socks or shoes on at all times! (Technically, it may well be cleaner than carpet, but it really detracted from the comfort level of the room.) The Vincci needs to invest in carpet or at least some rugs to be charging $300/night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, location and quiet spacious clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: cbabeCapeTown
Reviews.Content: Vincci Avalon was a well located, clean, efficient hotel. The rooms are much bigger than where I have stayed previously in NYC. It was quiet at night too. The hotel does not have their own restaurant but one that but one is internally connected via the hotel lobby. They offer a buffet breakfast there. We did not eat there as we preferred to go out to other nearby locations in the morning. The staff were great and very helpful. I would recommend to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutque hotel in awesome location”
Reviews.Author: jordnegert
Reviews.Content: My friend and I came up here for Electric Zoo for three nights. I can't begin to rave enough about the hotel; the service was warm and inviting (the front desk staff were fairly attractive too). As we walked in we were immediately greeted by the bag/coat check and the front desk staff. I requested prior to our visit 'the best room they had',. I had originally booked the double queen suite, and they then offered to upgrade me free to a penthouse king bed suite. The suite was incredible! The bathroom was half the size of the 550sq ft room, but I unfortunately had another traveler that prohibited me from taking it. So we went to our originally assigned room (#307) and were still wowed. The place was extremely clen and the bathroom was a nice touch (marble everywhere). A few things I notedd that didn't hinder our stay to much: 1. The sheets were amazing but the comforter was not warm/thick at all, seemed to be more of a shall type of deal 2. The bathroom shower was clear glass, which sucked when three guys were trying to get ready (we really weren't keen on seeing each-others junk). Also I don't think there was a shower head (or if there was it spurted out and looked like the end of just the pipe). There was still hot water abundant. 3. The wall mounted LCD were awesome, but there were a cluster of cables running beneath it on the floor. 4. No room service and the wifi is VERY weak We didn't cehck out the Spa that was included with our stay, so no comments there. The location was perfect; just far enough from the touristy sections but not far enough to be in the middle of no where. Lots of EXCELLENT restaurants nearby, and if yo uwant a late night munchy, Papaya Dog is 100ft from the front door. Overall, our stay was great. I will definately be staying here again and look forward to it on my next trip!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: jhi1960
Reviews.Content: From the very onset we had a great time, ALL staff are excellent and very friendly and helpful, nothing felt like too much trouble. Position of Hotel is second to none and the local bus service right outside the hotel made getting around Manhattan so easy, especially in the heat!!! Rooms are fab, not noisy, nice and cool and loads of space even though we were not in it that much, great places to eat near by. All in all I would stay here every time. Thanks Avalon for a great holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but too Noisy with sleepless nights”
Reviews.Author: Aisling2006
Reviews.Content: I had read all the reviews which were great and this is why I chose this hotel. My welcome upon arrival to the hotel was non existant, the hotel receptionist, Ester was unfriendly and didnt seem interested we had arrived. She asked if I had my documents of the booking so that she could find it and this caused a whole lot of confusion. A guest should never be asked to present documentation of their booking,i explained to her that she should have the details, not me and then she had a bit of an attitude. What a lovely introduction to the hotel..... Rooms were lovely, showers arnt great but they suffice! I wouldnt rate the hotel a 4 star, more of a high 3 star.... Some of our nights were sleepless due to noisy traffic outside and crazy guests partying in the hotel room next to us on 1 night. We complained and they moved us the next day which was great, and when i phoned down to complain about the guests who were partying, the security and receptionist were very prompt in dealing with my complaint effectively, they went straight up and addressed the situation and all the partying stopped. Location is excellent however it is too noisy at nights as the traffic is crazy, i would not stay again because of the noise and also because i didnt feel that the customer service was good. Breakfast is ridiculously priced at $19.95 dollars, who would pay that???? Im all for customer service and i was dissapointed that i didnt have a nice greeting etc... when i arrived. On a positive note, The consierge Curtis was lovely and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: Barbados_addict
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Vincci Avalon for 3 nights in August 2010. The hotel is in a great location sandwiched between 5th and Madison Avenue on 32nd Street (two blocks from Empire State). The room was a good size for Manhattan, but not as big as some of my colleagues in the same hotel! I did feel that the room was a little dated, but was perfectly acceptable for three nights. I only ate at the hotel once - for breakfast. The breakfast was good and as expected, although overpriced in my opinion. Overall I would recommend this hotel to a friend/colleague but would make sure they understand the pro's and con's of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not Recommended”
Reviews.Author: jpinqatar
Reviews.Content: Room was great, staff were not helpful. Hotel is in nice location near Empire State Bldng. When we checked out, we asked for a taxi to take us (wife and 2 small kids) to JFK, the front desk staff told us they could not call us a cab but we could utilize the hotel transport, which turned out to be 3 times the cost. There were also NO staff to help with our bags once we did manage to get a taxi for ourselves. Will not stay here again and will make sure to tell the same to anyone else travelling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “stylish oasis”
Reviews.Author: VXM
Reviews.Content: Having a delayed flight from Australia and arriving late at night at the Hotel Vincci Avalon, we were quickly directed to our spacious suite. With an enormous bathroom, large entry foyer and lounge area, we had clearly been upgraded. In the middle of an incredibly buzzy part of town, little Korea, the suite was a comfortable and calm oasis. We chose the location as it was close to Penn Station, but if we'd had more time there, we would have enjoyed the proximity to the Empire State building, Macy's etc.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but only with a shortcoming”
Reviews.Author: luisps12
Reviews.Content: This hotel is excellent in all senses, but I had a one problem that made me feel very uncomfortable. The problem was that I booked a Suite Junior in my last travel (July 28-30) because I was traveling with my 16 years old son and we wanted to sleep in different beds, but the hotel gave us a single room very small and with one bed. Of course that was not a Suite Junior, that it was for I was paid for. The following day the hotel gave us at last a Suite Junior, but we had to suffer a very uncomfortable night, with my son sleeping on the floor over a blanket.

Reviews.Title: “comfortable and very good price-value”
Reviews.Author: mario150800
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended , very comfortable and spacious rooms. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “A lot of room in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Idontwannagohome
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, well appointed room, huge by New York or European standards. Friendly staff, very patient with me when I went into shock over city taxes on my bill. Some great restaurants nearby, La Halle ( Anthony Bourdain used to work here, try the duck! ) and a fantastic Thai place. Night life, if your looking for it, is non excistant in this area. Was a good thing for peace and quite but forget it if you want a late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: sawk2208
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location was ideal - not in the really busy Times Square, but only a few (safe) minutes walk away. The Empire State Building was only a couple of blocks away. Room size was very good, but the decor was a little tired - but it wouldn't put me off staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Frendly, nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Michal32
Reviews.Content: Let’s start with pluses: very good located, Empire SB in 3 min. walk, Time Square in 15min. If you like Korean food you will be happy to know that “Little Korea” is just 3 min. away. Staff was very friendly, with great sense of humor, so you feel here really welcome. We had a double room, the bed was comfy. Room was rather small– but for New York hotel we didn’t expect bigger one. It was clean, so was the bathroom. Free WIFI was working almost all the time properly. Now minuses: A/C very noisy – one night I turned it off because the noise disturbed my sleep – then in the morning temp was about 80F – for us still ok. Breakfast is not included and if you want one, hotel will charge 20USD for it. In my opinion too expensive – there is plenty of bars and rest. around. I definitely recommend this hotel and would come back during next visit to NY.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and value for midtown”
Reviews.Author: AKP4
Reviews.Content: Super friendly and helpful staff, lovely room and amazing location--walked to great restaurants every night but were also close to the subway. Felt like we couldn't have picked a better place even if we spent twice as much.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: Lonecypress
Reviews.Content: Our room size was acceptable for 2 adults. The service at the front desk was very good. The location it was accessible and central to our needs.

Reviews.Title: “Leisure in New York !!!”
Reviews.Author: meenaMumbai
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel for it's midtown Manhattan location ! It was close to Times Square as well as fabulous shopping places like Macy's , Gap, Forever 21 etc.... Since this trip of ours was sheer indulgence in shopping and eating so it suited us well! It was leisure all the way! Though New York and Leisure do not go together....this hotel made it possible for us!

Reviews.Title: “Location and style”
Reviews.Author: TravelBabeChester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is set in Little Korea and is just off Fifth and Madison. A fanatastic location within walking distance of many of the sights and a subway at the end of the block. Empire State is just around the corner and we had coffee in there several times. The hotel room was just like the photos so no surprizes. We were on the 10th floor. The doorman was very helpful and friendly. As were the desk staff. They have a new restaurnat opening shortly which looks good. Plenty of choice to eat in this lively area of NYC. No grand public rooms but free Wi Fi. One of the best tourist places was Top of the Rock. Great views on the same level as Empire State. Best department store Lloyd & Taylor on 5th all the major fashion brands with wonderful service. Best avoided Bergdorfs.

Reviews.Title: “great value, perfect staying and service, recommended!!”
Reviews.Author: ilgianlu
Reviews.Content: I've been at the Hotel for 1 week in the suite room and everything was perfect. I was at 12 floor and I didn't hear any traffic noise. Room was very clean and comfortable, and comparing to the NYC standard very very big...I recommend this hotel also for perfect position, near madison avenueand 5th. Have a nice stay here!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful accommodations”
Reviews.Author: t4drman
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel with friendly staff and generously sized rooms. Everything was exquisite inside the room as well as in the lobby of this fine establishment. You will not ever be disappointed with a stay at this beautiful hotel in the heart of midtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Most friendly and lovely people working there, I've never found in a hotel”
Reviews.Author: mendozasr
Reviews.Content: Not only the most proffesional staff you can find in a hotel, they are continuous worried about your happinest in your stay in the hotel. Service, help, friendly... simply the best.
