I am a salesman sleeping in hotels more than 90 night per year in the last 23 years. This has been the best one in all of those years. Thanks to all of you and congratulation. I feel like at home, not like in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel option in Midtown”
Reviews.Author: travlinf00l
Reviews.Content: The Vincci Avalon is a great hotel just around the corner from the Empire State Building. It is in "Korea Town" - a small strip of 32nd street that features Korean and other Asian Restaurants and shops. Overall I rate this hotel very high for value and comfort. My room was very large and quiet and featured 2 flat panel HDTVs. As with most hotels, only a few channels were available in HD. The room had both wired and wireless high speed internet access, and while not the fastest connection I've seen it was fine for normal, business purposes. The bed was very comfortable, and the room had an ok mini-bar (although I didn't open it). My only complaint about the room is that the bathroom was a bit dated and poorly laid out. The shower was tiny and had no shelf/seating area inside. The hotel does not have its own fitness center but guests can work out at the Equinox around the corner free. Normally I eat breakfast at the hotel, but I did not do so at the Avalon because 1. They want $20 for a buffet breakfast which is outrageous, and 2. there are dozens of breakfast options within 2 blocks of the hotel. The front desk staff was excellent (I saw them patiently answering many questions from guests and walk ins alike) but the doormen/bell staff was useless. I saw them wandering around the lobby but they did not offer to help anyone with the door, bags, directions, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Quality all the way”
Reviews.Author: NorwegianKebler
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, great location and wonderful staff. Huge rooms, not just for New York standards, but compared to anywhere! The breakfast buffet is European style with A LOT to choose from, but the price ($19.95 per person) is a little steep. With all the great diners in New York, save the money.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel”
Reviews.Author: ranam
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days at the Avalon and were on the whole very satisfied with this hotel, specialy the location and the junior suite we had. The staff was friendly and helpful. The only issue we encountered is the reliability of the wake up service. The night before we leeve, I had requested by phone to be waked up at 6 am, but we did not get any call or ring at all. This could have been a big problem because we had a shuttle scheduled at 7:15 to go to the airport. Fortunately, as a double precaution we had put into operation our own alarm clock, so we waked up in time.

Reviews.Title: “Came back for the 2nd time”
Reviews.Author: pacogirona
Reviews.Content: I was already in the Vincci New York in NOvember 2010 and came back again a few months later. Wonderful location, great staff, excellent treatment. Toilets still need a slight refurbishing but everything is extremely clean and comfortable. So it is just a minor comment. Very quiet rooms although in the city center. Spacious rooms (all of them) and a homy feeling the moment you walk in your room. Temperature of the room too warm, this is my only critique. In any case, wonderful to sleep with open windows. Will come back again ! This is my new address for Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “It really grew on me!”
Reviews.Author: Jennystar100
Reviews.Content: On arrival and after the first night here I had two lists : the plusses and the minuses. By the end of the holiday, it was mostly plusses. A warm welcome from a friendly doorman/bell boy and slick transfer to a room on the 12th floor (very slow lift, but good for chiling out!). Room was immaculate. Two double beds - so comfortable!! fabulous bedding and super comfy pillows. The bathroom was clean twin washbasins and well lit. The room had a fridge and safe, but no tea/coffee making facilities. There is a free breakfast on offer but it is so ridiculously early we didn't make it. Coffee and tea are available in the lounge from 11am to 6pm but this does not help at 8am when you are desperate for a cup of coffee!! That's about my only real complaint. Next time we will bring a travel kettle and coffee. The air-con is noisy and at first Ithought it was going to be a problem, but after a couple of nights it was not noticeable. The free wifi was a well-appreciated extra and was easy to access. The location although not right in the midst of the nightlife was near enough to walk to many fabulous places yet far enough away to be peaceful and quiet. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “loved it.”
Reviews.Author: gramoba
Reviews.Content: We come to NYC a few times a year and this was the best experience ever. NY hotel staff can be distant and cold but not here! Everyone was professional, eager to help, and friendly. Cean rooms, in room WiFi. It's an easy stroll from Penn Station and a pleasant walk to theatres and shopping. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Happychap08
Reviews.Content: I received great service at the Vincci Avalon, I had a problem with the hairdryer in the room so I informed reception and on my return there was brand new hairdryer fitted to the wall in my bathroom any ready to use. The bedroom was really spacious with a comfortable bed, the room was decorated to a high standard, it was clean and shinny. Superb location just one block away from the Empire State Building with Times Square, Broadway, Macy's, Madisson Square Gardens only a short walk away. The hotel offered free internet access and printing service, this was a great help as we got to check-in on-line and print our boarding passes to save time at the airport. I would highly recommend this hotel, and New York is amazing Loved my stay!

Reviews.Title: “Absolute comfort in an impeccably groomed hotel”
Reviews.Author: lampreave
Reviews.Content: I was so happy with absolutely everything at the Vincci Avalon...I just wish I could have stayed longer! The staff was so kind, the interior design was classic and calming, and the amenities were so comforting.

Reviews.Title: “service please!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lennon11
Reviews.Content: STAYED HERE AS IT HAD THE BEST RATES IN TOWN FOR A KING SUITE,FOR SPACE AS WE WERE STAYING SIX NIGHTS. check in was not allowed until 3 o clock,not so helpful considering we were travelling for the previous sixteen. reception did not inform us of this as we checked,only realised as the porter took our bags away to storage. reception staff were rude and disinterested. breakfast was fine as were the rooms. i would think this is a business travellers hotel as it lacked comfort and charm required for leisure travellers

Reviews.Title: “The room was simply too hot”
Reviews.Author: HonestMaineTraveler
Reviews.Content: I'm very disappointed that I cannot recommend this hotel. The location is perfect, the hotel is clean, the rooms are nice, and the staff was friendly. But it was 50 degrees outside and 82 degrees in the room. I called down to the front desk, and they told me to turn off the heat, which I had done an hour earlier. They apologized--nicely--and said there was nothing they could do. I opened the window, but that didn't helped, and it was noisy outside. I had read on Expedia that there were problems with the rooms being hot, but I wanted to give it a try because I'm in New York a lot, and it really is the perfect location. But I was sweating while working at the desk, and I simply cannot sleep in an 82-degree room. And when a hotel is mostly a place to get a comfortable night sleep, that simply doesn't work.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay here.”
Reviews.Author: BoomerBabe
Reviews.Content: Writing this a bit late, as we stayed there in 2008. We actually stayed twice - we were away on the weekend and returned on Monday. Great location, clean and inviting space. ( The hotel was overheated - that is my only complaint. ) Our room was elegant, spacious and comfortable. We had lovely service, friendly help at the desk - left our bags over the weekend and returned to find them without any problem. We did not eat in the hotel due to the prices, but found great places nearby for breakfast, and, of course, for dinner. It was a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Big Room at a value”
Reviews.Author: LoveNewOrleans
Reviews.Content: This hotel is terrific - not the fanciest hotel but the rooms were very large - especially for NY hotel rooms - the bathroom had a good mirror and good shower head - bed comfortable and big flat screen TV - never used the mini bar - great little stores in the neighborhood and Empire State Building right around the corner - I thought this hotel was great for the price and the size of the room made a difference -

Reviews.Title: “A short New York family break, sightseeing, shopping.”
Reviews.Author: JagXJ40
Reviews.Content: We had a great time in the hotel. We went for a short sightseeing break in the city. The hotel is very central and we walked to most of the locations very easily. The staff are all bi-lingual and this helps immensely (we live in Spain), Many thanks to Wilson and Carolina especially. The staff made us feel at home right from the beginning and were always very helpful and friendly. The room was large and everything worked well, very clean and tidied up on time each day. We had one problem with a hair dryer that did not work, this was resolved in less than 5 minutes. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and we certainly would not hesitate to return there on a future visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location! What you would expect from a mid range price hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: vb506
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci for 5 nights mid feb - We rang to confirm our booking before leaving the UK due to reading some reviews previous re 'over booking' but there was no issues. On arrival to the hotel the receptionist was a bit rude and unhelpful and we stood around like lemons waiting for our room to be organised - however this was the only issue we had with our entire stay. Our room was very clean and spacious compared to typical NY standards and also was in a fantastic location. 4/5 nights we had disruptive sleep due to noisy guests etc, but a perfect nights rest is never guaranteed in the city that never sleeps! Free access to internet is also a bonus in the hotel free tea and coffee was a bit sparodic and was often luke warm and would be the only recommendation I would make to the hotel. Overall a neat little hotel very clean and in a great location, would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: DAZ5866
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vincci Avalon from 28th Jan till the 2nd of Feb. The hotel was brilliant the rooms were massive (we had family room which was worth paying extra for) and the hotel staff were really polite and friendly. Wi-Fi in the room was a little slow but not sure how anyone can grumble at something thats free!! Rooms were always left nice and tidy by the maid service for when we returned in the evening and none of our stuff was ever touched (and we did lots of shopping). Location is really central to everything and not to far from Penn station so can always commute from airport by train to hotel which is only like $17 i think although the hotel can offer excellent rates on private taxi hire. All in all this hotel was really good and if I can get the hotel room for the same price next year I will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms, great location, really really happy!”
Reviews.Author: ActGirlCanberra
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 7 nights at the Vincci Avalon just after New Year. We booked 2 juniour suites for our family of four and were delighted with the amount of room we had. We possibly all could have been in the one room but preferred a bit of extra space for all the shopping!! The staff were lovely and helpful, and when we had a situation with the aircon being a little too warm it was sorted out for us. Just down the street was Cafe 28 where you can grab a fabulous meal to take away, and of course there are plenty of diners, pizza joints etc to enjoy. The location was brilliant. Right near the Empire State building in the middle of Manhattan. A walk to so many wonderful things! Highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: Manresa
Reviews.Content: I just can say everything was perfect. It's location is great. Rooms were big. Beds comfortable. Bathroom clean and also big... we really enjoyed it. Everytime we come to NY this will be our hotel.!!! The only thing I can say I didn't like is about service. The ladys that made the room in the morning were very loud. Our room was next to the service elevator and sometimes they shouted, and sang... it was quite annoying. Also they awoke us when we were resting, more than one day asking if we had pillows or towels. But as I've said we really had a good time there and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Overbooking!!”
Reviews.Author: csant
Reviews.Content: I couldn't agree more with one of your solo tavellers.I even had experienced overbooking at a cost .I personally made the reservation through their website directly and followed normal procedures, by giving my credit card details,address, email etc;.Got to the hotel at about 1.30 am and the girl in reception who was v nice did tell me that there was 'no room at the inn' although they were aware of my reservation.I find terribly it arrogant of the management in question to allow this to happen, especially as I was travelling all day from ISTANBUL/ LONDON/ NEW YORKTo be fair they had made a reservation for that particular date in another hotel , which I had to pay for (no sleep!!!)and upgraded me when I checked in.Still, the fact remains that I was terribly let downafter a long journey and this doesn't compensate the fact that they ruined my NY stay.To make it worse, I did email/faxed etc after I got back to Europe and yet again the management never got back to me.If this attitude is linked to what is supposed to be tied to a 'service oriented' city, AVALON management should recruit some CHINESE, maybe they can do thir duties better.Sorry, but I am still waiting for an apology.Shame on you!!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: SymonDP
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel in good position very closer to empire state building. All personal very professional and also friendly, room clean and large. Excellent service of breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “very happy with most aspects”
Reviews.Author: trevor3773
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights the hotel from28th december to 2nd january it was very well situated the rooms were very clean and well maintained if a little small, there was unfortunitlay some milldew in the shower area, the staff were very friendly and very helpful would like to mention Abbey who was very good to us. we had our children with us ranging from 22 - 13 all had a very good time would stay in your hotel again if we return to new york

Reviews.Title: “Do not leave your valuables in the room!!”
Reviews.Author: EssexJOEpping
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a girly xmas shopping weekend. Firstly our flight was delayed so we arrived late. They had given our rooms to somebody else so we had to wait around until we could find another suite, where we were on seperate floors. we left the hotel around 10am to goshopping and I remembered I had left my expensive diamond watch by the shower so i immediately called the hotel to notify them. When I arrived back at 5pm the watch was gone. I had to stay in that evening while my friends went out for the night to search the room thoroughly, only to find my luggage had been rifled through and my ipod was also missing. I reported this to the head of housekeeping and the police. The head of housekeeping was very supportive and told me he would investigate with the cleaners and to enjoy the rest of my stay as he would get back to me and the hotel is insured for this. It ruined my stay but when I returned I sent several emails and left lots of messages and was totally ignored by him.. After a few months I was eventually given a message by one of the staff more or less saying 'too bad e are not doing anything about it'. This was discusting behaviour as the head of housekeeping told me he thought it was possible that one of the staff had stolen my things but totally ignored my calls when I returned to the Uk. I would NEVER RECCOMEND THIS HOTEL TO ANYONE> BE CAREFULL !!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: nikkic11
Reviews.Content: Stayed here last year had no problems. Came back this year and we had a few. Our 1st room was too noisy as the fans from building opposite were very loud, complained had we got moved to a non smoking room which smelt of smoke. Our 3rd room was a junior suite - we had paid for King deluxe and ended up sleeping in a Queen bed. We were too exhausted to complain again. Apart from that the hotel is clean and well located. The girl on reception was not too happy when we complained but we had paid for a room that we ended up not getting!

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely go back”
Reviews.Author: wvparrotlover
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Jr Suite w/2 full beds. The room was clean and well-appointed. The hotel was in a good area. We stayed in November and the heat in the room was overpowering, but opening a window and turning the thermostat off did the trick. A little bit of mold/mildew in the bathroom, but I imagine it's hard to see with all that marble! Overall, very nice hotel, Fabulous location. Within walking distance to subway and bus, many tourist attractions and shopping... nice cafe around the corner. Hope to get back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent value for money!”
Reviews.Author: newdogSomerset
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed our stay here. Superb location. Very clean hotel if a bit dated. This didn't matter as fitted in with the rest of New York style. Staff excellent, particularly Bell Boys! Room was a fantastic size, really large for two sharing twin room; however no extra frills, basic room contents. Even had a bit of a view!! Room 906. Totally reccommend to family and friends. Our room was very quiet for NY; not a sound was heard either inside or outside. Rarity surely in NY?

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city, friendly helpful staff and comfy, clean rooms.”
Reviews.Author: halulah
Reviews.Content: We stayed from Oct 3rd to Oct 7th 2009: on arrival we greeted by friendly staff, helpful and efficient. Our room was very clean, and as we had requested, we had 2 queen beds. Our flat screen TV had a comfy sofa to crash on after a hard days trekking. And the shower room was clean, with high quality towels and toiletries. The cleaner did an excellent job of tidying our room too. We both found the reception staff very helpful (at any time of the day or night). And having access to the PC's as gratis was great, although i found the wireless internet unusable. We both agreed that we would stay at the Avalon again - its location is excellent - which ever way you turn out of the entrance, you are surrounded by NYC at its best. Thanks to all the staff for such an enjoyable holiday. I

Reviews.Title: “Value for money if you book in advance - but don't arrive after 10pm!”
Reviews.Author: UkCarm
Reviews.Content: I booked the Avalon through an affiliate website in August on a 30 day advance special rate for a long weekend in October. This hotel was great value for money if booked in advance. The rooms are a lot larger that other newer hotels in New York and is well positioned off 32nd and Madison. As I had booked the hotel through another website, I e-mailed the Avalon direct to check the booking had gone through and to request a non-smoking room. I was also going to be arriving on a late flight - getting to Manhatten at about 11.30pm. They assured me that everything would be fine and I would be able to check in at that time. However, when we arrived at the hotel - earlier than thought, we were told that we were unable to stay there as the person who had our room had not checked out. We had to stay at the Carlton on 34th Street for the first night and then back to the Avalon the following morning. We were really disappointed about this as it tarnished an otherwise great stay. We could not get a refund on the room for the night as the hotel said we booked on a special offer and they had paid for a more expensive hotel for us for the night! Our junior suite was extreamly spacious with a large bathroom, dressing area and seperate lounge area with windows that opened onto the street. Be warned - from the start of October, some hotels in New York shut down their air con - hence why the hotel was so warm. We opened the window in our room and shut off the heating which helped. The area is great - try Silo for breakfast Monday - Friday (turn right out of the hotel and walk one block down) and try the Japanese buffet restaurant next door which is amazing! Walk down to 2nd Avenue for some great unique places to eat and drink - real Murray Hill. The staff were great and helpful with us. I would stay there again, but get there early!

Reviews.Title: “The other reviews were correct...”
Reviews.Author: TreeFrog9
Reviews.Content: Before I booked my reservation at this hotel, I read the other reviews here at Trip Advisor. There were a few older posts of the rooms being too hot . I fugured that a few months later, they would have had the problem fixed. But as soon as I walked into the lobby, there were 2 other guests at the front desk complaining of the same thing. They were not travelling together and each of their rooms were overly warm. The front desk was working to switch their rooms. When I was assigned my room and went up, my room was also overly warm. The windows in my room opened so I kept them open during my stay- I was in meetings all day and just needed a place to sleep. The noise level from the street did wake me around 230am when people were leaving the Times Square area. I don't think I will ever stay at this hotel again....not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: margieray56
Reviews.Content: Two years ago I booked a Delux suite for 4 women. When we arrived they had given our room away for no real reason except they did. We settled for a Junior suite and our breakfast was to be comped each day. The room was beautiful and had a great kitchenette. Each morning the dining room had no info on the breakfast comp. because no one at the front desk ever put it into the dining rooms computer, or so I was told. I had to ask them to adjust the price from the larger suite to the smaller. In 2009, I took 5 women to NY and booked 2 DELUX suites. I emailed ahead of time to try to assure that our rooms would be available. Upon arrival they had given one away and were planning to put 3 older women in a king size bed. Go figure. I ended up taking a junior suite but once again had to request they adjust the price. When we got to the room there was no coffee pot or kitchenette. We were told coffee would be available in the lobby at 6:30 am. What a hassle. The coffee machine made one cup of instant coffee at a time. It took forever to get 6 cups then having to carry them upstairs was a mess. The dining room does not open until 7:30 am. The people at the front desk have terrible attitudes. They just don't seem to care that the guest is being inconvenienced. I will have to think twice about staying there again

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: abh712nc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Avalon for three days and could not have asked for a better hotel. The room was very large for NYC standards and could have easily slept 5 or 6 people with room to move around, get ready, etc. The bathroom was big with a standing shower (great pressure!), tub, and two sinks. The air conditioning and mini-fridge worked great in our room. When we called three separate times over the stay for a cot, extra towels and ice, they each arrived within 15 minutes. The hotel was very clean, updated and in a great location. Subway, deli's, diners, Starbucks, Empire State Building and great restaurants all within a few blocks. Also had fast WiFi service. The staff at the hotel was incredibly nice, especially Curtis at the front door. He went out of his way to make sure we had what we needed and we loved talking with him each day. We will definitely stay here our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Thumbs up”
Reviews.Author: travlngw-2adlts-5kds
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced, Clean and the suite was a good size (about 500sq ft). Stayed 3 days, 2 nights with kids ranging from 17 to 4 and we were all comfortable. Centrally located with reasonably priced restraunts near by (especially if you are traveling with a big party). I think they are in the process of remodeling so the mini fridge was emptied for us but didnt work. We purchased bottled water at a market near by and had room temperature water(no big deal). Overall our stay was great and I would recommend this hotel to our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “NYC NOT A PLACE FOR CHILDREN”
Reviews.Author: Aussiedissneylover
Reviews.Content: After having a wonderful week in LA disneyland, we were very disapointed with this hotel. When we arrived our room wasn't ready, no cot as I had request when booking. When we asked for one it still hadn't arrived after two hours and had to call again and request that one be bought up asap. NO FRIDGE, they said there fridges were being up graded? However I said that unless I get a fridge I am leaving all of a souden we got one. It is not a nice area of town. It is in korea town. Hotel staff not very helpful at all, and on two nights we had the smell of smoke comming into our room. Once I called the staff at 2AM with asthma saying who is smoking? It then stopped. Not near as nice as it looks in photos. Really in all NYC was not a place to take three young children.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal in midtown”
Reviews.Author: suzygold
Reviews.Content: Air conditioning worked perfectly. Junior suite was HUGE by NYC standards (450 sq ft) and only $179 in July. Subway is 1 and 1/2 blocks away. Twin Deli on Madison between 32nd and 33rd had great bagel and coffee selections. A bagel and coffee was less than $3.00. There are two laptops in the library with internet for public use. I only wish coffee was available all day as there is no coffee or mini bar in the rooms despite what their website says.

Reviews.Title: “Feel's like home....”
Reviews.Author: Coppercowboy
Reviews.Content: Nice place, nice people. Room we add was clean and well climated. Washroom was big, clean too. Near everything in Manatthan. One furniture was broken(tv furniture) missing a door, fridge was defect, but.......they came with another one. Thanks again. You should try it.

Reviews.Title: “Huge rooms, with an ok view rather than a brick wall”
Reviews.Author: mrbod
Reviews.Content: Travelling with friends we needed 3 seperate beds. For about £1500 we got 2 huge rooms, both with 2 double beds in and 2 tv's (?!?!). We certainly weren't disappointed. Hotel is right around the corner from the Empire State so it was easy to access all parts of Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous location shame about the air con!”
Reviews.Author: shelleyandandy
Reviews.Content: Having scoured the internet for a good quality hotel with a fair price in a good location, I decided to go for the Avalon. Upon arrival we were greated with a lovely smile from reception which is quite opulent with a clean and inviting entrance. We are shown to our room ( room 907 ) which was spacious and had a good feel to it. The view was dismal but how much time do you really spend hanging out of the window eh ;-). We quickly realised that our air con wasnt working and they told us that most of the hotel was suffering from the same issue and they couldnt really do anything about it. Which in my opinion doesnt really cut the mustard ! My straightners (GHD) also didnt work in most of the plug sockets as they were loose from some of the walls. We only ate breakfast once as we found it quite expensive, but the once we did eat it, the staff were lovely and the food was fresh and tasty. We travelled to Central Park ( I have a little boy who is over 5 ), the native american museum, staten island ( on the free ferry), the World Trade Center, FAO Schwartz, Central park Zoo and for all of the above, this hotel is IDEALLY located. Just off 5th Avenue it is around 50 meters from the Empire States Building. Over all my experience was a good one. The hotel quality is above average but not great. I would recommend this hotel to a friend as long as they guarenteed that the air con was working !

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience in NYC”
Reviews.Author: fromSanFran
Reviews.Content: When we arrived at the Avalon, we were NOT advised when we checked in that the air conditioning was not working in the entire hotel. I switched on the A/C in the room before leaving for dinner. When we returned from dinner the room was a furnace! (The heat came on, the A/C didn't work) I called downstairs and they said the air conditioning wasn't working and they didn't know when it would be fixed. (We were booked in for four days - it was sweltering weather in Manhattan). It was impossible to sleep (with ear plugs) with the trash trucks, taxis, and traffic blaring all night in a unbearably uncomfortable room. When I complained the following morning, they refused to let us check out early. The manager tried to have us move to a lower floor; he said it would be "cooler." What a JOKE - the air conditioning was broken for the entire hotel! The room was supposed to have two bathroom sinks (it only had one), the room keys didn't work, and the hotel staff did not seem to care that their guests were miserable and suffering. I will NEVER go back.

Reviews.Title: “I can't believe they claim 4 stars!”
Reviews.Author: gnoccola
Reviews.Content: I had to stay in this hotel for 10 days at $200 per night. For that price and the 4 stars they claim I would expect more. Overall the room was clean, and spacious enough. But, beside that, the customer service was terrible and the room was lacking basic stuff. For instance, the claim to have coffee machines in every room, but they don't. When you go down and ask why in the room they write in gigantic letters that there is coffee, they say they "will" have coffee machines in the future, but for now you have to suck it up. They try to offer an alternative, with a coffee dispenser in the hall, which could be ok if it wasn't for the fact that the coffee is always cold and the cream old. Really, every time I tried to get some coffee, it was ice cold. Then, they say they have mini bar, but when you get to the room, you only see a locked cooler. When you go ask for the key, they say they are in the process of renewing the mini-bar, so they cannot actually unlock the fridge for you. They can bring you ice if you want, but no fridge. That was a big disappointment since I had to spend 10 days in there and I would have love to get some fresh water at night or to store some food. Then, the worst thing is that the internet connection is either slow or not working. They lost the connection on Friday and they say that there is no way a technician can come and fix it until Monday. So, 3 day or more without a connection are not a big deal for them. Try to be in NY trying to buy a house and have no internet and see how you like it! Overall, this hotel sucks. The receptionists keep smiling, but they do not solve any of these issues. I would definitely expect more from a 4 stars hotel.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: TravelWhileWeEnjoy
Reviews.Content: I was ironically here for a Hospitality Convention. This hotel does not know the meaning of the word. It was an unually warm week in November. The room registered over 82 degrees at all times! I have a heat related ilness that was furthur aggravated by this. I complained to the front desk at 3am when I could not sleep. I was told that the air conditioning was turned OFF for the season! I have NEVER heard of this especially for the caliber of hotel they claim to be. I was not offered any comfort (portable fan/air conditioner) or room upgrade. I was told no manager was available and I should sleep with open windows! No cancellation of my next 2 nights was allowed due to 48 hr cancel policy. I was offered NOTHING untielevating this andthen it was for a future stay at 20% off. I WILL NEVER STAY AGAIN AND DISCOURAGE ANYONE FROM STAYING AT A HOTEL LACKING SUCH CARE FOR THE COMFORT OF THEIR GUESTS!

Reviews.Title: “Very pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: wingator
Reviews.Content: On a recent trip to New York, I chose to stay the Vincci hotel based on recommendations from another internet site. The hotel is only one block from the Empire State Building and only six blocks from Penn Station. The street was just ok, but it was not noisy and the hotel was easy to find. We were warmly greeted upon arrival and offered a room upgrade to a suite. We would normally have declined, but it was only $30 extra (Valentine special). If you are offered this deal, take it. The room was wonderful. Foyer, Coat room, TV room and bedroom. The bathroom was three rooms itself (sink, shower/tub, and toilet rooms). There was also free internet. The suite still came to under $200/night. Unbelievable value in the heart of New York.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & friendly”
Reviews.Author: sunny_funk
Reviews.Content: Very clean, rooms are amazing & huge, breakfast is a little expensive in the hotel, but there's a plenty of Deli's about, especially the Brooklyn Bagel Company on the corner of the St as you turn left out of the hotel. Staff was friendly, rooms cleaned daily with fresh towels. This was my 2nd time in NYC & this hotel was in an ideal location for me away from the noisyness of Times Square...although you'll never truely escape the NYC sound!

Reviews.Title: “The best choice in NY!”
Reviews.Author: MGCVC
Reviews.Content: We found an excellent offer for this hotel, which is located very close to the Empire State Building. The hotel belongs to a Spanish chain of hotels and therefore has a strong (and positive!) European character in both decoration and service. Rooms are huge (uncommon in NY!), clean and reformed. Furniture are old but well preserved. Air conditioning is a little bit noisy but not to the extent of being annoying. Its location can't be better: quite near from everything. There is a computer-room with free internet connection. Thanks to the offer we got, we did a well-worth choice, as the other hotels we saw were only a little bit cheaper but much worse. I really recommend this hotel. We had a fantastic experience there!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome location, deal on price, cosmetic issues, slow internet”
Reviews.Author: gotobednow
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vincci for a weekend getaway with my husband the first weekend in March. Rates in NYC are rock bottom right now and we had a wide variety of choices in the 4-star category for less than $130/night. We come to the city often and have been to many, many different hotels. The Vincci's location is wonderful. The 15-minute walk from Grand Central where we come into the city was quite nice. Check-in was quick and we had booked a Jr. Suite with a queen bed and they upgraded us without our asking to a King Suite which is an elongated room with a King bed and a couch area. The marble bathroom had a tub and a shower stall as well as double sinks and it was very spacious. I can't really speak to the service since we didn't need it, but the front desk woman who checked us in was friendly, as was the man who delivered ice to our room. Before I say anything else, I will preface it with the fact that we would definitely stay here again if the price was right. My complaints are not deal breakers, just not what I expect out of a hotel of this caliber. And certainly not what I would expect had I paid normal NYC prices. The reason why I am only giving 4-stars instead of 5 is because of the appointments and lack of attention paid to details in the room. Other 4-star hotels we've been to (Intercontinental being our most recent) have invested much more in room decor. The furniture here was cheap to begin with, so of course, it was broken. The armoire was falling apart on the bottom and the drawers inside were broken. The wood on all pieces of furniture was badly dinged and chipped. And there was a long, cloth covered bench that had been "spot cleaned" so many times that it was covered with clean spots and actually looked disgusting. My last "complaint" would be the Internet service. Yes it is free, but boy is it SLOW!!!! It was as if I was using dial-up. Other hotels I have stayed in in the city have not been much better, but I still want to mention it. If you were trying to conduct business via the computer, you would be frustrated. On a positive note, I believe this may have been the first hotel I've stayed in where the floor in the room was not carpeted. It was a good change of pace to have the Pergo flooring. I was worried at first we might here other guests' heels clicking above us, but we did not. Overall, we enjoyed our stay, loved the location and as I said before, would definitely stay again if the price was right.

Reviews.Title: “staff issues”
Reviews.Author: benavista
Reviews.Content: Firstly, I totaly agree with the comments made by ecape 23 regarding the staff. Unfortunatey Iberia lost our luggage en route which meant we had to replace everything we had brought for our 7 day stay. Although obviously not the hotels problem the doorman, Abbey was fantastic in his help trying to resolve this matter five days into our stay. The day we were checking out Carolina was on duty and we found her to be very unhelpfull. While waiting to be served I overheard her take a call from a customer and at the end of the conversation swearing when she put the phone down, not the kind service you would expect form a 4 star hotel receptionist. We had to fax Iberia a claim form which she also seemed to have a problem with, we were then charged 4 dollars for this which after the help 2 days previously seemed a little excesive. Overall we were very pleased with our room, location and the rest of the staff and would consider using this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “From Florida to the Big Apple....Hotel with Style!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: tiasmomPensacola
Reviews.Content: Friends and I went on a New York at Christmas Retreat....Although you don't spend much time in the room while in New York, this was a GREAT PLACE to come back to. My only complaint is that between the two rooms we got the smaller bathroom. Our other friends had the bath and seperate shower. The front desk was very helpful and friendly. I loved it and going back in June, hoping to stay here again.!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Oh My My My”
Reviews.Author: greenie30
Reviews.Content: We have sadly just returned from our trip to New York. We stayed there for three amazing nights! Our welcome at the hotel was very nice, room was just spotless, breakfast was deliciousand staff were just excellent. Everytime we passed a member of staff they said Hello and helped us whenever possible. They made our stay very nice and easy. I couldnt recommend this hotel more highly. The room on the 12th floor was just amazing. The view of the Empire State was worth waking up for and the size of the room was just superb! The very kind Bellman helped with our heavy bags, asked if we needed help with anything and even went out into the streets and found a cab. He was very polite and very kind to two poor girls who struggled with their shopping! If staying in New York this hotel is very glamourous and made us feel very special!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location in Central Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: fletch5
Reviews.Content: Just returned last week from a great trip to NYC. Staying in the Avalon was just the best location. 12th Floor, large junior suite, room 1203 very quiet room, furniture a bit run down but beds large clean & comfortable and service was impeccable, thanks to Wilson the doorman/bellboy for all his help. If you can find Mark on his twin bicycle for a tour round Central Park on a Sunday morning do this rather than take the horse and carriage, it will cost you a lot more but his knowledge and personal touch is the best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay in the Big Apple”
Reviews.Author: Escape23
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Avalon Vincci after reading the comments from this website. My fiancé and I were travelling from Spain to spend a few weeks in the USA. We would spend the first 3 nights in NYC, then fly down to Florida before returning to NYC to spend a further 4 nights, then fly back to Europe. I was perhaps a little sceptical about staying here as some of the other members reviews were both positive and negative. After some careful consideration, we decided to book the hotel for the first 3 nights of our stay, and if the hotel was good, we would book the last 4 nights of our holiday there too. Let me tell you, the hotel was just fine for our needs, and we did in fact book (via their website) the last 4 nights there. This was our first visit to NYC so we wanted to be in a central location. You cannot get more central than this!. The Empire State Building is just around the corner, and as other reviewers have mentioned, Macy´s and Maddison SQ Garden are all a short walk away. The hotel is not a modern hotel, but it is clean and comfortable. The décor I guess could be called “charming”. Check-in was easy and the friendly receptionist, Mawy, advised us that we had been upgraded from a King Deluxe to an Executive King Suite. The room was very spacious, large bedroom and sectioned off sitting area with sofa, chairs and desk, the marble bathroom had all the amenities that you would expect from a 4 Star hotel, as well a Jacuzzi bath and separate shower. We had two LCD Flatscreen TV´s and an iPod docking station as well as a Bose radio in the room. The furniture seemed new and was very comfortable. There is also an electronic Safe Box as well as an Ironing Board and Iron, which I think comes in useful in hotels as they tend to charge a lot of money for pressing your clothes. When I had made the room reservation on their website, I had ordered a Half bottle of House Champagne and some Madisson Crunch Chocolates to be delivered to the room, these were not there when we arrived, so I had to call down to the front desk for them. Mawy arranged for the items to be delivered promptly afterwards. The “Champagne” in fact turned out to be Spanish Cava and the Chocolates were a selection of Ferrero Roche. Not exactly as described on their website, and we all know the price difference between a bottle of Champagne and Cava. Later that evening I asked the Doorman/Luggage Porter where I could try a good steak, and he recommended a restaurant three blocks away, which turned out to be very good. We never tried the breakfast at the hotel, but overheard that it was 16USD per person. Instead we ventured out to the Bagel Café on the corner every morning (which is open 24 hours). An Open Top Bus Tour is a must, and one of the stops is just outside the Empire State Building, which in turn is just around the corner. Having spent the days sightseeing and shopping, we felt that it was always nice to return to the hotel. The staff were very pleasant and welcoming, and as many reviewers have stated, the beds are heavenly comfortable. There is free WiFi access in the lobby as well as 2 PC´s for guest use, which comes in handy if you want to check emails or your flight bookings. The rooms were cleaned very well on a daily basis. Ours was facing the street, so there was some noise during the night (it seems mandatory in NYC to honk your car horn every so often), but it wasn’t loud as I thought it would be. There is an Aircon/Heating machine in the rooms, and the quite hum kind of drowns out the noise from outside. There were two remote controls for each television, which we found a bit confusing, but they both worked and the channels were clear (CNN, BBC World etc…). The Minibar was well stocked and the normal prices for a hotel, though there were no wine glasses available, even though 2 half bottles of wine were. There is a filter coffee machine also. The hotel was quite busy during our stay, and there are a lot of international clientele, especially Spanish (the hotel belongs to a Spanish chain). Overall, we enjoyed our stay, and wondered why the hotel had got some negative reviews. About two weeks later we returned to the hotel. The Doorman remembered us and gave us a very warm “welcome back”. This time there was no upgrade, so we got the King Delux that we originally booked. This time our room was on the backside of the hotel and the view was basically of the building next door or the fire escape, meaning that we had to keep our curtains closed for most of the time. The room was a little bit smaller than our previous one, with no partition between the small living area. There were 2 TV´s, though these were quite old and small, and not the Flatscreens that we had before. The sound didn’t work properly on one of them, instead we got a loud hissing noise from the speakers. There was no Bose radio either, and the floor creaked. I went down to the Front Desk to see if I could change room, the Receptionist didn’t even look up from her computer screen and bluntly told me that the hotel was full, and that maybe we could change the following day. We decided to grin and bear it, seeing as we would be out most of the time, and didn’t want to be fussed with unpacking and packing up again for changing rooms, as long as the TV was fixed, we could handle it. Again without looking up from her computer, she wrote down problem with the TV and said it would be fixed. Back in the room, some of the furniture was a bit old, and some of the lamps could have done with changing, the one near the bed was almost falling off. The shower head was broken, which meant that we had to use the shower in the bath tub (no Jacuzzi this time), which in turn made the whole floor wet and slippery. Our room was situated next to the Service Store, the small room were the Maids keep the towels, slippers, shampoos, cleaning liquids etc… This meant that during the night, you could hear the night cleaner talking and opening and shutting the door, and during the early morning you could hear the Maids do the same. Now I began to understand some of the negative reviews from this site. When returning from dinner, the TV had still not been fixed. So we ended up watching the TV on mute and use the sound from the other set instead. Kind of semi Stereo!. The next morning, Mawy the receptionist was on duty, so I told her about the TV and she promised to have someone look at it. Later that day, in keeping with her promise, the TV was fixed. As always, during our stay our room was expertly cleaned. Our departing flight was in the evening, so the next day I went to enquire about the possibility of a late check-out. The receptionist, the one who refuses to acknowledge the clients, never looked up from her screen as she said that I had to speak to a Manager. I think that when you pay the amount you do to stay in a 4 Star hotel, the staff should at least acknowledge you and make eye contact. I wasn’t checking out until the next day, so I said that I would speak to a manager tomorrow. I sarcastically thanked her for her “help”, and she managed to answer me, again without even looking up. The following morning I went to the Front Desk. I said my “Good Mornings” and asked her if I could speak to a Manager. Again, without looking up she called out for one of the Managers. It was the Assistant Front Office Manager, Eric on duty and I explained to him that I would appreciate, if possible, a late check-out. He checked on the system and found that my room was already booked for another guest, but he could let me check-out at 13.30hrs and that they could store my luggage if need be, which we agreed to and thanked him for his help. A little later I got a call from the front desk at around 11.00hrs, to remind me that check-out time was coming up, so I reminded her that only 15 minutes before, Eric had agreed to a late check-out. Without apologising she put the phone down. I know that hotels have a huge amount of guests daily, and it is hard for staff to remember them, but if you are staying for 4 nights, I think that it would be easier to recognise you and not treat you like “just another room number”. I cannot stand “impersonal service”, or worse still, rudeness. I felt a little disappointed with this stay, the first stay was great, great service, great room. However, the second stay we felt was a big let down and an anti climax to a pleasant holiday. We could tolerate the difference in room if the customer service had made up for it. There is nothing better than "Service with a Smile". If the experience had been similar to my first stay, I would give the Avalon Vincci an "Excellent" rating, however, I have given it a "Neutral/ Average" based mainly on my return. On the whole, I would only recommend this hotel if you book the Executive Suites, they only cost a little more, and the difference is huge. The locale is great and near to everything and 99% of the staff are very helpful. The photos on their site are a true depiction of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: ADDICT_NYC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to NYC and we chose to Vincci Avalon. I must say I was very disappointed with the room. Very, very noisy. I did not feel comfortable at all. The size was ok, but even though we were on the 9th floor, it was so noisy. I would not recommend it. After long days walking and shopping, you definetly need a rest. Quality-price is not balanced. Too expensive for what it offers.

Reviews.Title: “fab location”
Reviews.Author: danibird25
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from 3 nights at the Vincci Avalon. For a NY hotel room it was huge. We had 2 double beds and a sofa bed as well as a full bathroom complete with robes, slippers and toiletries all complimentary. The hotel was clean and the staff were wonderful and helpful. The hotel is in an excellent location for the all the shops and there are loads of good places to eat nearby. Andrews for breakfast was ace, and a chinese restaurant (next door to hotel) Todai was excellent. The hotel had about 100 rooms set over 12 floors so its fairly small in comparison to other NY hotels which is a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: princess2008_8
Reviews.Content: It was the first time I was visiting New york and it was a shopping trip with my sister. We choose to book at the Avalon as it was the best price for the time of year we wanted, we stayed for 5 days and this hotel was perfect, the staff were very friendly and helpful. We didn't use the restaurants as most of the time we ate out. The room were very clean and made up very day, and considering our room was facing the road, it was very quite. I would definatly stay at the Vincci Avalon again.

Reviews.Title: “A gem of a hotel - great location. Great rates!”
Reviews.Author: fabi73
Reviews.Content: My second stay here and its a great hotel! I decided to upgrade from the Junior Suite to the Queen Deluxe. A bit of a problem with my initial room and I was moved to a fantastic room on the 12th (and top) floor! The bathroom - clean and sumptious. Bed - best bed ever! I'm an insomniac and even I couldnt resist it! I like the separate living area as well. The mini bar was well-stocked and plenty of wardrobe space. My ONLY complaint would be the TV - this is NYC! The TV is old and small. A smart larger LCD would be nice! Location - perfect for the Empire State Building (practically across the road). Macy's Modell's, Footlocker, Victoria's Secret and Madison Sqaure Garden a short walk away. The walk to the NY Library isnt bad at all. Maybe a problem with getting to and from Times Square and the fancier shops of Madison Ave and 5th but cant have everything! Place is great. Prices are great. Stayed 9 days this time around taking advantage of a special offer. Rooms are big for Manhattan. A true gem. Oh and FREE internet access and Wifi!! Cant wait til 2009!

Reviews.Title: “A great place”
Reviews.Author: Kbedford21
Reviews.Content: It was a great experience. The hotel needs though to improve on the telephones and the tvs. The front desk was great. I spoke to the manager (peter?) and he was able to assist me with my needs. The bellman was able to get me a cab within minutes. the housekeeping manager I could not get his name, he is tall and black was very polite to my family and made sure that we have an extra roll away bed for our family. The restaurant breakfast needs a little bit of improvement. Otherwise it is a great place. Will be there for Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “The Vincci Avalon is great for families!”
Reviews.Author: CALtravelmom
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel at Hotels.com for a great rate. It was one of the hotels that could accommodate all 5 of our family members in a suite because the two room suites are roomy. We arrived in NYC via Penn Station and walked to the hotel. We reserved a junior suite and upon arrival were given a full size suite upgrade! All of the staff at the hotel are very, very nice. The suite was very nice, very clean, very comfortable beds, marble bath, and our room was quiet. This hotel is a boutique type hotel, nicest I saw in the immediate area, and a very short block & one half to the Empire State Building. There was always free great coffee and mini-muffins for early risers down in the lobby. A good place to eat for families is The Empire Brewery (and Restaurant) in the first level and basement of the Empire State Building. A nearby Walgreens supplied us with cereals for snacking and some breakfasts for our teens (there is a refrigerator in the rooms). There are restaurants open for breakfast nearby. There were a large number of inexpensive souvenir shops in the area. Because of that, the area the Vincci is in is not glamorous, though Park Avenue & 5th Avenue are right up the street! The double deck bus tours start only a block away (Bargain to get a great deal!). Enjoy your stay at the Vincci!

Reviews.Title: “Survived The Avalon”
Reviews.Author: TorontoDisgruntled
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just got back to Toronto after spending 4 nights at the 32 nd Street Vincci Avalon Hotel. We could hardly wait to share this experience with other travellers. We booked our hotel months in advance, and selected the Avalon on the advice of a client. We wanted to stay in Manhattan, to shop and sight see. From the moment we arrived, we were under-whelmed by the Avalon experience. We received a tiny room with one bed when we had ordered a larger room with two beds. The room we received was tiny, dirty and noisy. The floor was sticky and a dirty, smelly rag was sitting on the bathroom sink, and the door of the TV cabinet was broken. Clearly we were upset. The next morning we complained to the front desk and were told that it was the travel agent's fault,. After we complained some more they relented and upgraded our room to the room we had booked, which was double the size. The new room was much quieter, but the floor and windows were filthy and the bath room mirror was not functional.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: HoustonSuperMario
Reviews.Content: Started bad with Reception not honoring reservation, then offering us a take it or go somewhere else deal. Every day was painful to get something done, no towels... broken pipe and non-potable water in bathroom. We were also locked out our room because another reception crew wanted to talk about reservations, which were made months in advance... It was a horrible experience... the Hotel claims to be a 4 star hotel, I'll give it a 2 star. Objectively, the neighborhood is filthy, the rooms are nice with outdated TVs. We even had a broken remote. No wireless internet, only in a secluded area near the lobby and just the 1 computer with wired internet for all the guest. No room service, no pool, the view our of the room was a trash site... We did not get glasses or simple soap in the bathroom or extra blankets... obviously, we managed the storm and tried to forget that we paid 400 USD a night for a room, which in two occacions were locked out and offered to be kicked out... If we were not traveling as a family group, I would have left in a sec and go to a better hotel for the same price... Never will come back to this hotel again. We traveled with wife and kids... only nice thing was the concierge... and the web photos... horrible stay indeed.

Reviews.Title: “value for money”
Reviews.Author: 2adults1teen
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 11 nights in the midst of a heat wave, temp reaching peak of 93 degrees. Have stayed with this spanish owned chain before in North Africia and were happy to stay again. Represents good value for money.Excellent midtown location.Staff were efficiant and helpful. Booked a junior suite,plenty of room for 2 adults and 1 teen. Agree with previous reviews that furniture is a little tatty, but clean and the place does have charecter. Beds really comfortable, which is really important after walking several blocks up and down Manhatten in the heat each day. Air con worked well, managed to keep the room really comfortable. Use the bagel deli on the corner for breakfast in the morning - you can't miss it. Jumbo Juice great for a refreshing smoothie and you must try Todai the Japanese and Sushi buffet that is next door to the hotel ,the biggest and best that you will come across. Also if your kids are into vintage clothing try cheap jacks-one block down on fifth ave, not cheap but a great collection of clothes.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Hotel in NYC”
Reviews.Author: Peter044
Reviews.Content: The best hotel I've seen. The best Service, the best People the best beds. Was the best experience inn NYC!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Butterfly079
Reviews.Content: The Vincci chain are really reliable and always guarantee decent accommodation at a decent price. I have used them before and have always come away happy. The location in Manhatten is ideal for any traveller who wants to be close enough to the action without it being on their doorstep. The 6 train is only a couple of blocks away and is ideal for getting to most places up and down Manhatten. The Empire State Building is literally around the corner (go early or late to avoid crows). Korea Town is also along 33rd St and well worth having dinner in any of the restaurants there if you want to stay close to the hotel one evening. The hotel itself was lovely and the staff were very friendly and welcoming. The room was ideal - spacious, clean and comfortable - although I avoided room service and using the mini bar as they were quite expensive, but then who goes to Manhatten to sit in a hotel room when there are so many great bars/restaurants to go to! Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Great People!”
Reviews.Author: miamirose_7
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to visit NYC in the Spring! And I was not disappointed... After a long flight we arrived at the hotel and were greeted with a warm smile at the reception as Mawy , the front desk agent checked us in to our room and was very helpful in offering us advice on where to shop and other things to do. Our room was nice, very clean and comfy and we did have a view! The hotel is conveniently located near the best coffee shops and stores, oh did I mention that Macy's is right there! Mawy was able to get us tickets to a broadway show and reservations to a great little restaurant! The hotel also offers breakfast in the morning, and has a nice little bar where you can start your evening with an early cocktail. Overall, our stay was great, very nice hotel, the staff was very accomodating and made our first visit to NYC a memorable one!. We are looking forward to returning in the fall!

Reviews.Title: “great location, but really 2/3 star”
Reviews.Author: simonb1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a junior suite, I think we paid about $250 a night plus tax, which i thought was good value but mostly for the location. Our room wasnt great - a bit run down, the furniture is all really cheap, as is the laminate flooring! bathroom small too. BUT the bed was comfy. Had chocolates and champagne sent to the room on arrival - dont do it.. Ask for a room/floor that isnt smoking. we were on the 10th, thought it was no smoking but smelled a bit of stale smoke. There were a few families about but generally seemed quiet.. Our A/C worked but was a bit noisy! The staff were kinda friendly and helpful. Didnt eat there, they only do breakfast anyway, which looked good from a distance but expensive, go the the bagel place on the corner or jumba juice one minute away! Also, bar only open 5pm till 11pm. Stay here if your on a budget, dont be fooled by the hotel website, this isnt luxury and the rooms arent impeccably designed, however, it was clean, had all the things a hotel should. Practical, great location but def dont take someone here you want to impress.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dre4m-on
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel. We stayed there last November, my Mother and I, for a girlie shopping trip! Situated on 32nd Street beside 5th Avenue, it's location is fantastic for shopping! As well as exploring the rest of Manhattan. Macy's is a 2 minute walk (at which I totally recommend lunch there in their Cellar Bar & Grill - the steaks are fabulous) as is the Empire State Building. The hotel itself is very well kept, a lovely 4 star, huge rooms with a sofa seating area, comfy beds, very clean, nice staff (the concierge are there as soon as you get out of your taxi). Nearest subway station is a 1-2 minute walk, step out of the hotel and walk 2 blocks to your left. A little tip for breakfast - there's a cafe/takeaway on the corner there near the subway station (corner of 32nd & 7th) called 'Speedy's'. One word - yum! They also do lovely soups and muffins. You can see Macy's from there too. If returning to NYC I'd definitely stay here again, especially if it was a shopping trip!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay at the Vincci Avalon”
Reviews.Author: Mamaganoosh
Reviews.Content: We booked our rooms through Hotwire. We got the room at a good deal for $218. The location can't be beat. It is located between two subway lines and away from the crazy crowds in Times Square. The service we received was friendly, quick and efficient and the rooms were clean and comfortable, if a little worn. I especially liked that they supplied robes and slippers. I would definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: parked
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7th April - 12th April the location of this hotel is excellent, it is very central for getting around and just around the corner from the Empire State Building. The room was dated but was comfortable and clean, hotel staff courteous, watch out for the 19 dollars per person for breakfast we didnt ask and got stung on the first morning!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CorkCarol
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel. We were worried about this hotel after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor but we need not have. The Hotel is very clean and the staff extremely helpful. They made our stay very enjoyable. There were five of us in two junior suites, These rooms are very spacious and have spare blankets and pillows available. The bathroom is also very big by New York standards and both were cleaned daily. The desk staff and the doorman were allways available to help us with transport and to provide any information we required. When we return to New York we will stay in the Avalon. The only down side was that the bar closed too early , eleven o'clock at night.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for central base in New York”
Reviews.Author: fmackay
Reviews.Content: .I stayed at this hotel for 5 nights from 8th April 2008 with my wife and 3 teenage children. We had a deluxe suite which was spacious and faced the front of the building. We were a bit worried, having read some of the negative reviews, particularly since we had some problems with our booking already (not the hotel's fault but the company with which we booked.) We were welcomed in a friendly and professional way by the reception staff and quickly settled into our suite, which matched the hotel's description well. As others have commented, the style of the whole hotel is '1940's / traditional' and this may not be to everyone's taste - but I found it restful, in the frenetic atmosphere of central Manhattan. All the staff with whom we had contact, continued this positive , initial impression. Carmen Garcia, in particular, took over and resolved the problems caused by the E-booking company (hint, hint - Boo, Hiss). We didn't eat in the hotel. Local diners (Jimmy's and the more upmarket, Murray Hill Diner )are much better value for breakfast Overall, this hotel deserves a better press, than its recent reviews suggest.. We will certainly have no hesitation in coming back to this very well run, reasonably priced hotel given its excellent position in the most central area of NYC.

Reviews.Title: “What a con”
Reviews.Author: Waterboy25
Reviews.Content: I booked a "queen Deluxe Suite" in this hotel last October for a 5 night stay in the big apple with my wife and 3 children aged 16,14 and 11. I specified the size and ages of my party and was quoted a price of approx 1600 dollars which I thought was ok considering the central location of the Hotel. I was aware of some negative comments on sites such as this but felt overall the comments were positive. A week before my intended travel date I received a confirmation letter from the hotel noting that I had booked a Junior suite at the price which I was originally quoted. This raised my suspicions so I had a further look at the hotel website and noticed that a charge of 50 dollars plus tax per night per additional adult over the age of 11 was mentioned.(additional being over 2 persons occupying a suite with 2 queen beds and a sofa bed). As a result of the hotels failure to respond to numerous emails I rang the hotel who very abruptly told me that this had always been their practice but admitted that it wasnt specified on their website at the time I made my booking but that I would have to pay an additional amount of approx 600 dollars. I then queried the change in room and was bothered off with more abrupt remarks that the two types of rooms were comparable (when a glance at the hotels website would show you otherwise). 4 days before my intended arrival I found another hotel and emailed the avalon to cancel my reservation. Having got no reply to my email, the following day I rang the hotel spoke with a lady in the reservations section again cancelled the stay and confirmed my phone call by email. On arriving home i noted that I had been charged 305 dollars by the Avalon which is their charge where a cancellation is not recieved 48 hours before the day of arrival. I emailed the hotel for a refund of this charge 2 days ago and guess what I havent heard anything from them. Dont be decieved by the seemingly good value offered by this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: littlemolly
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Vincci Avalon for 4 nights in November. We were delighted with the size of our junior suite and the cleanliness of the room. The front desk staff dealt with all our queries in a friendly and professional way. The location was just superb - the Empire State building was at the end of the block and about 5 minutes further on was Macy's in Herald Square. As we came mainly for christmas shopping we couldn't have been better situated. We had free breakfast in the lobby (available between 5am and 7am) and if we were later rising there were many cafes and restaurants to have really good value breakfasts. I find it amazing that people could write such negative reviews, but then some people are never happy unless they are complaining. We enjoyed it so much we have booked to return in December.

Reviews.Title: “Very good and stylish hotel - high praise from me!”
Reviews.Author: sallynb
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel overall with friendly staff and excellent size, well cleaned rooms. Loved the hard floors (wish more hotels had them), but found the beds matresses a little too well used (they dipped in the middle). Overall excellent though! Recommend for families.

Reviews.Title: “loved it - i am surprised by the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: katiesam
Reviews.Content: ok, it was a couple of years ago now and i cannot account for what the hotel is like now, but i had a brilliant stay. I stayed at the Avalon for 4 nights with my cousin, aunt and grandmother. Room was very clean, the shower was lovely, very powerful unlike other hotels. beds were made everyday, maid cleaned everyday. Breakfast was delicious! continental breakfast also included cakes. My aunt and cousin returned to the Avalon Nov 2007 and said they had a similar experience to the years before and i am hopeing to book to go back again this year.

Reviews.Title: “4 star it is not, perhaps 2!”
Reviews.Author: Jerrais
Reviews.Content: Where to start......if you like your hotels with quirky aspects because they lend character then this is for you. First up, check- in fine & friendly, all appears ok. The room however was not made up and we arrived around 17.30. The room was described as a Junior Suite. Well if two Queen size beds in very close proximity and around 10 foot square living space is a Junior suite then you'll be happy. Total room dimensions around 25x10 feet and gloomy with it. View dismal out back - see picture. Anyway room changed quick enough but when we by chance collared resident cleaner he asked that reception check with him before allocating next room so as to ensure that they had made it up....who is running this place I wonder? Further problems ensued, turn one of two TVs on and the sound comes out at full blast, the other TV has only half a picture - noisy TV once volume turned down then turns itself off after 1/2 hour for no apparent reason. Turn it on again and you are back at full volume! Reported problems to reception who promised something would be done. Nothing happened. The air con seemed jammed on boiling, registering 85 deg F when returned in evenings, fortunately window part opens to let cool night air in - it was in the low 20's deg F! As above reported to reception to no avail. Night safe didn't open and, as above, reported but no follow up. Otherwise the place is clean and as my better half described it as 'Georgian distressed elegance' - I think this is very apt. Four stars for this - you have to be kidding me! Hotel Bar - yep this only appears to open weekends. Breakfasts are good if pricey. So thats the bad side, is there any good I hear you ask? Well location is excellent, 2 minutes from the Empire State Building, 5 mins from Macy's. Close to subway (buy Metrocard for $7 and travel as much as you like in 24 hours - kids under 12 go free - available in subways at ATM style kiosks everywhere). Thats the good bit. I have no axe to grind against this place and it should be much better. I really wanted it to be good but perhaps I was just unlucky. It looks the business on the website but it is tired. I have no yardstick to benchmark other mid town Manhattan hotels but an NY acquaintance of mine described the area as much improved upon from early 90's when it was distinctly dodgy - touch of the Korean district to it. I felt comfortable here, more so than say London. Other than that , loved New York, come back home for a rest after five days. Would I stay at the Avalon again? I'm afraid not unless subsequent Trip Advisor reviews tell me its picked up.

Reviews.Title: “A total rip-off. One star quality pretending to be a four star hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC_Connoisseur
Reviews.Content: The only way this hotel stays in business is by hooking people through hotwire by calling itself four star and by fleecing Italian tourists (it's Italian owned) who can't do anything about it once they get to NYC. The hotel has shabby furniture, horrible mattresses, and amenities that are consistent with a Motel 6. There is no room service, the front desk staff is indifferent, and it's clear that they know you got suckered. The "junior suite" I got was classified as such because the one room had a sofa and a coffee table. STAY AWAY

Reviews.Title: “Very Poor Standards at the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: Vicbee
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a 5 night stay at the hotel and have to say it was the worst hotel I’ve ever stayed at. The hotel is very run down and shabby, the management was non-existent and the staff all incompetent, on one occasion a girl at reception was sleeping in the back room! On our first morning we had no water to shower, none of the staff could tell me what the situation was or when we’d have water back on, we received no apology and there wasn’t a General Manager for us to speak with. When the water did come back on it was brown! To top it off our shower broke but no-one came to fix it so my husband had to do it himself. Our key cards to the room didn’t work. We were on the 10th floor and had to constantly go back down to get new cards. We had a sheet to cover us at night, no duvet just a shabby blanket in the cupboard if we got cold - January in NYC is very cold! The curtains were filthy and the handle on the mini bar had broken off. On our last night we asked for a wake up call as we had to be up early for our flight home but we didn't get the call, luckily we woke up! Upon returning home I have discovered the hotel has charged me twice for the reservation which means I’m having to go through my bank and wait 15 days for reimbursement. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone and do not feel the hotel should be classed as ‘superior deluxe’ as it is far from it, I've stayed in nicer hostels.

Reviews.Title: “OK, but expensive”
Reviews.Author: sb5000
Reviews.Content: My room was nice and big. The furnishings were a bit old but in nice condition. If you get a room in the back of the hotel, don’t look out the window as it’s a horrible site. It was an alley loaded with garbage. The breakfast was good with a nice selection of everything and the free internet connection was fast. Of course being New York, the rates were extremely expensive. For business, it’s ok but for someone on vacation, I’d look for a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: MarkHustwit
Reviews.Content: Recently returned from a 5 night stay at this hotel whilst travelling with my girlfriend and 4 other adults. The hotel is situated very conveniently near the Empire State Building, the Subway and the shops. The location is excellent! The communal areas in the hotel are very clean, elegant and comfortable. There is a bar open 5pm - 11pm which is not really long enough, a library with free internet access which is excellent, a restaurant where breakfast is served and is good quality assuming you do not leave is to late! There is a wide choice of hot and cold food as well as fruit and the cost is $21 per person. The reception is 24 hour and i have to say that generally we found the staff really helpful, they booked our helicopter tour which was unfortunately cancelled due to high winds. We had a JR Suite which was not as big as i thought it would be and was also rather dated however it was more than comfortable, cleaned every day and served the purpose for the limited time that we were in it! Do note that you can't check in till 3pm. Just a quick tip - under the Empire Stare building there are guys in red jackets selling tours. We purchased the Empire State building trip to the top, unlimited bus tours for 3 days around Manhattan downtown and uptown and Brooklyn. We also did the water taxi round the statue of Liberty and we got all this for $80 which we thought was good value!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Little Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Retired2001DeBary_FL
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-night stay at the Avalon and would absoultely stay there again. We took two of our grandaughters with us (ages 8 & 9) and stayed in a Junior Suite (#1106). It was perfect for us. Laminate hardwood floors that absolutely shined; large all-marble bathroom; 2 queen-sized beds (and a fold out sofa; plenty of lamps/lights and lots of windows (on two sides of the room). There was a lot of drawer space (I think 10 full-sized drawers) and a closet. The two televisions were a God-send (they could watch their shows at night and we could watch ours). Our room was very quiet...heard very little of the outside noise. Perhaps our room had been recently redone, but we saw no evidence of the "tired" rooms that some people mentioned. Our room looked very much like the rooms depicted on the hotel's website. I did not include a picture of our room because it would have been a disservice to the hotel to take a picture after "our girls" had spread their stuff all around the room. The staff were helpful and friendly (particularly the bellhop). We were able to store our luggage before we checked in and after we checked in. The only problem that we had was a glitch in the heating system. Fortunately, it was too warm rather than too cold and we solved the problem by turning off the heat during the night (it only dropped to 69) and then turned it on in the morning. Someone came up to our room when we discovered the problem on our second night, but the engineer had already left for the day and we could not get it fixed. Overall, a great little hotel that we will defintely stay in again on our next vist. It was very very clean, friendly, great location and very roomy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: jan78wor
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay. The hotel stay were friendly. The rooms were clean and spacious. It is just around the corner from the Empire State Building and 5th avenue, you wouldn't find a better hotel in this location! high recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: misssusita
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at this hotel. I was a little worried about the mixed reviews, but have to say that we really enjoyed our stay in a junior suite. The room was large and was kept clean and tidy. The only complaint that could be made was that the lighting was very gloomy. The staff were always curteous and helpful, especially the barman and the doormen. I would recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “we love it X”
Reviews.Author: JamesBond0007
Reviews.Content: Great location , nice friendly staff. The whole stay for 5 nights was great. Its a little noisy but its the city that never sleeps for heavens sake. Tip is find the La Quinta hotel its 200 yds one the same street as the hotel going towards the empire state. Go in and up the lift to the Sky bar, order a French Martini ( tell them Sasha from england sent you ) and enjoy the wicked view of the empire state . Also around the corner try Jimmys coffee shop for breakfast, Proper american diner. Have fun and do go to the Sky bar at night !!

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!!!”
