Reviews.Author: josrook
Reviews.Content: A group of four of us (all ladies from the UK) arrived at this hotel at 1.p.m. in the morning to find that our junior suite which had been booked by us in January had been given to someon else. They offered us another room that contained 1 double bed which was of no use to us at all. You really need this after a seven and a half hour flight!! We had to move to another hotel for one night and then come back to the Avalon for the other 5 nights into a suite that was a far cry from the lovely photos on their website. Their idea of compensation for this mess was to give us a voucher for a free hotel breakfast which we could have gone to a Diner and bought for about 10 dollars each anyway. The Manager there was a complete waste of space and really did not want to know about our complaint and his staff were about as helpful as he was. My advice if travelling to New York is DO NOT STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fine!”
Reviews.Author: Leanne_S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here here for 4 nights in November. The rooms were nice and the location was great. There were a couple of little problems - the AC/heater would come on intermittantly when the temperature in the room dropped below a certain point which was a bit annoying as it was quite loud but my husband managed to sort it out. Also the restaurant was closed for breakfast on Thanksgiving but we didn't get a refund on our bill, but its not a big deal. I will say that once tax etc. gets added onto the final bill the room rate may be more than you think. We reserved through Opodo but I checked the room rate with the hotel via email before we went so we didn't get a surprise when we got the bill but it was more than I originally thought it was going to be when I booked. On the plus side, the rooms were nice and clean and always tidied, the breakfast was nice and newspapers were left on your door in the morning. All in all a very comfortable stay, I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: RITraveler55
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for Thanksgiving parade. The junior suite was large and comfortable. However, the room was poorly lit and had worn, shabby furnishings. They definitely need to improve the lighting and replace the very old furniture. If you can over look the above, the room was clean and the beds comfortable. We found the staff to be very helpful. I would recommend the hotel if you are understand its limitations.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel until the last day”
Reviews.Author: DublinDancer
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 4 night stay at the avalon hotel. great hotel i was worried after reading some reviews but it shined. rooms were cleaned everyday and a newspaper left on your door every morning. great location of macys and esb but a bit of a walk to everything else(approx 15mins). be warned when booking a car with the hotel make sure they order it even if you do pay a deposit. i had the experience of them not booking a car and they then had to get the bellboy to hail a car the driver of this car was brining us to the wrong airport and didnt have good english, but this was the only bad experience would book here agian.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Zippy13
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a girlie shopping week in September 2006. The hotel didn't have much in the way of ameneties, but the rooms were a good size for Manhattan. Check in staff weren't the happiest but the guy who took our bags to our room was great. He told us about things to do in the area and got us a cab. Had a few problems with the room, lightbulbs not working, door handle hanging off the shower.....hotel did sort this for us quickly, but the room should have been checked over before we checked in. The hotel is just round the corner from the Empire State Building where you can get an open top bus from & Macey's is about 5mins walk. There is a great Bagel shop on the corner and a pizza slicery too. I would stay here again as it is a great location & got a good deal with Opodo.

Reviews.Title: “hated the avalon”
Reviews.Author: bocamimi
Reviews.Content: just returned from a 5 night stay and had alot of problems. First of all no ac the first night and it was very hot. We complained to the front desk and they were very rude. The second night the ac worked but was very loud and we could not sleep very well. The management was not very nice and couldn't care less that we were not happy with our room. This was our third year at the hotel and I have to say that since it changed ownership it is definitely not the same. We will never book this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “As good as last time”
Reviews.Author: Happytraveller22
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the Avalon previously we had no hesitation in booking it for our party of 8. The location is superb, close to the Empire State Building, Macy's and a variety of restaurants. All 4 of our rooms were clean and welcoming. The staff were all friendly and helpful and our stay was just as pleasant as last time. The rooms were all large and well equipped, far better than the room we had at a much more expensive hotel, which was part of a well known chain that we stayed in once before. I would happily stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Just right”
Reviews.Author: barryuk
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 nights here. Friendly staff. Clean and well-appointed rooms with lovely marble bathroom. Coffee maker for the mornings. No restaurant (so what - who needs a hotel rest. in New York???) Older hotel means thick walls; never heard anyone once inside the room. Lovely big windows, with a view of the top of Empire State Building. 50 yards from Empire State; 200 yards from Line 6 subway, 500 yards from Manhattan Mall and multi-line 34th Street subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a party of 5”
Reviews.Author: 1stjayhawk
Reviews.Content: We loved the Avalon and the price! Very nice room. Valet service, two tvs, very comfy beds and a mini bar. What more could you ask for? WE loved it and will definitely book again. Close to most everything. The deli on the corner had a wonderful breakfast for <$5. There was a Japanese restaurant across the street. Lot's of food locales. We were with a group of 9 and we were all satisfied with the accomodations.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel at a great price”
Reviews.Author: JemSylv
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in a number of 'budget' hotels in New York, I thought I'd step outside the usual price range (although this wasn't that much more expensive than the hovels I have suffered). This hotel suited my needs perfectly. I had been upgraded to a junior suite automatically, the staff were efficient, polite and friendly. The location is good for a visit (two blocks from the Empire State building, but far enough from the melee that is Times Sq/42nd St). The room and housekeeping were excellent. There isn't any room service, but that's fine as I don't use it anyway. Some people would complain about a crack in one of the windows, but if you do, you're far too picky. It made no difference to my stay. I'd recommend this hotel as a great base for a trip to New York

Reviews.Title: “Reservation cancelled - Now fighting for credit card refund!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nikki156
Reviews.Content: My party of 4 were due to stay at the Avalon for 5 nights in September. Our airline cancelled our flights and so we were forced to fly with an alternative airline. Upon contacting the hotel by phone to change our dates with them, I was advised that my new dates were unavailable due to the hotel being full. This was disappointing for us but not the hotels fault. I informed the hotel that I would need to cancel my reservation completely and find alternative accomodation. The rude hotel member of staff advised that they had cancelled my booking and I asked for confirmation to be sent by email. After 1 week I had not received any such confirmation so contacted the hotel again to check the cancellation had been actioned. I was told I would receive an email and waited. I decided to send an email so that I would have proof of my request in writing. This email was sent several times over the period of a few weeks asking for a response to acknowledge my requests. I never received one! My fantastic trip to NYC has now been and gone and upon returning had the lovely surprise of a $270 charge on my credit card for a no show! Despite contacting the hotel to request my refund, hotel staff are rude, abrupt have have no intentions of processing my refund and have even hung up on me!! After several international phone calls and emails that I don't receive replies to. This is now in the hands of Visa who will have to battle it out with the hotel before I get my money back. Once I had been forced to cancel my reservation, this scenario became a worry of mine as I had read on TA that other guests cancelling reservations before their stay had also received no show charges and battled to get their money back. I guess this is a common occurence with this hotel and the only reason my rating is 1, is because I can't give it 0!! Whilst I can't comment on a stay at the hotel. My comments are based on the service I have received over the phone since my initial booking and the fact that the hotel are clearly out to charge guests that have cancelled well in advance!! Sorry for the long winded review I just don't want other potential guests to find themselves in the same situation!!! Avoid the stress and avoid this place at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: fluffybundles
Reviews.Content: The location of the Avalon is great, just around the corner of the Empire State Building and, if you walk Madison NOT 5th Avenue, you can be at Central Park in about 15 minutes. The hotel itself, what can I say. The room was small but we were expecting that for New York. The bathroom, however, was huge. I would have preferred the space was used in the room. It was reported to be a queen size bed but it was more like a small double. The staff was not helpful at all. We have been able to cash travellers cheques in every location but here. We reported the first morning that our hairdryer wasn't working and she added it to the huge list of other complaints. It was never fixed. Breakfast buffet $19?? We didn't try it.

Reviews.Title: “What do some people want?”
Reviews.Author: DIBSTER
Reviews.Content: "Tired" paintwork? Just how long do some people sit in their rooms looking at the paintwork! This is NEW YORK for goodness sakes, drop off your bags and get out there, don't sit in the hotel looking for little faults. My wife and I spent 4 nights here at the end of September, unfortunately this clashed with the General Assembly get together at the UN and as a consequence the NY traffic was something to behold, the jams and how NY'ers drive through it is a tourist attraction of its own. We found the staff very friendly and helpful, a problem with the plumbing (a common theme apparently) was sorted with no fuss within 30 mins. The room itself was large with two double beds, two TV's and a sitting room with a well stocked fridge which we did not use. We did not bother with the USD 19.00 breakfast, instead went to the Brooklyn Bagel Cafe just across the street for an excellent breakfast for under USD 5.00 each. (tip: try the "Hungry Man Hero" for USD 3.75 - that will set you up all day) Excellent location for getting about town, Empire State Bldg 2 mins away (tip: go there for 8.00am when it opens and beat the queues). For a 4 night stay it is impossible to see everywhere, but when we come back my wife and I would have no qualms about staying at the Vincci again, but not when the UN are meeting and the President is in town..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: saintgerry
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel back in January after reading the generally good reviews, however I started to worry as I read the reviews in the lead up to our holiday. However now that I have stayed there all I can say is that there are some really fussy people out there. Sure the decor was a bit tired and maybe in need of a coat of paint but other than that both the hotel and staff were excellent. The toilet backed up on the last morning and it would have been easy for the staff not to worry about it as we were checking out that morning however it was fixed within half an hour. The location was as good as I could have wished for, the neighbourhood was as welcoming and friendly as could be expected. The bagel shop on the corner does a fantastic breakfast that's so cheap you feel as though you are getting it for free and for a decent meal at night you could do a lot worse than try the Heartland brewery restaurant across the street. If I was going to NY again I would look no further than this hotel and would recommend that others do the same.

Reviews.Title: “Moldy Bathtub”
Reviews.Author: et-toronto
Reviews.Content: August 22 to 25, 2007. We have stayed at this hotel several times over the last 6 years but have not been back since 2005! There is new ownership. On first glance, the hotel has been somewhat updated a couple of years ago, but on closer look, it is simply cosmetic (same beds, same furniture etc). Everything is tired. Bedspread was stained, furniture chipped and scratched badly and the worst was the bathtub...very moldy. Housekeeping and management came right up to take a look, but they were only able to give us a somewhat better room the next day. My father's room had a similar situation but he chose not to complain about it. In the past, our room had breakfast included; this time breakfast would have cost an additional $19.00 per person!!! I likely will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “No free breakfast, poor concierge & blocked toilet”
Reviews.Author: gs1234
Reviews.Content: First the good part - This hotel was located in a great location just off fifth avenue beside the empire state building. We also got a good deal on a three night stay and a suite with an extra fold down sofa bed for 2 adults and 2 kids. The total for 3 nights for the 4 of us in july was 750 dollars which was an excellent deal. Now the bad part - concierge was extremely rude and gave out to us because he didn't do his job properly in bringing our bags to our room and his manager gave out to him! He expected us to leave our valuable possessions sitting in the lobby unattended until he was ready to bring them up! The concierge also got us an unofficial lincoln cab for our return trip to JFK and more than likely took a backhander of 10 dollars! The web site confirmed that there was a free breakfast and free coffee and pastries in the lobby all day - not true! The breakfast was buffet and cost us 19 dollars each. There was no coffee or pastries - weekdays or weekend! We could have had a much nicer breakfast served to us by a waitress on Lexington ave around the corner for 5 dollars each. This is what we did for the second and third mornings! The toilet backed up and flooded our bathroom. It took three phone calls, a personal visit by me to reception and 2 hours later to get somebody up to the room to repair it! Overall we didn't stay in the room much as we were out and about in NYC so we were not too bothered. My advice is - if you have two kids then stay here but if your are a single traveller or a couple - use your felxibility to get somewhere with better service!

Reviews.Title: “The Awesome Avalon”
Reviews.Author: NFPD
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just returned from a three day shopping crusade in NYC. We had a fantastic time and the Vincci Avalon was a great place to stay. The room was a nice size (not to big, not to small) and very clean. I asked for extra pillows I received them within five minutes. The staff was always helpful and kind. We were not looking for food or any extras(even though they have some) just a clean, comfy place and we got it. Some other friends were staying at the Gershwin- disgusting and they paid more than we did for much, much less. The room, I felt was reasonably priced for New York City. The location was fantastic, very central and easy to get to subways, train to Newark (Penn Station close), or walk to the thousands of restaurants nearby. We felt very safe in this neighbourhood and as a police officer, I was looking for goings on- nothing. Lots places to eat with all price ranges within a two block radius. Great Irish pub, about 4 blocks, called The Blarney Stone. Very happy I will return to this location in the future

Reviews.Title: “Loved the avalon. Glad we chose to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: MisterX71uk
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel back in February for our stay in August as we had sent the kids off to summer camp for a week. The reviews back then were excellent and I have to admit I was a bit concerned with the reviews that I had read just before we left for NY but we soon found those reviews to be completely untrue. The staff were extremely helpfull and friendly (with the exception of one member that took her time to warm to us but was fine after that), The concierges were excellent, friendly and nothing was any trouble to these guys. We booked a junior suit and initially felt slightly let down with the room but at $950 for 4 nights it was well worth it. (always looks better on the web site). The location is excellent with the Empire state less than 5 mins up the road and the Bagel shop on the corner served a massive breakfast for both of us for $8!!! Bargain. Madison Square Garden 10 mins away and Macys 5mins. Overall we really enjoyed our stay at the Avalon and we will stay here again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: TravellingMan101
Reviews.Content: My wife and I frequently travel to New York and therefore have stayed at many hotels in the city. This was our first stay at the Avalon. Overall we were pleased with the room. It was spacious and clean (hardwood floors which was a nice touch). We did encounter issues in regards to minor amentities such as umbrellas and internet, however they were small enough of worries that it did not hurt our opinion of the hotel. Given the right price, we would stay at the Avalon again. Please see photos of our room (#602). It was a standard room as far as we know.

Reviews.Title: “is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: faroadviser
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family in 20 july for 5 nights. The rooms are very clean and quiet. Staff was always friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet is very good for the usual American standard. .

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JustAMomArizona
Reviews.Content: Great location. Two blocks from Empire State Building, subway and close to everything else. The rooms are large, clean and more than expected. The staff was always friendly and very helpful. I did not eat at the restaurant because there are so many delis & restaurants within walking distance - so I can not comment on the food. Would Absolutely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “No problems”
Reviews.Author: QCC001
Reviews.Content: Previous reviews mention labor dispute. No evidence of that as of June 26, 2007. Air conditioning worked perfectly. Room made up perfectly each day. Didn't visit restaurant for breakfast. Deli down the street sells a bagel/egg/bacon/cheese sandwich freshly made for $2.00. 4 of us ate breakfast,including fruits and drinks, for under $20.00 each day. I was able to use a high speed signal in room for free (don't believe it is provided by hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful time!”
Reviews.Author: BORI12
Reviews.Content: We have no complains. The staff was professional and very helpful. The room was kept very tidy. Room service was very efficient. The breakfast buffet a bit over priced. Overall experience was above average.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Night Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: edelnot
Reviews.Content: A bride A groom A limo and NO hotel.The winners at the Avalon over booked, so that we had to find elsewhere to stay in the middle of the night, no real apology no compensation no warning nothing.so i cant tell you how the Avalon is they never let us stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best find in NY”
Reviews.Author: kappen123
Reviews.Content: Our stay was very good. The location of the hotel could not have been better, just a couple blocks from the subway station in each direction. It was in the center of Manhattan making every attraction easy to get to. The hotel was clean (no cockroaches for us!!!). We stayed on the 10th floor in a double suite. Very large bedding area, bathroom, and a reasonable-sized seating area. For the price of a hotel room in NY, we could not have been happier!!! It was VERY reasonably priced for the quality. The staff were helpful and the lobby warm. Our room faced the street side (32nd) and were pleasantly surprised the noise was minimal. I would recommend this hotel for three reasons: price, location, and spaciousness. We had a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Cockroach hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilyTaylor
Reviews.Content: On a positive note...first impressions of the hotel were very good, all the pictures on the website are correct and location wise you couldn't get any better, for that reason alone I would, despite my disapointing stay recommend the hotel to friends.Our stay firstly was spoilt by the picket lines that stayed outside the hotel for the entire duration. We were verbally heckled each and every time we came in and out of the hotel which was extremely upsetting as this was our honeymoon! The reception staff (male) couldn't have cracked a smile if his life depended on it, and did nothing to reassure us of the situation and unfortunately as we paid in full 6 months before our stay to Expedia, they had their money so no effort was made to make sure we were comfortable. If this wasn't bad enough we realised on our last night of the 4 night stay that we shared our room the whole time with cockroach's, being in the junior suite on the 12th floor this amazed us. This was supposed to be a clean and respectable hotel but we couldn't get out fast enough. My husband finally caught the critter and disposed of it, but overall the general hygene in the room was poor. In the 4 days we stayed the floor had never been swept or cleaned as the same dirt was on the floor the whole time. We paid around £140 per night so expected more.....

Reviews.Title: “Customer service is not available”
Reviews.Author: maggieManitoba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon Hotel May 9 to May 14th. We had a Jr. Suite which was very nice accomodations. Our first trip to NY. Union people were picketing in front of the hotel waking us up very early in the mornings and they were back late afternoon. They were harassing the hotel guests as guests were coming out and into the hotel. We complained to the hotel manager but he said it is not their fault. The hotel staff didn't seem to know what was going on?????? I told the mgr that they should be looking after their hotel guests and should have security posted outside the hotel so the guests weren't being hasseled. We did not appreciate their "I don't care attitude" and the hotel wouldn't even give the guests a complimentary breakfast, nothing.... We liked the hotel and the location which made it convenient but I doubt I will stay there again if I come back to NY.

Reviews.Title: “RUDE service, no air conditioning and picketters”
Reviews.Author: dtour_7
Reviews.Content: So bad we changed hotels mid-trip! Arrived early on a Weds morning but were told we could not check in at all early, which is fine, I guess. When we got to the room, we were impressed with the size. The Jr. Suite was spacious for 3 people and not bad decor. That's where the impressing ended. We soon realized our room was very hot and no matter how low we set the thermostat, it just continued to blow hot air. We called about this for 3 days in a row, and even when they came to look at it, they didn't stay long or do anything to fix it. The last time we called, no one ever even came up! We tried to communicate with the managment, to which they only got completely defensive and made some excuse for not being able to resolve the matter until Monday and promised to call then, which of course they didn't. All of the staff was extremely rude throughout the entire stay and forget about luxuries like a bellhop to help with our luggage or an ice machine on the floor. The water temperature on the shower would go from cool to scolding without notice and eventually, the knob just fell off. At that point, we checked out and after one final argument with the manager, transferred to The Dylan down the street which was the same price and beyond compare in amenities and service. The switch completely saved our trip and by the time the picketters outside (who have been hackling us all week - appearently this has been going on for some time) cheered as we left with our luggage, we finally understood.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mannen30
Reviews.Content: our stay at this hotel was a nightmare. Union protesters shouted all day long and they were quite impolite when we got in and out the hotel. The staff at the hotel was imcompetent and it took at least half an hour to ask a simple question. They gave us a smoking room despite the fact that we had booked a non-smoking room 2 month before. And when I told them that I couldn't stay in a smoking room, they went on saying that we indeed had booked a smoking room and we could get a new room first thing in the morning. We had to accept that since we had no place to go. The next morning we got new keys to an other room. When we opened the door, there were people staying in that room. It was so awkward!!!! When I got back to the reception, I had to wait half an hour for them to get us an other room. They weren't even sorry. They just stood there talking to each other, giving each other high fives. I have to say that this was my worst stay at a hotel and I have stayed at many hotels around the world. As the union protesters said: Don't check in, CHECK OUT!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jackholl0
Reviews.Content: It's funny how people have different experiences of the same hotel at similar times of visiting. My family stayed here over Easter 2007 and it was great. Nice room, nice staff, fantastic location. We could not fault the place. We would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Experience so bad we changed hotels after two nights”
Reviews.Author: tjcm
Reviews.Content: Do not stay at this hotel until they resolve their labor issues. They are short on staff and those that remain are rude and/or inexperienced. The service is poor which is reflected in the appearance and quality of the room. (Telephone did not work, no shampoo, limited supply of towels, glasses, cups, etc.) Check-in was long and check-out was even worse. Union protesters are at the entrance of the hotel chanting and marching and using megaphones to emphasize their discontent. When we checked-out early due to our disatifaction, we were still charged an additional night penalty which Expedia has refused to reimburse. My advice is book a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Miserably harrassed by strikers and hotel Didn't Care”
Reviews.Author: hummingbirdonfire
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was marginal, to say the least. Upon check in, which was close to midnight, the hotel bellman just sat, and read his paper, while we struggled with our bags. Not one offered to assist us with them, which was RUDE and VERY POOR SERVICE. The air conditioning system was awful, and the elevators were very small. Also, the hotel staff was striking outside the only entrance and exit there is. EVERY TIME we left, or returned to the hotel, we were HARASSED, with a megaphone in our faces, called names, and told that we should be ashamed for staying at this hotel. We paid top dollar to stay here, but when asked to be compensated for the harrassment that we received, the whole 5 days we were there, they offered NO COMPENSATION, stating that that is what the strikers wanted, and they would not concede to their demands. When we booked this hotel, there was no mention of the problems, and no discount given, in lieu of them. I can understand the hotel allowing harassment of their employees, since it is THEIR issue, BUT I CAN'T UNDERSTAND HOW THEY CAN ALLOW IT TO HAPPEN TO THEIR PATRONS, AND NOT BE WILLING TO COMPENSATE THEM SOMEHOW. I advise not to stay at a place that won't take care of their customers, strike, or no strike.

Reviews.Title: “Bedroom too hot, No Air Conditioning”
Reviews.Author: Joelly
Reviews.Content: We booked into the hotel for a total of 13 nights but stayed only 2. The Hotel website claimed to have AIR CONDITIOING but the bedrooms were 80 degrees day and night. The reception desk eventually admitted that the airconditioning is not switched on until June and July, at which time the heating was switched off as they could not run the two systems independently. I think it is disingenuine to claim to have airconditioning when it is not switched on until June each year. We kept the window open to the maximum of 2" and there was no airflow and the temperature in the bedroom did not drop below 80 degrees even at night when it was cool outside. The Avalon was clean and well decorated, the restaurant was good, but if you cannot get to sleep because of the heat, it is failing in the most basic requirement for a hotel. Thankfully we moved to a great hotel in the next street and had a wonderful stay there. .

Reviews.Title: “Very noisey picket line!!! ahh!!”
Reviews.Author: UsaGlobe_trotter_88
Reviews.Content: This is a nice hotel BUT there is a picket line for some sort of labor union that wakes you up at SEVEN in the MORNING. THEY DO NOT STOP. YOU CAN HEAR THEM FROM THE EIGHTH FLOOR. The rooms and the service were otherwise good IF YOU ARE DEAF. I would reccomend this place if there was not a NOISY, INCESSANT STRIKE. ugh. I asked for my $$ back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: hlcnyc
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avalon hotel for 8 nights with two friends at the end of April/start of May. We found the room (junior suite) to be very spacious with plenty of wardrobe and drawer space for all our many clothes! All the staff were very friendly and always there to help us with any questions, they also organised our car back to the airport - we would have got the train from Penn Station as it would have been cheaper, but our cases were far too heavy after a weeks shopping!!:o) This hotel is in a fantastic location, literally a minutes walk from the empire state, 10 minutes to Macys, and about the same distance to the nearest subway station. Theres a fab Korean jewellry and bag shop a couple shops down the same street called Kosy, where we all bought earrings and presents, and American Eagle Outfitters are fantastic for Tshirts. The only downside of the Avalon hotel was that our room was far too hot all of the time, as they dont switch the air conditioning on until June, and the thermostat was set to 80degrees permanently - but to be honest most nights we were all so tired it didnt affect us!!There is a lot of noise at night and starting early in the morning, so we had to keep the windows shut, which didnt help with the temperature!! Overall though this hotel is an ideal base for a trip to New York, and I would stay there again in an instant.

Reviews.Title: “Economical Hotel Near Theater District”
Reviews.Author: LakeMichiganBoater
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to NYC for a theater weekend, and this was the most cost effective hotel I could find "near" the theater district. We had a junior suite for an average of $290 per night for three nights. The room was large, clean, and had a king sized bed. The hotel was around the corner from two places on Madison where we could buy fruit and croissants for breakfast in the hotel, using the coffee maker in the room. The hotel was a 20 minute walk from the theater district. This meant that we could stay at the hotel, and have dinner, for the same price as hotels which were "in," or within a block, from the theaters.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location & clean ~ all you need in Manhattan !”
Reviews.Author: butterfly_place
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfect, Its in the best location just steps from empire state building, macy's and starbucks !!!! And just a walk from Times Square, Broadway & Fifth avenue. Very friendly & Clean hotel. Complementary Breakfast Buffet served every morning a great start to your day exploring manhattan !!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vincci Avalon”
Reviews.Author: SJERushden
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is! We booked a junior suite for 2 adults & a four year old for 4 nights & it was ideal. The room was large with a comfortable double bed and a sofa bed and plenty of room in between. It even had a 2 TV's, one opposite each bed! The bathroom was large & very clean with a bath & shower. We are very fussy over cleanliness & often cringe when our daughter plays on the floor, but we had no worries here, it was spotless. The staff were friendly & helpful & always able to answer any questions about New York. We were room only, but decided to have breakfast in the hotel each morning because it was easier & there was an extremely good buffet selection, catering for all requirements. It was perhaps a little expensive - with tips approx $50 per day (for 2 adults) but we didn't mind as it was good. The location of the hotel was fantastic, about 50 metres from 5th Avenue and Madison Avenue and another 100 metres to the Empire State Building. Macy's was a 10 minute walk away & the nearest Subway about 15 mins. Overall a great hotel in a fantastic location & we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great location great staff”
Reviews.Author: DublinScouser
Reviews.Content: Just spent 4 nights at the AVALON and can recommend it to anyone. Hotel was clean and tidy, staff very helpful and willing to help. Location ideal just 150 yards from EMPIRE STATE. FAULTS, Room was too warm and heating etc controlled by main reception also internet access is one pc downstairs not in room as indicated. Breakfast was nice but at $42 for 2 people is dear. Loads places nearby get a good full breakfast for 6/8 dollars Would recommend AVALON to anybody looking for good hotel in an ideal central location. James and Carmel (dublin ireland )

Reviews.Title: “Would recommend to anyone”
Reviews.Author: Missy1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at hotel in early March with three friends. Our room was very spacious with 2 beds and a sitting area. This was the junior suite. The bathroom was lovely with double sinks and separate shower and bath. Room was always spotless and we were promptly given extra towels when we requested them. I didn't eat at the hotel as there are so many good restuarants in New York but the menu looked really good. The staff were very helpful especially the doormen. They provided umbrellas when raining and had no problem orgainising cars to the airport. If and when I go back to New York, the Avalon would certainly be on my list of Hotels to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Great Space”
Reviews.Author: BLGAW
Reviews.Content: My two teenage daughters and I stayed at the Avalon Mar. 12-15, 2007. I booked on Hotwire for approx. $212.50/nt. The room was on the 5th floor and when we exited the elevator, we noticed that the carpet was a little worn. Entering our room we noticed the wood floor creaked as we walked across it. (We were concerned that this might bother other tenants, but no one ever complained.) Our room consisted of 2 queen size beds in one room and a sleeper sofa in a separate sitting area. We feel the rooms were very large for us, as was the bathroom which consisted of a counter with double sinks, toilet, standing glass shower and a separate bath tub. There were always plenty of towels as well. The only complaint we had was the location of the shower head in the shower. Our heights range from 4'-10" to 5'-1". However the shower head was at least 7' high. We could not adjust it so we had to call maintenance to come adjust it for us. Maintenance came very quickly, but he could not adjust it to point any lower than it already was. So he ended up pointing it toward the back wall a little so we had a little more room. Since we were on the 5th floor, we did experience some traffic noise in the early mornings, but a trip to the local Duane Reade Drug store for ear plugs rectified that problem. Subways were very close and we took them everywhere. (If you are staying 3 days or longer, I suggest that you purchase the unlimited subway passes.) We also walked alot. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the Empire State Building on 32nd Street between Madison and 5th Avenue and we felt very safe walking around at night. All in all, we enjoyed our stay at the Avalon hotel. Staff was very nice, congenial and quite knowledgeable about transportation to any part of the city. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant because there are so many other restaurants in NYC to choose from. We would definitely stay here again and possibly ask for a room on a higher floor to avoid the traffic noise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travelling_City_Girl
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over spring break with our teenage son and for the most part, the hotel was great. I loved the room with the wood floors, living room, very large bathroom with two sinks, and I loved that the living room was by the window. It allowed for the noise and darkness level in the bedroom area to be just right at night (for NYC.) We didn't eat in the hotel and I had heard that breakfast was pricey. There is a good coffee shop and a great bagel/breakfast place just on the corner. Definitely eat at one of those before heading out for your day. On the day we left, which was the day after it suddenly snowed, the doorman was extremely helpful in getting a cab, which he had to go to the cross street to get. The only problem that we encountered was that one morning there was no water in the entire hotel! And it didn't come back on until about 12:30 p.m. It made getting ready a huge problem. Since we were on a leisure vacation, we were ok with getting ready with bottled water, but if you were there on business and had to be at a meeting, it wouldn't have been a good situation. I have stayed in NYC a few times and this was by far the biggest room and bathroom I have stayed in. Also, having queen beds instead of double beds was awesome. For traveling with a family, it is a great choice in NYC. I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel okay for the price”
Reviews.Author: Bridgit
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avalon in January with a couple of friends. The hotel was okay and it was a good price for New York. The rooms were really small but that's to be expected. We had two rooms and one room was fine but the other smelled of mildew. When we discovered that the smelll was coming from the shower curtain in the bathroom, we asked the front desk if we could have it changed. They said that they would rectify the situation while we were out for dinner. When we returned to the room, some sort of heavily perfumed deodorizer had been sprayed in the bathroom but the shower curtain had not been changed. When the sickening perfume smell wore off, the mildew odour was back. The location of the hotel was not the greatest (Murray Hill) but it was close to the subway. There really weren't a lot of options for dinner nearby or any place we could find to grab a nightcap. The hotel bar closes quite early.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value”
Reviews.Author: dusty450
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from the Vincii Avalon and having read some of the earlier reviews here I think I stayed at the wrong hotel! The room was enormous for two people - we had two bathrobes, two beds and two TV's. I only tried one telly and that worked fine - however who needs to watch TV when you are in NYC? The first night we did have a few problems with the air conditioning coming on in the night which was quite noisy however next day I worked out how to use the wall control. Didn't need to go via reception - for info if you are thinking of staying here you just press mode then choose system heat or off and fan auto or off - when it is warm enough just turn the fan off and if you don't want it to come on in the night just turn the sytem off - sorted!! All the staff were very helpful - especially the bellboys. I did not eat at the hotel but did use Brooklyn Bagels - try the Turkey treat smoked turkey, cranberry, swiss cheese and lettuce for $5 it was so impressive I took a picture of it to show my husband back home!! Also had two delicious breakfasts at the Martinique Cafe on Greely Square just around the corner a bit more pricey than the bagels however you do get a ceramic plate and real cutlery! I had blueberry pancakes and a South of the Border breakfast which filled me til tea time. Any way back to the hotel - excellent location, clean room which did not smell of smoke, comfortable room and extremely comfortable bed - if i had to pick up on anything i would say the water pressure is really low so it takes about 30 mins to fill the bath and the lift is equally relaxed but hey i was on holiday so its no big deal. Would recommend and use again as the location is excellent for the price range - if you are expecting the service and facilities to be like the Waldorf- Astoria then you should book there but if you want a safe clean central location then this can do no wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely no complaints about the Avalon Feb 2007”
Reviews.Author: Streetperson
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avalon from 21st-25th February with my 18 year old daughter. Booked a junior suite through Expedia and emailed hotel a week before to ensure the booking was with them which it was.Specifically wanted 2 double beds which we had. Paid £480 (inc taxes) for 4 nights which I thought was reasonable. Hotel was absoutely fine - excellent postition for shopping, 5th Avenue, ESB, TOTR , MoMA, Central Park, Times Square, Theatres all within walking distance- didn't take the subway until we went to Ellis Island and subway station very close. Hotel room was clean and well stocked - the heating system still seems a little bizarre as it did not seem possible to control it in the room. It was way too hot when we got there - so opened the windows and by the end of our stay it was a comfortable 68 degrees. Staff all seemed very pleasant and Wilson the concierge was really nice and helpful. I had to force a tip into his hand!!! Didn't eat at the hotel but went to Austins Cafe ( 5 minute walk )for breakfast - on corner of 3rd and 34th - really good choice of food and excellent value - you can eat there or take out if you want. Another tip - used carmelimo to pick us up from JFK - $41 to hotel with voucher - downloadable from their website - convenient , quick and cheaper than a cab I think . No problems booking on line and you call them toll free when you get through the horror which is passport control at JFK. Bit more expensive back to the airport at $50 but prompt service and nice car.

Reviews.Title: “Valentine's Day holiday in NYC at the lovely, romantic Avalon”
Reviews.Author: MrsBond923
Reviews.Content: Location: ideal for tourists. Two blocks from the Empire State building; close to the subway, Grand Central Station, Penn Station, lots of great restaurants, shopping...everything! Staff: polite and professional. Room: our "junior" suite was very spacious (surprisingly so), comfortable, well-appointed, and always spotless. Plenty of towels too - huge brownie points for that! Also loved the wood floors (as did my allergy-stricken husband). The Wolfgang Puck coffee that accompanied the in-room coffee maker was, as my husband put it, "Wolfgang Suck." But hey, there's four thousand coffee shops within spitting distance. Problems: just a few minor issues - the bathroom sink was clogged, which they promptly fixed. Also, one of the TVs did not work and although we asked them twice to fix it, it never got fixed. But since we had another TV in the sitting area, it was not really a problem. Peace: our room on the 10th floor was high enough to be relatively quiet, and the walls soundproof enough that we never heard other guests. The heating system, which unfortunately can only be controlled by the front desk, was loud when the blower came on, which was a little annoying. Restaurant: we never tried the hotel restaurant (why bother when there are a bazillion other fantastic restaurants in the city?) but the menu did look good. I think I recall breakfast being some ungodly expensive sum; $25 maybe? But we found Brooklyn Bagels on the corner and had breakfast there every morning. Cheap, yummy! Overall: we had a great experience with the Avalon hotel and found it to be a very good value. We really did our homework looking for a nice but not insanely priced hotel, and this was the standout of the 13 hotels we considered. If/when we return to NYC, we will gladly stay at the Avalon again, and definitely recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “great location ,nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: evaireland
Reviews.Content: stayed at the avalon hotel new york city early feb,convenient for shopping,theature,fine dining,staff very pleasant & helpfull, rooms spacious,clean ,very comfortable beds,really enjoyed my stay,would definately stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: frananne
Reviews.Content: My two sons and I stayed in a Junior Suite at the Avalon on 2/16/2007. The hotel was very nice and our room was clean and beautifully decorated. If you don't smoke, I would suggest you ask for a non smoking room, as our room smelled like smoke upon entering. I had read some reviews about the staff not being very helpful, but on our stay they were quite polite and helpful. There's a great place to eat right on the corner, Brooklyn Bagels, which has a great selection of food at a very reasonable price. Also has an ATM. Overall we had a great stay in New York and would definitely stay at the Avalon when going back.

Reviews.Title: “Kudos to the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: rtstudio
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Vincci Avalon on Feb. 1-4, 2007. After hours of research on Trip Advisor we made the right choice. Reading hotel reviews in NYC is entertaining enough, so was hoping to avoid any major problems and we did. The location is one of the most convenient in town for walking to sites, including Central Park or walking to one of 3 nearby subway stops. We had two reservations booked through Expedia, our first night was a one bedroom room for the two of us, then moving to a larger room with two double beds when our party grew to 4 on the last two nights. Checking in at 1:30a.m. was no problem as our plane was delayed, we called ahead to let them know. Our room was spacious including a separate sitting area, great bathroom, large as well for NYC. Our shower handle was loose, but operational. Great waterpressure-you can adjust it at the spa style showerhead - and thermostatic valves with plenty of hot water. Comfy beds with a semi-boutique room aesthetic. For ice you have to call down for it to be delivered, but this actually became a small luxury and was quick. We were allowed to move to our larger room , even on the same floor, once we checked out of the smaller room. We had thought we might have to check our luggage until 3:00 check in. Helpful staff avoided this. Our larger room-double jr. suite -had two tvs and a shower with a garden tub and two sinks- pleasant surprise. It was on a back alley view, so quiet but nothing to see but the top of an historic copper rooftop. Heating system worked great, a little louder than perfect. Quiet rooms, no sounds from the other guests. For NYC it is a great home away from home, a few more luxuries than the standard, and other than a loose shower handle all was tip top. We didn't dine in the hotel, just snacks out of the mini bar. I recommend Daniels bagels for true NYC breakfast-3 blocks away, there are quite a few Zagat rated Asian restaurants on 32nd. We ate twice at the Korean take out /market a block away. For a view have drinks at the Mandarin Hotel, with a great view of Central Park, and enjoy your savings staying at the Avalon. We will plan to stay here again. Thank you staff for your professionalism and hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic, central, clean, just perfect!”
Reviews.Author: LOUDANLancashire
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in november 2006 with my 3 sisters in a junior suite. The rooms were absolutely spotless. We had no wait checking in. Staff were friendly on reception. We only had breakfast one morning in the hotel which was nice but not the best and other places were cheaper. Highly recommend starbucks just across the road for a nice coffee and breakfast sandwich, a good way to start a day full of shopping!! Yellow cabs are really cheap and they are everywhere so you don't have to hang around just hail one when they pass. We booked the shuttle bus to and from JFK airport but nobody told us that you have to go to a desk in the airport once you have landed and show them your vouchers and THEY ring the bus for you. We spent an hour waiting outside the airport trying to flag one down only to be told we had to go to the desk and one came rightaway. Times square is much better by night than it is in the day. Planet Hollywood is also in times square and is very, very good and not expensive as you would expect. You might have to que for 15-20 mins but it is definitely worth it. The four of us got a meal each and a giant cocktail each (with a planet hollwood glass to keep) and the whole lot came to £60. If you are a shopaholic macy's and bloomingdales are great you need a full day to get round each of these they are just huge. If youtake your passport into macys you get 11% discount. on everything which is an added bonus as everything is half the price as in england anyway!! Highly reccommend this hotel and new york is just great, just like being in a movie as soon as you get there, I would definitely go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: debs1966
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avalon from 27th December to 1st January with my husband and 12 year old son and had a great time. Check in was quick and efficient after our long (delayed) flight, staff went out of their way to ensure we didn't have any further waiting on this already stressful day! We were upraded for the 1st night from a deluxe to executive suite (probably due to overbooking!) but were able to keep this for the duration of our stay for no extra charge which was great. The suite was large, clean and tidy and was kept immaculately clean by the cleaning staff each day. We had a king size bed in the bedroom area, along with a double sofa bed in the lounge. The bathroom was large with a shower and jacuzzi bath and there was a useful 'dressng area' between the bathroom and bedroom parts which was good as it gives a little privacy and space to get changed should it be needed. Location as has been said before is excellent - within easy walking of most attractions. We even walked to Central Park along 5th (about 1/2 hour or so stroll). We walked almost everywhere and felt really safe at all times. I have to say that we found everyone extremely friendly with the exception of the bar/restaurant staff who seemed to have a 'don't care attitude'. We ate in the bar/restaurant on the first night and the service was OK (food was pretty good though), however, on eating there later in our stay, the service was awful. The waitress took our order and brought the wrong food due to her being more interested in talking on her cell phone and watching TV than taking the order correctly. We told her that she had brought the wrong food, and she grudgingly corrected it. The final straw was when we asked for the bill and she had added a $20 tip to it! When we questioned this, she said that the manager told her she was allowed to do this for all orders and no-one had ever complained before! We always tip for good service but take offense at being told we HAVE to tip and how much we should leave! She then tried to tell us that this is how it is in America, but, at no other time during our visit was a mandatory service charge added without it being stated on the menu at the outset. I guess this is just someone trying it on but it didn't work with us and for the first time ever, we left no tip at all! This said, all in all we would stay at this hotel again as you don't really eat in the restaurant very much as there is so much choice within easy walking distance and the location and rooms made up for the problems with the restaurant. One tip I would add is that we booked with Super Shuttle for our airport transfers and this was a complete disaster, having to wait almost 2 hours at Newark airport to go to the hotel. This was not the hotel's fault, but I thought I'd mention it for anyone planning to use this service. It is more expensive to get a taxi, but at least you're not kept waiting after a long flight!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: jerryscamp
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Vinnci Avalon Hotel New York for our honeymoon in Dec 2006. I had read reviews on trip advisor about this hotel which were somewhat mixed but looked pretty good overall. The location of the hotel (2 blocks from Empire State Building, 1.5 blocks from Macy's) was fabulous and there are plenty of subway stations in the locality. The hotel itself is beautifully furnished and our Executive King Suite could not be faulted, maid service and clean towels every day also. The only downside to the hotel is the staff, they were pleasant enough but did not go out of their way to give any help or assistance. The doorman and concierge came and went at whim, the bar staff closed the bar whenever they fancied, irrelevant of people being in the bar and trying to get a cab ordered through reception was like trying to get an audience with the queen. This was our 2nd visit to New York and having previously stayed at the Helmsley Park Lane where the staff could not do enough for you we think the staff at the Avalon need to work on their customer service skills.

Reviews.Title: “Cancelled reservation 2 weeks ahead of time - but still charged”
Reviews.Author: sbowen0823
Reviews.Content: I booked 3 nights through their website a month in advance, then after reading some of the reviews on here decided to cancel and stay at another hotel. I cancelled my reservations 10 days in advance, again through the website, have both the confirmation and cancellation paperwork however I was still charged $204.66 for a hotel that I never even saw during our trip. The first time I talked to the reservations manager she said that I booked online, called and cancelled over the phone, then rebooked over the phone. I called ONCE to confirm my reservations after booking them online (habit I always do). They confirmed them and that was it, no additional information exchanged. AFTER I faxed her the paper work showing that I booked online and cancelled on line she changed her story saying that I did both book and cancel online, but that I also re-booked the next day online...which I never did!!!! So, now I am stuck with this $204.66 charge. I am desputing it with my bank, and hoping they can help to resolve the issue and credit my account back. We will see. The staff that I have spoken too has been rude and short, and I personally would never stay at the hotel or recommend it to anyone, just from the week of hassels I have spent dealing with them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel - We loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: goldrock
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vincci Avalon Hotel in New York City on December 23rd to December 25th. We are a family of 5 and fit fairly comfortable in one room. We had 2 queen beds and a pull-out couch. The room was beautiful and clean- dark hardwood floors, pretty decorations, and a really nice bathroom. The only reason I almost gave this hotel 4 stars is because they didn't have air conditioning on in the winter and we had to open the windows to decrease the stuffiness. Besides being a really beautiful hotel, the bellmen were extraordinary. The first bellman, helped us with suggestions on New York sites, restaurants, and tips on how to get around in NY. The security guard was very, very nice and went out of his way to find us a fan the first night because we were warm. I would definitely book with this hotel again. The last bellman was very helpful too. The Empire State Building is very close. We walked to our Broadway show and to Time Square. We took the subway to the Statue of Liberty. This was a great trip and a big part of the greatness was this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall Quite Satisfoctory”
Reviews.Author: jon_1627
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for four nights from 7 Dec - 11 Dec and all in all found it to be quite satisfactory. We arrrived after a long flight from London and we welcomed by warm and friendly reception staff. However, the comments about staff answering the phone whilst checking you in are correct and it was a little annoying but nonetheless check in was quite efficient and we were not kept waiting long. Our room was on the third floor and whilst it failed to offer any more attractive view than the air conditiioning units of the building next door, the rooms were very clean and inviting. Our room even hard two tv's, one in the bedroom area and a seperate one in the lounge area. However, the room was constantly on the cold side and the air conditioning seemed to be controlled from the main reception, given that it was December this was not especially welcome. However, the room was equipped with a seperate heater, that whilst not especially environmentally efficient (heating a pre-chilled room) did do the job, we are also supplied with extra blankets and pillows. The room was also only supplied with one bath robe for two of us. On the plus side the room was supplied daily with free fresh filter coffee which made a welcome change from the instant coffee supplied in most hotel in which we have stayed and a complementary daily newspaper. In terms of location, the Avalon is ideally placed being just a few minutes walk from Macey's, Empire State Building, Madisson Sq Garden and the Flatiron building and makes for a great tourist quality hotel stay. I'm not sure if I would rate it as a four star hotel but its definately a good quality three star hotel. New York is an expensive city for hotels and taking the competitive (if still expensive) price of the Avalon into account, I would definately consider staying here again when I next visit the big apple.

Reviews.Title: “Would try another hotel next time.”
Reviews.Author: Longislander1
Reviews.Content: Maybe it's the new management -- as some have alluded to -- but our most recent stay at the Avalon was not as good as our last one. The staff was friendly, but the management of this hotel needs serious upgrading. We booked a junior suite at $300 a night and were placed in a very tiny "superior" room. After we got into the room, I had to go visit the desk assistant and remind him that we didn't get the room we paid for. He said that no junior suites were available at our time of booking (although we had a printed confirmation for one), so you have to be careful that the room you book is actually the room you get. We did get a $25 credit the next morning. There are a number of other issues. The desk staff is also instructed to answer the telephone, so callers get first priority while the real live guests get to wait in line. No one on the desk staff instructed us that we could get a $30 discount at our parking garage by having the hotel validate our ticket. We would have overpaid if the garage attendant hadn't mentioned it. That meant my wife had to walk all the way back to the hotel to get the ticket stamped. As mentioned above, the superior rooms are very tiny. The beds were made up for the summer although we arrived in December, so we had only a thin blanket and light spread. There was no comforter in the closet and no additional pillows (other than the one each that we had), except for a long, bolster-type piece that neither of us could use individually. There were two of us in the room, but only one robe. The bars of soap are kind of thin. When I turned up the heat in the middle of the night, we discovered that the thermostat activated a loud overhead blower that actually moved the curtains on the other side of the room. To keep the room warm, we had to listen to this blower go on and off during the night. The mattresses are of the old, cheap variety. Beds have not been upgraded to the premium grade that you can find in so many other hotels these days. We also heard a number of doors slam early on Sunday morning. As a result of these issues, we got a poor night's sleep. This hotel is conveniently located and prices are fair. But there's a lot of competition in New York and, based on this unsatisfactory experience, we will book elswhere next time.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it highly enough !!!”
Reviews.Author: jmckellar22
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a four night stay at The Avalon. If I had of read the previous report I might have cancelled, but what a mistake that would of been. My husband and myself only booked a standard room, or a superior suite as they called it through Opodo and paid £150 per night, and I could not of found fault with it. The room was clean and spacious with a queen bed that could of slept four, the marble bathroom was fantastic with twin sinks, large powerful shower and bath.The room was cleaned daily with fresh towels also. The temp was controlled by a thermostat on the wall, unlike reports from other reviews that it was controlled by reception, maybe the hotel has since changed this. The staff were efficient and friendly and on the one occassion that i needed help with the thermostat an engineer came immediately. The breakfast is not worth bothering to rush down for, but there's a great deli on the corner that serves bacon, eggs, french toast, fresh fruit etc, so why worry about being down before 7.00 am for tea and pastries in the hotel. But its the location that wins over other hotels, its just around the corner from the ESB, and a 2 min walk from Macy's, what more could you want. Theres also a sub close by and lots of Korean and Asian restaurants near. I think the moral of this tale is to book a standard room and do not pay the extra for the junior suites and spend the difference on fifth avenue

Reviews.Title: “Run the other way!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nyc1205
Reviews.Content: This was the worst stay in a hotel that I have ever experienced. I am a pretty patient person and realize that things happen beyond one's control, but this hotel and manager were the worst. We checked in on Wednesday, November 29, 2006 and were to check out on Saturday, December 2, 2006, however, after a horrible experience, we left on Friday. The first thing that was somewhat aggravating was that there was only one person on duty at all times so there was always a line at the desk. No one could check in before 3pm at all and there was a HUGE line and lots of people crammed into this tiny little lobby. There was no hot water on Thursday or Friday and there was no compensation or even an apology from the manager. He was very obnoxious about the whole situation like it was our fault. It was also 78 degrees in our room and we were told to open the windows that the heat had been turned on for the fall and they couldn't provide any air condition even though it was an unseasonably warm 68 degrees outside. When our agent contacted the hotel for details the manager told them that the water was only off for a couple of hours and it wasn't as big a deal as we had stated AND that we had lied about the number of individuals in our party. He said that we stated 2 guests and really had 4 in the room. Well, we did book 2, but someone else decided to join us and we told the hotel that when we checked in and that there would be 3 (not 4) and gave all of our party's names. We were charged an extra $25 per night for the extra person which was shown as a charge on our bill proving that we had given them the information. At first glance the hotel fairly nice, but it is MUCH smaller than the website visualizes. It is a cute little place, but very worn. There were big strips ripped off of the window sill/seat, a couple of the outlets were broken in half, the furniture was all knicked up and the shelf in the tv armoir was broken and fell out in the floor when we opened the doors, the lock was missing from the bathroom door handle, the hot water handle in the tub fell off and one of the pieces attached to that handle fell off as well, the handle to pull out to turn the shower on came off in my hand when I pulled it out to turn the shower on, the faucet leaked all over the sink and got our things wet, when the maid came all she did was make our bed and empty the trash, there were no clean towels left and the sink and bath tub weren't cleaned (we were able to shower Wednesday night), when we called for towels were were told that they would bring some right up, well they never did...but since we couldn't shower I guess they figured it was no big deal. Due to the heat we kept the windows open the entire time and the horrible smell of the food from a nearby restaurant was stomach turning. Also, the guy on the scaffold with the jack hammer or drill right outside our window first thing in the morning was really nice too. The room was very dimly lit and just added to the darkness of our visit. We left and went to another hotel that we had stayed in last year and finished up our trip on a bright and wonderful note! We only booked with the Avalon because the other great hotel was triple what we had paid the year before and it wasn't possible. I know that anyone that stayed during the time that we were there will never go back again. We had conversations with several different groups there and no one was happy with the hotel or staff and left. I do have to say that the bellman and the one girl at the desk when we checked in were wonderful. They were kind and helpful and did what they could for everyone. The poor desk clerk that checked us in was doing it all by herself and kept a smile on her face the whole time. I felt bad for her that she was put in the position to handle all of the conflict for the manager who was rarely available. You can choose to do what you want, but I can honestly say that I will never stay in that hotel again no matter what the circumstances. It was a horrible experience and ruined the majority of our trip.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: kitkatkath
Reviews.Content: I booked two rooms ( myself/wife and two sons in twenties) for three nights and was very pleased overall.The location is truly central and the hotel staff are friendly .Any free breakfast offer you can forget as this is just a roll off a plate and coffee from a dispenser in the hall available from 05:00 until 07:00.There is a chargable cooked breakfast, though.One thing that was annoying was that when we did go out for breakfast I spoke to two of the desk staff explaning that a relative would be arriving within the hour and to give them an envelope when they arrived.They arrived after our return and the desk staff neither phoned our room nor gave the letter so both parties waited for an hour, us in our rooms and the relatives in reception.

Reviews.Title: “Could be brilliant if better organised”
Reviews.Author: Roombud
Reviews.Content: I booked 2 junior suites in January for 3 night stay at end of November for party of 4. Was concerned after reading reviews, so e mailed a week prior to arrival to tell them this and confirm booking. Received confirmation which was sent to home e mail while we were actually there! The bad: They still managed to mess up the rooms by giving us a small double and a junior suite instead of 2 junior suites. I insisted on what had been paid for, or at least an upgrade, not a downgrade. Miraculously found another junior suite then they argued that breakfast wasn't included for second room, which it was - again, had to insist. Our room temperature was 63 degrees and freezing on a night - our friends room was 78 degrees and boiling. The maintenance man (Tim) was really nice but it remained unsorted for the duration of our stay, as did our coffee maker - replaced 3 times and none worked! Bar drinks really expensive too at almost £7 for a gin & tonic. Staff seem really overworked and we witnessed a lot of complaints. No robes as stated in bedroom. The good: Looks good inside & out. Location great. Breakfast (which we'd had to argue for as being included) was gorgeous. Rooms(after they were sorted)were a good size. Staff were all lovely, although overworked and harassed, and as a result, incompetent so messages did not get passed to maintenance about faulty things etc. I bet the heating and coffee maker in room 1206 are still not working. Really nice and clean with the potential to be a brilliant hotel. Management is obviously extremely poor and it needs sorting urgently.

Reviews.Title: “Great location !”
Reviews.Author: jeffcar
Reviews.Content: We were recomended this hotel , what a great location right by the Empire State Building ,we walked to most areas from here including Ground zeroband Central Park . The bar at the bottom of the EMS was our rest area to refuel Hotel it self was very clean and staff helpful NOTE watch out for taxi drivers in the Black cabs they charge alot more stick with the yellow cabs the drivers are freindly

Reviews.Title: “Really great location”
Reviews.Author: sbixsbix
Reviews.Content: Location: One block from Empire State Building, some blocks from NY Penn Station, in other words PERFECT. Rooms: very very clean.... Service: OK Front desk: a little bit too slow A little tip for people arriving from ERW airport (Newark International)... this hotel is conveniently located at 10 minute by feet from NY Penn Station which is connected to Newark Airport by train each 15 minutes. It requires only 20 minutes from the airport to NY Penn Station for only 14$ per person. By shuttle or by cab it requires more than an hour and you have to wait for the taxi or reserve the shuttle in advance

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: Phippster
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 4 day stay in New York. Before booking the Avalon, I reviewed a lot of hotels on Tripadvisor and overall the Avalon was one of the best in our price range. I was not disappointed. The good.......the location is amazing. The Empire State building is 2 blocks away (to the novice Brits, at the end of the street and 100 yards up). We couldn't have wished for a better location for all the sites of NY. We did most of our sightseeing by GrayLine open top buses but when we did walk it took us only 25 minutes to walk from the hotel to the Plaza. 26 blocks! A nice brisk walk. We booked a junior suite and the room was VERY big, especially by NY standards. We even had 2 TV's and 2 phones....I was very impressed. The bathroom was clean and large but on closer inspection the ceiling had a spot damp and for £665 I would have expected a damp free bathroom. We arrived at 2.30pm and although on booking had been told check in was 3pm, thought that the room may be ready. Was told by a very abrupt receptionist that we could not check in until 3pm. Was not offered leaving our luggage anywhere but on asking was told the bell man would organise. To be honest the best service we received from any of the staff was the bell man where he seemed to be rushing around all over the hotel. Throughout our stay the staff on the front desk were a little unfriendly and we had to call twice to get our luggage delivered. Overall though, not a bad experience at all and I would stay at the Avalon again however, this is probably more to do with the fact that to find a good NY hotel in a good location at a reasonable price is very hard to find. One other tip for general eating in NY. Go to Hudson Street on the corner of West 11th in Greenwich village. The street has a number of little restaurants and bars at very reasonable prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay at the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: germolma
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in the Avalon hotel during september 2006. The lobby is very clean, in marble and the front staff are rather helpful. They speak both spanish and english. Our room was a superior one (the cheapest one) but it exceeded what we expected. A big bed in front of a TV, a resting zone with two sofas and another TV and a rather large bathroom also decorated in marble. The wardrobe was equipped with an iron and a courtesy umbrella, just in case. The parquet had been recently changed and many changes are still being introduced by the recently owner of the hotel, Vincci Hoteles. During our stay, the decoration of the bed was altered by introducing beautiful pillows. Every morning we woke up with a new newspaper in our door and overall service was good. Points against could be the noise that came through our room door, specially from the cleaning service, because the door didn't fit very well. Anyway, we recommend this hotel for a romantic stay in NYC. As other reviews, we recommend the breakfast in the deli in the corner just in front the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location...Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: FranM
Reviews.Content: The Avalon hotel is a wonderful place to stay. In the heart of Manhatten, literally a block from the Empire State Building, 3 blocks from Macy's! It's clean, quiet, comfortable and convenient! The room we had was fantastic, the bathroom is to die for! Large soaking tub and separate shower, two large sinks, long vanity. Perfect!. Beds were super comfy, pillows lovely. 2 tv's for those who can't decide on what to watch! The best part about this hotel though is the location. It's so close to major sites, we could have walked to Time's Square, but chose not to! Between 5th Ave. and Madison Ave. on East 32nd Street. Shopping down the street, great Japanese sushi/seafood buffet restaurant next door. We will certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nightmare at the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: PBW
Reviews.Content: I recently went to the Avalon with my Aunt. The rooms were okay the bathroom had good counter space. We never did receive the robes we were promised. The drains in the sink and shower were very slow. The remote for the TV didn’t have any batteries. The bellmen were very nice. Unfortunately there was a union strike in front of the hotel with a big blow up RAT. There was no security guard. The bellmen were under staffed, which brings me to the worst part of the trip my suitcase was stolen from the lobby of the hotel. A man ran in grabbed it and left. The area was a little shady. I still have not heard form the hotel on what they plan on doing. The General Manager was not helpful. I would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but...”
Reviews.Author: luvmickey
Reviews.Content: Pros: This was a "great find" in NYC for our family of 5. Two double beds and a double sofa bed for $250 a night in a generous sized room. Breakfast is included, but it's served from 5 - 7 AM. Wonderful location, lost its view of the Empire State Building when a condo went up across the street. Very quiet. Free internet in the lobby. The staff was very nice. Cons: Due to the heat wave and humidity, our bedsheets were damp every night. The front marble "apron" of our sink was missing and housekeeping did not replenish our supply of washclothes or toiletries on our second day (I just wrote a nice note and 5 of each item were replaced!). I found crumbs in the sheets of the sofa bed when I unfolded it for the night. Except for the dampness, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a good choice”
Reviews.Author: drfager
Reviews.Content: stayed 5 nights at this hotel. we were given the wrong room upon arrival but moved the following day . room was large by nyc standards and clean. there were two minor problems reported to the front desk, one was fixed within a few hours the other was looked at but not fixed before we left. the staff was very friendly and helpful. the hotel restaurant was very nice and reasonable except for breakfast. there are a couple of nice places on madison for breakfast for 1/3 the price.. the empire state building is very close and you can walk to times square, penn station, and grand central station. overall a nice small hotel in a pretty safe neighborhood. we did not regret our decision to stay here. a couple of drawbacks are that there is no gym in the hotel and no laundry room. you get privileges at bally's but a small gym in the hotel would be preferable. ice is available but you must request it from the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “So-So”
Reviews.Author: iamshasha
Reviews.Content: I found the Avalon through an internet search, in the hopes that my family and I could find a hotel that would be fairly centrally located and yet still be affordable. The Avalon fit the bill. When we arrived we also saw the giant blowup rat by the front door - but, it was only there one day and didn't bother us at all. My boyfriend and I were in a "Superior Double Room", which was incredibly small, but fit us just fine. The bathroom was fairly clean, although our bathtub was obviously plugged up as after we took our first shower, within minutes, we would be standing in a few inches of water. Yuck. Also, they do not have fitted sheets on the beds, only a top sheet that is somehow tucked underneath - needless to say within an hour of sleeping the sheet found it's way up and we would wake up with our bodies touching the bare mattress. Yuck, again. We also had a mini-bar in the room, but the fridge was absolutely NOT working, so anything in there was not cold, but rather lukewarm. My parents stayed in a king suite, which was MUCH nicer than our room, and they didn't have as many complaints. The room is very large with a huge bathroom (a toilet and a bidet), a jacuzzi bathtub, a standup shower, and a large vanity with two sinks. They also had a separate sitting room, with a pull-out couch and another TV. My major complaints about the hotel would be their service - on Saturday morning we ordered room service for breakfast, and it was a disaster. My mother called in first and the person receiving the phone call didn't speak a word of English, so after 10 minutes of trying to tell him what they wanted to order, she hung up. My sister tried calling a few minutes later and although she got through to someone else, it took forever to get to their room and when it arrived, the order was almost completely incorrect - they had asked for potatoes with their eggs, and instead all received sausage; the toast was literally a piece of bread, not even remotely toasted; they asked for orange juice and received milk; the list goes on and on. There was no continental breakfast that I saw, and even if it was there, I doubt it would be any good. The location is very nice - we walked pretty much everywhere, and we were in a safe area. Overall, our stay wasn't terrible, but it definitely left us wanting more. But the location was great, and served us well.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
