Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Vinnci Avalon in New York. As most of the previous reviews mentioned, it was superbly located in mid-town, about two blocks from the Empire State Bldng, and two blocks from the subway. The hotel was clean, and relatively spacious, by NY standards. We had requested a Deluxe Queen, which would have given us two Queen beds, apparently tough to find in NY. Most hotels have doubles. Anway, even though we confirmed three times, they did not have that room when we arrived. They gave us a King Suite instead (King bed and foldout couch) and said we could have the other room the rest of the days. We ended up not switching, and just staying in the King Suite, as it was fairly roomy and our 13-year old son didn't mind the fold out. HIghlights: two tvs, good air conditioning, clean, spacious, nice bathroom that was well appointed and had a separate shower and bath with good water pressure. Very close to good food that's reasonable. We didn't book online, so our stay didn't include the buffet breakfast, which I though was pricey as a separate charge. Demerits--air conditioning is controlled by the central desk and you have to call every single time you want it turned up or down. Also, there are no ice machines, so you have to call the front desk and ask for a bellman to bring ice to you... a pain when it's 95 and humid like it was when we were there. It sometimes took as long as an hour to get ice after a request. They offer "continental breakfast" in the lobby from 7 to 10, but we only managed to get there before everything was gone one day out of our week's stay. We usually went down around 9, an hour before it should be done, and it was completely gone. The hotel was being picketed while we were there, and they had only one bellman, so some of the service issues could have been out of character. The people were nice and overall, I would stay there again, and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Avalon only average”
Reviews.Author: drdobg
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a three night NYC trip. The room was clean and of average size (ie, large by NYC standards I'm told)- we had a King-suite. Furniture was showing visible signs of wear. Floors in the room appeared to have been recently redone in Pergo. Bed was very comfortable (a King) and the bath was above average size. There was no ability to control temperature in the room. It was in the high 80's in the city when we arrived and the room was stifling at the time of our arrival. It took several hours to figure out that our adjustment of the thermostat had no effect on the actual temperature in our room. A call to the front desk to revealed that the desk had to turn on the a/c. For the rest of our stay, the room was probably in the low 60's and we had to open a window to get the temperature somewhere near comfortable. There were no "plush terrycloth bathrobes" as mentioned in other promotional literature (others have made this observation as well) The "continental breakfast" which was included was a joke! It consisted of a card-table in the lobby with an urn of coffee, a bowl of fruit and a tray which was always nearly empty of what looked to be packaged rolls. The promised welcome glass of champagne was never offered. I asked the desk clerk for directions to a wine shop or wine bar and was directed to a convenience store 2 blocks away that stocked about 20 bottles of questionable vintage. The location is a real plus-centrally located in Manhattan on the edge of a Korean neighborhood. Within a few blocks (walking distance) of Penn Station, Empire State Building and several subway stops making it easy to get anywhere you want to get painlessly and easily. This was our first trip to Manhattan, so without other hotel experiences to compare to, I would not stay at this hotel again, but would see if other lodgings were of equal or superior quality.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Great Hotel. Great birthday!”
Reviews.Author: ladyhotelier
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avalon for four nights to celebrate my birthday. Brilliant location, very helpful staff, good clean rooms. Couldn't fault it! The breakfast was good, the bar was a bonus and nothing seemed to be too much trouble. It was good value for money and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value , Great Position”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 nights in a king suite as we were travelling with our 12 year old son and wanted some privacy . Therefore a little disappointed as the room areas were fairly open plan - just an open doorway between . Also view of ESB as mentioned on web was possible only for Spiderman. Pluses were great position just off 5th Ave. Very good size suite , comfy king but sofa bed rather less so . Bathroom fine but taps and finish in need of refurb which I believe is imminent . Staff were friendly - room clean faultless . Plenty of wardrobe space . Would stay again though as for value for money - under $240 per night booked on hotel's website was a first class deal . Good Japanese restaurant opposite and some intesresting Korean places that we didn't get chance to try . Plus some great places lower in Manhattan - can recc. Craftbar , USC ( also Flatiron Lounge and Pegau Club for cocktails ) and a little uptown - BLTSteak ( try the kobe beef .. ) and for some oriental pizazz - Tao . Note for Dad's wanting a quiet beer - Jack Dempsey's a street or so down is very friendly !

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: gemsstock
Reviews.Content: We have recently stayed three nights at the Avalon and were very pleasantly suprised. The rooms were well sized for NY standards, the beds were good and the bathroom clean. Unlike another reviewer commented, the breakfast is of wonderful quality. There is a small table opposite the reception with coffee and muffins but the buffet is in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice!”
Reviews.Author: rodlover
Reviews.Content: Very clean, well-maintained, quiet. Helpful, attentive staff. Nice breakfast buffet. Stayed 2 nights for our daughter's Columbia graduation held at Madison Square Garden, a 10 minute walk. Have stayed at other hotels in the area at same price, or more. This one is a real value. Good location for many activities, including shopping. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel great value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon Hotel for 6 days, and it was great. The room was big with two doulble beds, sitting area, two tvs, mini fridge, safe, coffee maker and hairdryer. The bathroom was large with a bath and shower. The room was cleaned every day and fresh towels were left. The hotel is in a great loction just off 5th ave, close to all the main sights. Just across the road from the empire state building, macys is about 5 min walk and times square is about 10 min walk. We did find the room cold with the air condition but we just asked for it to be turned off which it was straight away and was fine after that. The Avalon is great value for money and if i go back to new york i would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Unwilling to accomodate or provide any service at all”
Reviews.Author: 801howard
Reviews.Content: Prior to booking I called the hotel to guarantee a jr suite with two double beds. They made a notation & indicated no problem. We arrived prior to check-in (11:00 am) so our bags were stored. We got back to the hotel around 5:00. When checking in asked if the room had two double beds. I got a song & dance how they could not guarantee a room with two beds. I informed them that I had called prior to booking the room & was given confirmation. They upgraded us to an executive suite with a king & pull out. I was traveling with a friend & another was arriving a day later. One of us would have to sleep on the pull out. The hotel said they would move us on the 2nd day. On the 2nd day we found out that the hotel only has 15 rooms with two beds, which is only 15-20% of the total rooms. We were not moved & no effort was made to appease us. The sofa bed had no sheets & there were none in the room. The room was supposed to have robes. They brought one even though they knew the room was occupied by more than one person. Finally, the room had artwork missing (the nails/hangers were still in the wall). The bathroom was great and that's all I can say about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, well priced”
Reviews.Author: Steve__1000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for 6 nights in late April. It's clean, well maintained, nicely priced and convenient to many midtown destinations. It does not have an on site exercise room but does have an arrangement with a Bally's health club 3 blocks away. I used it and it's a nice club with full cardio and weight rooms as well as a pool and trainers. The only problem we had was that the King Suite we reserved wasn't available when we arrived. We spent two nights in a nice Junior Suite with two queens, and then were moved into the King. The King is nicer and roomier with a larger two sink bathroom and a much nicer shower. I believe that all the rooms have two TV's and a seperate seating area. There is a very nice little bar off the lobby which is a good place to unwind after a full day or night on the town. Over all we liked the hotel and recommend it. We would stay there again. We would also recommend a restaurant called Artisinal, two blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Avalon in late April 2006. Booked a jr suite and all were filled when we arrived and were upgraded to a king suite. After reading recent reviews before our trip, I didn't think we would have the breakfast, but were given vouchers for each day. Breakfast was very good, not the normal continental breakfast. Hot eggs, pancakes, bacon, sausage, fresh fruit, bagels, muffins etc. All the employees treated us very well. Our room was large and very quiet, never heard a siren or the early morning trash trucks. Close to subways and an easy walk to many sites. Saw 'the rat' the morning we left. From the reviews, I wasn't sure what it was all about. Something to do with a labor union. This was my second trip to NYC and would definitely stay at the Avalon again.

Reviews.Title: “Good but 'continental breakfast?'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked through [----------------] Hotel was ok but two main things to look out for if you book that the promise of a complementary glass of champagne on arrival does not happen, even when asked for. Continental breakfast consists a small atble in the hallway opposite reception, on the table your breakfast consists of a cup of coffee, banana or apple and a mini muffin.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Vincci Avalon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights over the easter break. What a fantastic hotel!! I booked through expedia and got the hotel at a bargain rate. The room, a junior suite, was extremely large, two double beds and a separate seating area with two tv's!! Breakfast was included - detailed as "continental" but included egg and bacon, pancakes etc. The best thing of all about the hotel was the location, two minutes walk away is the empire state building, park avenue and Macy's. Fabulous!!! Five stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel, be aware about credit card charges”
Reviews.Author: England4444
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with 3 friends for a weekend break as we'd been last year and had a fabulous time. The hotel is lovely. We had an upgrade which made a huge difference as the rooms aren't that huge. Nice decor, clean rooms and polite staff - in particular one who went out of her way to make our stay that extra bit special. The location is good also - 2 minutes from the Empire State Building, and a short walk to a good selection of shops. There aren't really many places to eat in the evening unless you like Burger King. During the day there is a good deli at the end of the street. My only complaint is that after I returned home the hotel charged my credit card for something I wasn't warned about. I sent at least 3 e-mails to query this and apart from one reply saying they'd look into it have heard nothing. Although it was only for a small amount be warned!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: rbirch
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Avalon for 10 nights in April for our honeymoon. We booked it back in October 2005 and one of the reasons we chose the hotel was because of the glowing trip advisor reviews. When I looked at some of the recent reviews just before we left, I panicked, because the hotel had been given so many bad reports. However, when we got there, everything was wonderful. We had no problems checking in, the room was huge, everything worked, and even though our room was at the front facing the street, you couldn't hear any outside noise. The bed was comfy, the tv was huge, you couldn't hear any noise from any other rooms and the room was always clean every day. What more could you ask for? One of the women on the reception was a little offhand on one occasion, but so what? Everyone else was polite and friendly, and the staff bent over backwards to get us a newspaper when the delivery was delayed one morning. If anything, it was some of the guests who were rude (one woman in particular was giving abuse to the person on the front desk). The workers strike was still on, but they weren't there every day and even when they were, it's not as if they were making lots of noise and blocking the entrance to the hotel - they were just sitting there chatting! We weren't affected at all by the building work that has been mentioned in other reviews - there was even a letter explaining the details of the work and apologising for the inconvenience when we arrived - but we weren't disturbed by a thing. The hotel is centrally located, round the corner from the Empire State building, shops galore on 34th Street, and a short walk to the nearest subway and Penn train station. There's also a great bagel place on the corner, and a good bar on 33rd. We would definitely stay here again - we're hoping to go again in the next couple of years and if we do we'd book in here. I would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: TF1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Avalon for 4 nights over the Easter holidays and were happy enough. The hotel is very well located, a few minutes walk from subway stations, The Empire State Building, Macy's and many shops and restaurants. At night time the area is still very busy and we felt safe at all times. The room was a decent size, clean and well kept; towels were changed everyday. Staff were helpful enough. We spent very little time in the hotel, just using it as a base. If this is the type of hotel you are looking for, then I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it, it is adequate and served its purpose well. As for the giant rat outside the hotel, we saw it very briefly when we arrived, but didn't see it again, in fact if I hadn't read about it on this site, I wouldn't even have known what it was. One thing to add would be that we had confirmed our booking by phone a few weeks before we arrived and judging by other reviews this is maybe a good idea. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Confirm Booking by phone, please!”
Reviews.Author: martinandelaine
Reviews.Content: Booked a Superior delux suite via internet back in Jan 2006 on a Visa card which was to expire in Feb 2006. Got a confirmation back for 4 nights 11 - 14 April inclusive. After a long flight from Aberdeen (UK) to NYC via Amsterdam pitched up at the Avalon to be informed they did not have a booking or room for us (2 adults 2 children 11 and 13). Alfredo told us the booking had been canceled by them because the card with which it had been booked had since expired even though they had confirmed the room to us in writing and we had with us a valid VISA card with the same number as the booking. Hmmmmmm. Bottom line was that Alfredo got on the phone and eventually got us booked into the 'Chandler' hotel on 31st Street, at the same rate. The room at the Chandler was slightly smaller than that booked at the Avalon but OK as we were only there to sleep. Cannot really provide a review of the Avalon as we did not get beyond the lobby but the Chandler was really nice and the staff very understanding of our predicament when we got there. I suppose we were lucky as it was Easter and NY hotels were pretty full. Please, please call the Avalon to confirm your booking either after making it online or before you travel as they appear to be struggling to cope with running the hotel as a going concern. We would not recommend the Avalon to anyone as being informed you do not have a hotel room in NY is not a pleasant experience. We would however recommend the Chandler around the corner! Disgruntled, Aberdeen, Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After extensive research of NYC hotels we selected the Avalon and paid for our entire stay in advance. My husband, older son (28 y.o.)and I arrived around midnight on a Thursday and we told our junior suite was not available. We were told only one room with one bed was available and that the hotel did not have roll away beds and that we would need to go to another hotel for the night and return the next day. The desk clerk sounded like a recording saying over and over, "I understand", "I understand". That is not exactly what you want to hear at midnight with a great deal of luggage and another son (20 y.o.) flying in very early the next morning and not knowing exactly where his family will be when he arrives or even where to go. Arrangements were made for us to go to another hotel for what was left of the night. The room could not handle three people at the same time, but, it was a roof over our heads with two beds and the staff there was very nice. We did move back to the Avalon about noon the next day, which wasted a majority of our day and our precious vacation time. We paid an additional amount of $50.00 daily to accomodate four people in a room, yet we only had three towels every day, one glass and no sheets for the sleeping couch. Always the clerk said "We'll take care of it" or "I understand". We were also told that breakfast was complimentary to find out that was not so. We were told by one clerk that they could print our Boarding Pass for our return trip only to arrive back at the desk later and be told, quite rudely I might add, "that is not a service we offer or ever had!" On the plus side, the room was very nice, we had a pretty good view as compared to many of the hotel views in NYC. The room was always cleaned and the hotel was very quiet and conveniently located. Definitely, something needs to be done regarding the customer service style of the afternoon and evening shifts. Would we stay at the Avalon again? Ask me next week.

Reviews.Title: “It's in the details...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'll start by saying we were pleasantly surprised by our stay at The Avalon Hotel. After reading reviews about "the Rat" and the in-room heating issues, we crossed our fingers and went for it anyway. We booked through [--------]. We elected to get the shuttle transfer from La Guardia to the Hotel for $17 per person. We discovered upon arrival that the fare, if you book with Super Shuttle directly, is only $14 ea.(I believe), but MAKE A RESERVATION! We opted to call ahead of the crowd waiting for luggage and we got on a van in the last 2 seats... Super Shuttle was short many drivers that day, so who knows how long we would have waited. We arrived early at the hotel. Our room was not ready yet, we asked to stow our luggage so we could take a walk. The receptionist was very nice but placid. She called the 'bell hop' on the radio. After waiting 15 minutes, patiently watching him (the bell hop) run around fetching others' luggage, I made eye contact and got him to finally aknowledge us and take our bags. We walked around the neighborhood for an hour and a half, noting our surroundings and came back to check in at 4:00 p.m. We stayed in room #1009, a Junior Suite on the 10th floor and our first impression was quite positive. The room was quite comfortable in size for 2 people; 2 double beds, very large bathroom with marble and seemed very clean (we later found a pair of shoes under one of the beds). The room also provided a small refrigerator, an iron and ironing board, plenty of hangers and a safe which we found usefull. The other reviewers did state truthfully; stained upholstery on the furnishings (also a bit worn), cheesy fake wood flooring (I noted as padded), and service was spotty. We had breakfast vouchers for 2 days. 'Hot Breakfast' was supposed to be an added $5 each, but we were never charged extra. I was happy with the food quality; the fruit was fresh, eggs tasted real, all-in-all it was decent. They did seem under-staffed though, only one 'busser' who was running around very efficiently, the host friendly yet timid. One thing to note was that upon arrival in our room on that Sunday afternoon, we didn't have any towels in our bathroom. We called the front desk to have housekeeping bring us towels, to which they said 'right away', turned out to be an hour later after a second call. When the towels did finally come, they were warm, obviously fresh from the dryer, but frayed. I wondered if the hotel could be low on their linen supply? Also noted was that when house keeping tidied our room on our Monday stay, they took our wash cloths and never brought new ones, not even the next day. We just used the hand towels, which there seemed to always be plenty of. Towels wouldn't normally be an issue for me, but after travelling all day, we needed to freshen up before dinner. One thing that really bothered me was that when we arrived back to our room Tuesday afternoon, housekeeping had cleaned our 'wood' floor with some sort of cleaner-polish. The smell hit you like a ton of bricks once you entered the room, so we opened the window to air things out, but the smell never really went away. Also, when we went to iron clothes, the iron wouldn't really hold the water needed for steam; it kind of leaked out as you ironed. The iron surface seemed to stick to your clothes as you ironed also... When we returned from a long day of dining and site seeing, we asked the bell hop if there was a wine shop locally, he said for me to check with the 'concierge'. When I asked the same question to the gentelman at the front desk, he said to ask the bell hop. We just went upstairs and searched the yellow pages, and found several stores within walking distance. Also, CVS (convenience store) right on the corner of 5th and 32nd. The elevaters are a tad slow, but we never had any problems. The famous "Rat" was out front of the hotel on the week days, it goes up in the morning, and they take it down in the early evening. The Union folks never seemed to bother the guests though. It seemed to be quite a harmless situation. Oh yeah! Not related to the hotel, but worth mentioning; We did the observation deck tour at The Empire State building. We paid $16 each, waited in line for 2 hours to get up there, then spent 20 minutes observing and taking pictures. They try to get you to rent a hand-held device that "explains what you are seeing". Very obnoxious sales pitch to me. The wait for the trip down in the elevater was 30 minutes also. We wouldn't have done it if we knew the truth to the wait times... Great views but too much time wasted for us. So much to see in 3 days. Upon checking out of the hotel, we were charged for our incidentals, all was o.k. there. No double-billing etc. However, when I said goodbye and thank you to the front dest clerk, she looked at me and just nodded. We were never asked "How was your stay?", no "Goodbye" or "Thank You" or anything. I found this amazing for the service industry! I'm sure we could have done much worse in NYC but it seems that the Vincci Hotel group would do well to invest some training time for their staff and a little money on improving the details.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great value but...”
Reviews.Author: gc01
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Avalon with reservation in hand after a long day of travel. Unfortunately the stay did not get off to a good start as they did not have my booked junior suite available. They tried to find us two single rooms, but only one single room was available, so we took it for the first night. They moved us to our junior suite the next day while we were site-seeing. Junior suite is a very good size for the money (paid $199 per night) and even though the view was not good at the back of the hotel, the room was quite. This hotel is in a great location, with all the conveniences around you (as outlined by several other reviews on this site). Cab rides from hotel cost $12 to Statue of Liberty ferry and $7 to 61St/2Ave (Serendipity 3 restaurant (yum,yum)). All other points of interest were within walking distance. What impressed me the most was how safe we felt walking around this area at night(but that does not mean you should let your guard down). The hotel also felt very safe to be in. One major disappointment was that the breakfast was not complimentary. To me this is a big mistake by the new hotel management. All the review books and this site bragged about the great complimentary breakfast this hotel had. No longer the case. The breakfast now cost $17 per person! Needless to say, we were shocked by this and the front desk staff had a print out of the web site showing the breakfast under amenities was not listed as complimentary. Obviously this was a common complaint for them to have this in hand. Hotel facade is still being renovated as of March 21st. Overall, this is a good value hotel in a great location. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money”
Reviews.Author: carolinecag
Reviews.Content: In common with recent reviews we booked this hotel following previous good ratings and were disappointed in some respects. On arrival we were given a double room despit booking a suite and I went back to reception to complain. After about half an hour and me nearly being in tears we were eventually given a suite on the 12th floor. I have to say that the receptionist - Erick, was very courteous and patient, but after a long day travelling I was not happy to be told that the suite I had booked was not available and that we would not even get a refund despite having written evidence of the booking. I think the turning point was when I moaned that I hadn't even had dinner yet (this was at 9.15 pm) and Erick was obviously scared of a tearful woman with low blood sugar! So we did get the right room, but only after a real fight. We also did have our complimentary breakfast and did not have any problem with the staff who were friendly and quick. The restaurant was closed until our last morning, but the alternative room was fine. The room itself was large and the sitting area was pleasant. Our room had just had a new floor put down and the decor all seemd quite fresh. When the weather turned colder we asked reception to put the heating on which they did, but it isn't controllable so you are either hot or cold. The beds were rather small for two adults and we didn't want to sleep in separate beds. The location is very good and I thought it was good value for money. However beware asking the concierge to book you a taxi to the airport. My partner was told this would cost the same as a yellow cab, but the driver charged him $65!!! I got a yellow cab to JFK 3 days later and this was only $40. Needless to say the rip off guy didn't get a tip and was very unhappy.

Reviews.Title: “no stars for the avalon”
Reviews.Author: chrisBostonMa
Reviews.Content: If this were the last hotel in New York City I would not stay there. Upon arrival, the front desk attempted to charge us twice but we had proof of payment. ( We heard another couple with a similar complaint.) When checking into our room, we discovered it was not the one we requested ( a nicer one) nor was it the same price.(We were originally told we would have a nice view of the Empire State Bldg., 2 queens and a large bathroom.) We got none of that. We spent an hour or more with the front desk trying to straighten it out when they finally promised us another room the next day and they would move all our bags for us. We left in the morning to sightsee etc. to come back to the same room, bags still there.After spending another hour with the front desk personnel we finally moved ourselves to another room that they gave us. It was basically the same...no view, 2 double beds and a small bathroom. We complained again so in the end, they gave us free parking for our car for 3 days. Also, we had to ask for towels and there was no heat in the room. We wore gloves, and hats to bed, despite requesting heat twice. The breakfast crew is understaffed and very slow, so we ate at a place down the street. I cannot recommend this hotel and will never, ever consider staying there again. There are too many other hotels in the city that might actually like our business.

Reviews.Title: “New Management is Tarnishing a Good Thing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel for about 7 years, and have always found it a comfortable, welcoming, and reasonably priced hotel. It was recently purchased by a Spanish company, Vincci hotels, and the changes are not for the better. Gone is the free continental breakfast. Gone is the triple sheeting. Gone are the bathrobes. The last two times I have stayed there, they messed up my reservations -- the first time this has happened in 7 years. Small but irritating things were problematic: TV remotes didn't work; the coffee maker had no carafe. It is still a decent hotel with good rates for NYC, but I don't have the same warm feeling I used to have, and I will definitely be looking for alternatives.

Reviews.Title: “Shame About the Staff”
Reviews.Author: monicaToronto
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights at the Avalon. The dining room was under renovation and a huge rat greeted us at the door. Actually the rat was more friendly than the manager. We assumed we got breakfast but were mistaken (rather embarassing)- I asked the manager about the misleading ad in their website (it stated under features: the Avalon Breakfast etc) she said it wasn't misleading it was perfectly clear. Again the customer is always wrong. To be fair the room was very nice - but don't expect great service from the maids. There were having a nice chat sitting on the floor when we arrived.

Reviews.Title: “VERY Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The first thing that greets you when you get to the hotel is a giant blow up rat. Apparently one of the local unions is picketting the hotel. Pretty funny. The Hotel is undergoing renovations, a fact that we were not told. Because of this, the restaurant is closed. Apparently they still serve breakfast. However, we only learned of this when we were leaving. The staff member we asked on our first day said no breakfast being served. Internet did not work because of renovations. Sporadic problems with electricity because of renovations. TV worked sometimes. No Business Center to allow for printing etc. The room was ok, but very loud. We were on 3rd floor, probably better to get higher floor. Furniture not too clean, stains etc. Staff friendly but not really helpful. Location was pretty convienent. Sits between two subway lines. Overall, disappointing especially in light of reviews on this site. When a hotel is undergoing renovations they should tell customers before they get there.

Reviews.Title: “Be Aware”
Reviews.Author: strauth
Reviews.Content: The room was amazing for New York, very spacious. The staff was not interested in us at all. Incorrect charges were not corrected for two months. The restaurant food was good, but service lacked.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, but check your reservation!”
Reviews.Author: gayn040
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon hotel for New Year 2005. The Hotel itself was lovely,nicely decorated and clean. Great sized rooms for 4, with a nice partition to watch TV in peace. Breakfast ok, basic, you had to pay extra for a cooked breakfast! Good location, Empire State Building just around the corner. Open top bus ride is a must you get to see all the sights and you can get your bearings to then decide what you want to then revisit. Overall a great stay but I would recommend to check your reservation before you go, we never had a room for the first night because the people before us decided to stay on for another night. We found this extreamly strange of the hotel to offer our room when it was booked. They did sort out another hotel but its not what you need after your flight when your tied and hungry!!

Reviews.Title: “Avalon Under Renovation”
Reviews.Author: Lanny123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned (March 2006) from a 3 night visit at the Avalon - our first stay at the hotel. I can't comment on value as we paid $119 per night plus points associated with Club Intrawest membership. The hotel has apparently changed ownership recently, purchased by a Spanish company. The restaurant connected to the hotel is under renovation (and closed) as are several rooms/floors in the hotel. We stayed in room 1006 and it was very quiet (it didn't face the street), but was a rather long room, a result of the renovation of this office building. The floor looked like wood, but was actually plastic (cheesy!). The staff tried to be helpful with our problems - no direct heating/air conditioning in the room (they had to turn our fan off in the basement). Neither one of the 2 tv's worked when we checked in, but one was fixed quickly. I won't go on and on, but this isn't likely to be a hotel I'd stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value, Good Location, Few Faults”
Reviews.Author: jscivs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a three night break as surprise for wife's birthday. The hotel is centrally situated in Manhatten and right round the corner from the Empire State Building and 5th Avenue. Times Square, Maceys, Broadway are easy walks. Subway is two blocks down and taxis are abundant (although difficult to catch a free one during busy times) We had a Junior suite which was very nice and a good size. Some of the furniture was a little jaded and the bath was very small for a 6'2" body! But overall. very nice. The big down side is the heating system. The room control does not work and you have to get it turned on or off via reception. The problem is that when it is on, it sounds like a freight train. You do get acclimatised to it but we had to get it turned off at night as it is very noisy. I guess in the summer it wouldn't be so much of a problem when the weather is warmer. The complimentary continental breakfast was good, a nice selection of hard boiled eggs, meats, cheese, croissants, pastries, cereals, fresh fruit and bread. It easily did us until lunch time. They do have hot (eggs, bacon and pancakes) but there is a $5 surcharge. We found the continental very satisfying. You may see 'Complimentary Champagne on arrival' advertised, but they don't do that (or at least they didn't for us and when I asked they said they didn't do it!). We did have trouble trying to upgrade to an executive suite - lots of unanswered e-mails both to the hotel and parent company. Apparantly it's not policy if you book through an external agent. Most bizaar as we were willing to pay the rack rate difference and they had suites free. As it happened, we would not have had time to wallow in the Jacuzzi in an executive suite even had they let us have one. Staff were very friendly and helpful at all times (despite some adverse comments in other reviews) but there was no room service. Also, there is no hotel information supplied in the room (meal times, local attractions, maps etc). Overall, a very nice little hotel and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I would not say it was 4 star though, more like a three. It's a shame as with a little TLC and effort it could be up there with the best. Mind you, the price would go up and we would lose a great mid-town deal.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: GiancarloRoma
Reviews.Content: I spent a week during New Years holidays. The hotel is a good option for a staying in NYC considering: a) the price (pretty cheap - around 200€ double room including taxes); b) location, just off the Empire State Building; c) the staff, nothing too exceptional ... but very kind and something professional; d) quality of the room (very spacious and confortable, we stayed at the 12th floor). So if you wanna visit NYC without spending a fortune this is the hotel for you. The correct name of the hotel is VINCCI AVALON HOTEL, and is part of a spanish group (actually the prefer to speak spanish than english ... ahahah!). Saluti.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After a horrid experience in a hotel nearby (Hotel Penn), I researched hotel's in the area for weeks. I used Trip Advisor to find a hotel with high reviews. The Avalon had the best reviews for the price and was a wonderful place to stay. The hotel was beautiful and the rooms were very clean, very roomy and had lots of extras for a hotel in NYC. The staff was very friendy and always ready to help and always with a smile. There was only one little mishap- I had to tell the front desk to turn the heat on- which they did right away and called back to check and see if it was working. As long as the price stays about the same, this hotel will be my hotel of choice in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - may be a bit noisy”
Reviews.Author: iloveolives
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia for a 6 night stay between Christmas and New Year. The price was very reasonable for 2 adults and 2 teenagers-proably because for this peak time we had booked months ahead. Prior to our arrival in the US I had checked the booking personally with the hotel reservations and this proved useful, as there was a discrepancy between what Expedia said we had ( 2 Queen beds) and what the hotel had noted ( 1 Queen + a sofa bed - not very comfortable for a week). The hotel honoured the original booking and our room was very spacious with an entrance way, very spacious bathroom with separate shower and bath and 2 basins, 2 comfortable beds and a separate lounge area with a second television. We had a view of the street and could even see the very tip of the ESB.Everything in the room worked and the only odd thing was that the heating was adjusted at the front desk, but there was no problem with that. The location was quite convenient to shopping , Fifth Ave, Times Sqaure etc. There are some great restaurants close by, particularly the Hunan (Chinese and sushi)in 5th, and Artisanal ( stylish french bistro) just down from the hotel in 32nd. However the new management is clearly still coming to grips with running the hotel , and they were understaffed particularly in the breakfast room which was chaos at peak times, but when it was not so busy was very good with lots of a good selection of everything you would expect and (except for the hot food) was included in the price. The free internet in the lounge at the back of reception was very useful. There is a lot of construction going on around the hotel so there is a bit of noise at various times.Even the hotel itself has scaffolding on it (along with just about every public building in NYC undergoing a facelift ). Overall the room was comfortable, the service fine (except for breakfast but that may have been under strain in the busy pre New Year period), but the best aspect was the value for money ( about $US320 per night average for a family including a substantial breakfast).There are sure to be be better hotels in NYC but the value for money in this one is pretty impressive. We would certainly stay again if we wanted to be in that location.

Reviews.Title: “Just fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GillianandJames
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for 4 nights in December 05. This was our fifth trip to NYC and the first time at the Avalon. The hotel is spotless and cleaned daily. The bathroom was spacious and the room is larger than other NYC hotels that I have stayed in. This is a great location, close to the Empire state and all shopping, including Macys. 15 minute walk to Times Square and 5th ave areas. There is a subway station close by which takes you to downtown (for the ferries to statue of liberty) or to Central Park, its worth using in the daytime and you save a fortune on taxi fares. The staff were really helpful especially Wilson. Breakfast is continental but there is a good choice. The Heartland brewery just around the corner serves good food and beer. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and the next time I visit I will be staying at the Avalon.

Reviews.Title: “Above average!”
Reviews.Author: blueskyyellowbeach
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avalon 6 nights 15th-22nd Nov 2005. Have to say that we were more than pleased with this hotel. We had a Jnr Suite, which had plenty of room for our family (2 Adults and 8yr old). As we were there for Birthday Celebrations we certainly needed the extra space for all the shopping! The room had spacious bathroom, with large powerfull shower (yippee) and huge bath. The fact that there were 2 TV's kept the boys v. happy late at night when we finally all crashed out. Housekeeping was excellent, the room was clean (after reading some of the reviews of other places I was a bit paranoid about this), and anything we asked for extra towels etc was provided promptly. We had asked for a view of the ESB when we booked but they were unable to arrange, it would have been nice but to be honest staying on East 32nd you see the ESB from every angle anyway!! Service from staff throughout the hotel was great and they were always helpful to us. Breakfast was included in our deal and was more than adequate, lots of pastries, bagels, fresh fruit etc. However, did notice that the American guests got v.agitated if there request/complaint wasn't dealt with that instant regardless of the fact that staff maybe serving someone else! The location was fine for us (there is a subway close by) we tended to get cabs everywhere to save precious time and at the end of a long day little Korea was noodle heaven for our fussy 8yr old eater. Would reccomend this place to anyone visiting NY with children, believe me with kids you need some space and if you book a Jnr Suite you'll get it.

Reviews.Title: “Loves it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jayne084
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel in August in the summer. Lovely hotel. Staff were very helful! As soon as we arrived they told us we looked like celebs! Always a bonus! Very close to Club 40/40 (which i would definatly recommened), close to the good shops! Recommend this hotel to everyone, even the young and stylish!! haha. Obviously the Plaza would be first choice but with it closed gotta settle! If anyone has booked have a fabulous time and tell the staff Jayne and Stace (england)that we said heeeeey gorgeous!! xxxxxxxx MWA! ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service from this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dottiet
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Avalon from the 13th - 20th December and I can find no fault in the hotel, rooms or service at all, before I go on I will point out that over the past 8 years we have stayed in many 5 star hotels around the world - and we found the Avalon to be up there with the best of them. From checking in the service was fantastic - we stayed in an Executive Suite and were impressed with the size of all the rooms,all of which were exceptionally clean with an amazing bath room, jacuzzi bath, seperate shower cubicle double sink and mirror robes etc. Lots of wardrobe space again in a seperate area to the living room and bedroom (which had the most comfortable bed ever!). We were staying in NYC for my 30th birthday and hubby arranged for breakfast and champagne to be delivered to the suite, we received the most amazing breakfast - there was so much food, all of which was served to us, it was amazing - a big platter of pancakes, bacon, sausage and french toast, a platter of fruit and a platter of muffins and patiseries - for which we were only charged the hot buffet addition($5 per head!) and no extra service for room delivery (not many hotels do this these days either!). We also received comlimentary champagne vouchers for the bar at check-in - again a very nice little touch! Every member of staff from the cleaner to the manager who arranged our transport back to JFK during the subway strike was friendly, polite and offered first class service, I can not see how others have moaned about this hotel. Each time we left or arrived back at the hotel we received lovely greetings from the doorman and reception staff all enquiring about our day and how much we enjoyed the city - again a personal touch you don't receive in many of the bigger chains. The rat was there when we arrived - what difference did that make none! It was gone the second day - after all this is NYC - it all adds a touch of character to this vibrant city. Again others have mentioned the poor view of the Empire State Building but all have failed to point out that the hotel have lost their view due to a large apartment complex which is under construction (construction was under way during our stay and we heard no noise at all from the site and they started work early morning!) that has blocked out all but the Peak of the building - not a fault of the hotel mis- advertising. Location wise you can't go wrong at all, the hotel is a great central base to explore all that new york has to offer - it is also minutes away from a subway station if you don't feel like walking. All in all we very much enjoyed our stay here and would not hesitate in recommending this hotel to friends and family, I also hope to return with the girls next December and again will be looking to book this hotel. We booked the hotel in early 05 through express-res, paying only $250 for their executive suite - what an absolute bargain - for the quality offered.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Iana
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my family for 3 days mid December. Room was a bit small, but we were hardly there. Staff were fantastic-very helpful. Empire State building is 2 minutes walking away, and you are only 5 minutes taxi ride away from all the sights. I would definetly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Horrendous Customer Service and Staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The worst customer service experience I've had in 15 yrs of travelling - I call to reconfirm my reservation and to let them know that I will be checking-in late (even though I have confirmed with a CC). The person on the other end is rude, short with me, disinterested and hangs up without 'good-bye' or anything. - I check in and get a twin smoking room, when I had reserved an executive non-smoking room. Front desk makes no mention of this. - Next moring, I go to ask about the room switch and front desk pretends as if nothing is wrong. They make me go get a print out of my reservation at which point the whip out my folio and, of course, printed in big letters are "executive non-smoking". Need to hassel the front desk to get them to switch me. - At checkout, no modification is made to my bill to reflect the downgrade in room. Again, it is an uphill and painful battle to get them to do anything. Finally, I ask to talk to the manager who gives me the run around. They agree to 'make an exception' for me and give me 30% off (basically what I would have paid if I'd have booked a twin room to begin with). I need to get to the airport so I reluctantly agree. I get them to print out another bill and instead, it has 15% off! Need to again have the manager come out to get the 30% and even then they did not apply the discount to all the NYC taxes! And lastly, the promised view of the Empire State Building is laughable. You can only see the landmark if you crane your neck at a severe angle. Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Fix the Basics.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a girls' weekend away with my mom, sister and niece; a pre-holiday weekend in NYC. Given our space needs, the room size & price was appealing. The decor was pleasant, location decent for Broadway & shopping. Not terribly convenient if you spend a lot of time in Midtown. We stayed three days, two nights: Dec 16-18 th. Problems began night one when the bathroom facilities wouldn't work - and this continued until the time we checked out. While the front desk and maintenance attendants were accomodating, this was truly inconvienent. I won't return.

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay at the Avalon.”
Reviews.Author: Mutt99
Reviews.Content: This is my second stay at the Avalon, first since it changed hands. Booked it on Orbitz for $189/night. A real bargain this time of year. Had a standard room which was a bit small but immaculate. Great marble bath. Free high-speed broadband is a nice touch. I was a bit concerned because it was right next to the elevator but I never heard a sound. My only complaint it that the heating/air con is pretty bad. Temp "control" is marginal at best. Every day there were union pickets out front with an inflatable giant rat - very entertaining! Their main gripe is that the hotel is non-union. No sympathy from me, since I'm often in NYC exhibiting at the Javits Center and have to deal with the organized extortion of the convention unions.

Reviews.Title: “great location for shopping...”
Reviews.Author: mrandmrsbra
Reviews.Content: i stayed in this hotel for 5 nights in a junior suite room from the 25 nov '05. being 3 girls on a shopping / partying holiday we found this hotel to be wonderful....so close to Macy's ,which was handy as half way through our shopping day we could return back to the hotel,leave are bags there , and head out for some more retail therepy.. and the hotel is so close to madison square gardens (where we were lucky enough to see the georgous Jon Bon Jovi) the hotel staff we really friendly, we only had 1 problem and that was the heating in our room - it was too cold but as soon as i told the staff behind the front desk they changed the temp straight away. on our last day the hotel staff were soooo good, our flight wasn't until 9 so the bellboy held our bags for the day and the front desk staff arranged a suv to bring u to the airport (we had that many bags a taxi wouldnt fit us). i would deffinality recommend this hotel and i would also stay there again for my next trip to New York which hopefully is soon...

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a travel agent, I use this site to see what people think about hotels. I have to admit that I was concerned after I read the reviews. I was very pleased with our stay at the hotel. My family, 2 adults and 2 children, stayed at the Avalon from the 26th to the 29th of November. The front desk staff was very friendly and told us to call down if the temperature of our room was uncomfortable. We didn't need to make the call as the room was very comfortable throughout the entire stay. The room was very big and clean. The sitting room with an extra TV was great for relaxing instead of having to sit on the bed. The bathroom was large with both a shower and a bathtub plus a double sink. We had a terrific view of the Empire State Building from our room which was a hit with our children. There were no noises from above, below or beside us and the hotel was completely full. The location was very convenient to both the subway and shopping. There was a pizza place, Pete's Pizza, out the door to the left and straight across the street. It is diagonal from the deli listed in the previous review. On our last day there our train didn't leave until late in the afternoon. The bellman stored our bags and gave us directions to our last sightseeing spot. The only staff that was lacking was the breakfast staff. They were not very friendly. Even though there were quite a few negative reviews, I would definitely recommend this hotel to my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!!”
Reviews.Author: jjsmom6867
Reviews.Content: Our party of 14 (including several children)shared 4 rooms. We have found that many establishments in NYC are not anxious to accommodate young children, this hotel is the exception to the rule. Our chaotic, tired, hungry crowd was handled beautifully by the exceptional, friendly, professional staff at the Avalon. All requests were handled promptly. The room was immaculate. We were especially thrilled with the bathroom. It was extraordinarily beautiful. The housekeeping staff was always smiling and friendly. We enjoyed the convenience to the garment district, Macy's, and other favorite stores. We will definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Vincci Avalon for 4 days with my lovely grandaughter who was celebrating her 18th birthday. The location is very central and makes an excellent base. We had an amazing time. The rooms were very clean and extremely comfortable. All the staff were very courteous and helpful. I kept in touch with Ireland by way of the Internet facility which is in the lobby. We would definately recommend this hotel and without a doubt we will be staying there again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Liked the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RyanRachel
Reviews.Content: Myself and 2 girlfriends stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The only problem we encountered was the smell of cigarette smoke in the bathroom every morning. None of us smoke so it was obviously coming from another room. Our heating wasn't working properly but that was sorted as soon as we told hotel staff. Breakfast was lovely and we generally found the staff friendly. Our trip was mainly for shopping so the location was excellent. Close to Macy's. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: When we arrived, the hotel had some workers on strike in the front - they yelled into the lobby whenever the door opened. When we got up to our room - I opened the curtains and much to my dismay - there was white plastic nailed over the outside of the windows (not clear plastic, white plastic). Nothing like staying in NYC without a view!!! I contacted the front desk, they said they could move me to another room that wasn't a suite - so I opted not to move. If I was claustrophobic I wouldn't have been able to stay. Tried to order room service at 10 pm for desserts but was told "We currently don't offer room service" - they were still trying to set up a room service menu I guess? The bathroom was great - very clean, awesome water pressure!! Bed & pillows weren't too comfy. Would not stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Vincci Avalon with concerns due to previous recent reviews. Staff at reception & other services were quick, polite, very helpful & friendly.Junior suite booked for three adults which was we all agreed excellent. Extremely large, lovely sitting area, 2 T.V's, marble bathroom with bath & shower with plentiful hot water. Air conditioning was fine. All services, including room-service were very good, excellent location, breakfast free, + evening meal available however due to excess of restaurants, delis & diners we chose not to use. Regarding Union dispute (very infrequently) it was amusing to see a 15-20ft rat inflated especially when you are sat in a bar enjoying drinks (Mrs Thatcher,Unions?). We have stayed all over Europe & sailed on QM2 with 5 Star service and found this Hotel to be comparable.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: scotsmaninnyc
Reviews.Content: Second stay at the Avalon. Mix up with an online booking. Arrived to be told that no room was available for the whole 7 night stay. But they did some juggling and fixed us up. Good service from reception staff. Hotel has changed hands and not too sure which way its going to go. Met on arrival by big inflatable rat courtesy of Hotel workers Union who have a dispute with the new owners. Room was very good. Huge marble bathroom. Towels and sheets changed every day. Spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here many times”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at he Avalon on many occassions throughout the last few years and always have a great stay. The staff are courteous and professional; location is convenient to subway, Koreatown , ESB, and New yorks best beer bar--the Gingerman (36th and Madison). Rooms are clean and comfortable, well suited to a short or long term stay and the bathrooms are palacial. On one visit--new years eve 2004--they even upgadred me to a nice suite--quite lovely. And this last visit, I realized a couple hours after check out that I had left my train tickets in my room. I called the front desk and they had security retreive the tickets for me immediately--waiting for me when I went back to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and comfy”
Reviews.Author: chavala
Reviews.Content: We recently went to New York for 2 nights/3 days and we were sharing a room with my adult daughter and her partner. Our priorities were cleanliness, safe-feeling neighbourhood, and a some space in the room -given that we had 2 generations with 4 large adults. The Avalon was chosen based on reader reviews and we were very pleased. It isn't the cheapest and we'll never know if we could have found a cheaper place that was just as good...but this place was everything we needed. We had a junior suite so one couple slept in the double bed. The other couple slept separately - one had the double bed and the other took the queen sofa bed in a screened off area. The hotel is a little worn (furniture/bath area) BUT it is clean and spacious. We paid $265 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SButler198
Reviews.Content: I was recommended this hotel by a friend. We booked early in the year and as the year went on the reviews were quite mixed. However when we arrived we needn't have worried. The staff were very welcoming and accommodating. The Junior Suite we had booked was very good. Good sized room with separate lounge - 2 televisions (not that we had time to watch either of them!!) The complimentary breakfast set us up for the day. Again the staff in the dining room were excellent. The concierge was brilliant - stading out in torrential rain trying to hail taxis and organising transport back to the airport. We all look forward to returning to the Avalon - great location, great hotel. Keep up the good work. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel at the start of the summer after reading lots of good reviews however as our holiday got nearer I noticed that the reviews had taken a turn for the worse - I needn't have worried. On arrival we were offered an upgrade to a suite - a good sized room with separate lounge area. Also a really good sized bathroom. The free continental breakfast was great - plenty of choice and it really set you up for the day. Our room was at the back of the hotel so the view wasn't fantastic but this meant that it was quiet. As stated by previous reviews, the air con is a bit daft as it is controlled by the front desk. On our first day it was a bit much, but one quick phone call to reception sorted that out, and we weren't bothered with it for the rest of our stay. I found the staff very helpful, particularly Carmen on the front desk, who rang round a number of ticket agents til I eventually got tickets for U2 in Madison Square Gardens - The perfect end to a brilliant stay in New York! I would definitely recommend this hotel, as it really good value and in an excellent location.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lobby was certainly attractive, but the room was just okay. The location is excellent and valet parking is a major plus. Our biggest problem was the temperature - it was freezing! Only stayed one night. Found the front desk staff to be polite but not at all warm or friendly. They are doing work on the facade of the building so the windows in our room were totally covered in paper - very unpleasant. A minor complaint was that the coffee station only offered 2 packages of sugar - not really sufficient if more than one person likes sugar in their coffee. Finally we were under the impression that we were entitled to a free continental breakfast, but that was not the case. Would not recommend this hotel when there are so many in NYC that are nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, would definately stay there again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our first anniversary. We were treated wonderful. Our room, which was a regular superior room, was great. Very spacious and clean. Our bathroom was huge compared to other hotels. The staff was very helpful. I lost a diamond earring in the sink and the maintenance man was quick to retrieve it. Our room was a perfect temperature. Not too warm and not too cool. It is a great location. Easy walk to uptown and downtown to the flatiron district. Short walk to Penn Station. I will definately stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel at stunning price for NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I picked the Avalon after a lot of research, mostly on trip advisor. I have to admit to being a little nervous before ariving as I was able to get rooms for 100UKP per night which was at least 50 UKP cheaper than almost any other cheap(for NYC) hotel with comparable reviews on trip advisor. I need ont have worried. The rooms (booked through expedia.co.uk) were junior suites and from what I gather were absolutely huge by NY standards. Two large beds, plenty of room around them, and then a seperate area by the window seperated off with a desk, a sofa and chair, a table and a second large tv. And if that wasn't enough, we even got a free continental breakfast every morning. Just superb! The hotel is just round the corner from the Empire State building, and is right near 5th Avenue which is where much of the shoping is done. Maddison Sqaure Garden is also jsut 2 minutes walk away. The only problem we had (which was nothing to do with the hotel) was that one of our party had their bag stolen while eating in a mexican just round the corner. As with any big city, you really do have to be careful with bags/wallets etc. The service at the hotel was also preety good for a big city. The people at the front desk answered all our questions well and made an effort. One of the waiters and one of the porters struggled a little with English but most were extremely kind and helpful. I would definately stay here again if I could get the same price given the price, the breakfast, the room size and the location.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel, will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: jmee
Reviews.Content: Having just spent three nights in the Avalon, I have to say that I was very impressed with the hotel. The staff were courteous at check in, the room was exactly what we had reserved (we phoned to confirm the reservation prior to leaving as we had also reserved through an internet site). Very spacious, clean, and most surprisingly, quiet! The location is fantastic for shopping, the ESB and Times Square. I will definitely be recommending this hotel to anyone else that is thinking about a trip to NYC, and hope to return there myself in the not to distant future.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the third time and hotel has changed hands. Big difference. My room was freezing cold the second night and I asked what could be done. The front desk staff seems like their faces would crack if they smiled at you. They told me they would handle it from a central control. They shut it off and when I returned from a full day of shopping during record breaking heat, it had been shut off completely and my room was over one hundred degrees. I also had a pillar in my room less than a foot and a half from the bed(with only one way out the other side was against the wall). I asked if they could switch me to a room where wouldn't walk into a pillar in the middle of the night. Front desk advised I should ask not to have that room when I came back again!!!!! The bell staff is awesome but does not make up for the terrible front desk staff. No pens in the room anymore only pencils and all toiletries which used to be wonderful are now Wal Mart style. Big rat and protestors out front making it difficult to get in and out.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We actually first stayed at the Kitano Hotel, where my in-laws were staying, and then moved to the Avalon once they left as it was half the price. I've got to say, I was pleasantly surprised. We got there at 11am and the staff checked us in (without the usual early check in mark-up) no problem. The room was surprisingly big and had a sitting area (not the case at the much more costly Kitano). The only real drawback for us were the two 'super single' beds (perhaps they were European doubles or something, but they were small). Yes the carpets have seen better days. And the view was of the back alley, but that also meant the room was very quiet. For the price--well under $200 including tax--it was a great deal for NYC and a great location--just around the corner from the Empire State Building. I'd definitely stay here again as this is real value for your money.

Reviews.Title: “I was not impressed!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just got back Sunday from NYC. I chose the Avalon from all the reviews and for the price. The location is pretty good. The room was pretty big and clean. My first problem was that you can not control your air. It's either on or off. We were either freezing or sweating. If we were cold, we would have to call down to have them turn it off. Then we would get hot, we had to call to have it turned back on. Everytime the cleaning ladies came, they would only leave 1 wash cloth. We were constantly calling down for more wash cloths. The big kicker is that they made a copy of my debit/checking card upon my arrival. When I checked out, I paid cash. Which would obviously mean to them, that they would not charge my debit card. WRONG!! They took my cash and charged my debit card. I'm having to dispute this and I still haven't gotten my money back into my checking account. They are swearing up and down that they refunded me, but they haven't. It's been a big mess!! I visit NYC every September and I will not be going back to the Avalon. If you can afford it, stay at the San Carlos Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: On arriving at the Avalon after a long flight we were greeted by a large inflatable rat and a few protestors shouting at us about the awful hotel we were about to enter!! Worriedly we checked in , to be highly surprised at the spacious, clean and quiet room we were given. Excellent service throughout our stay both from reception, bell boy and bar/restaurant staff. Didnt see the protestors again during our stay which which good!!Superb buffet style breakfast each morning and an excellent meal in the restaurant one evening made our stay more enjoyable. Fantastic location for us Macy addicts!!Loved the whole stay at the Avalon and will definately return....please just fix the air condtioning if you read this management...so cold at night ...we were not advised it was regulated at a main control system until we queried it !!

Reviews.Title: “Spring for the Executive King Suite”
Reviews.Author: jeffpsd
Reviews.Content: My first time to the Avalon, which I deceided on based on Trip Advisor comments. When I arrived I was given a deluxe king, not what I had reserved and I asked to be moved. Shortly, Ania from the front desk (she was a great help) let me know that she found me exeutve king (what I had reserved). What a difference; larger bath (by itself as large as some NYC hotel rooms) with jacuzzi tub, a large entry with hardwood flooring, much more room and a view of the ESB from my desk (with computer, fax and free internet). Breakfast is served at the Avalon (complementary for the time being) but no dinner, lunch or room service due to the hotel changing hands; no big deal, lots of place to eat in the area. Get a Executive king; a great deal and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Above Average Avalon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our week at The Avalon. The receptionist who checked us in was very brusque with us - not the sort of thing you need when you have been travelling for over 12 hours. However the man who took our luggage up and showed us our room more than made up for her. He was very helpful and pleasant. When we booked it clearly said two double beds, however only one in our room but there was a sofabed which my daughter was quite happy with. Hotel said that people who book with Expedia usually given only one double. I did check prior to leaving with Expedia and told two doubles had been booked - however not the case. Room felt clean, beautifully furnished. Bed very comfortable. Bathroom and shower fiinshed in marble so very luxurious. More than enough clean towels daily. Air con was a problem though. Was on when we arrived - the room was freezing. After asking five times it was eventually turned off. We then had it on during the day and would ask to have it turned off late at night as otherwise, although hot outside, it would have made our room too cold. Breakfast had a good variety of food- cereals, bagels, toast, fruit, pastries, juice and tea and coffee but the one thing that let it down was the head waiter who took your breakfast voucher - he was not approachable at all. Just pointed you to your table! Negative points then are - two receptionists who were brusque and rude. Air con too cold and no controls in your room. Although tea and coffee making facilities available in your room no kettle but a coffee percolator to heat water which effectively meant water hot but never boiled! Waiter in dining room not friendly at all. Positive points are that all other members of staff very pleasant, kind and more than helpful. We were even offered an umbrella one day when it had rained. Location excellent - just off Fifth Avenue and one block from The Empire State Building. Lovely room - clean and comfortable. General areas of hotel eg lobby etc very clean. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to other people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location; clean, spacious room; highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a very comfortable 3 night stay at the Avalon Hotel. We read the reviews that were posted on Trip Advisor before we booked it (beginning of August) and the reviews were very positive. However we checked back a couple of days before we were due to arrive and we were concerned that the reviews had deteriorated (the reviews were quite negative) so we were not sure what to expect. Thankfully our experience was like the ones we read in early August ... it was very, very good. The only problem we encountered was no bar fridge in our room when we arrived -- but that was very promptly remedied. Within 10 minutues of reporting that we did not have one, a bar fridge arrived. Staff was very courteous and friendly. Room was spacious (2 beds, plus sofa bed); bathroom was huge; decor very nice. If you are looking for a small hotel close to everything (e.g., Empire State Building is a 5 minute walk away), choose the Avalon. We did a lot of research on hotel prices before we left and the Avalon was very reasonably priced for the area we were staying in and the size of the room. The hotel was fully booked on the day we left (yesterday), so I think that speaks for itself. We would definately go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings about the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: summ3r
Reviews.Content: My family (my husband, 3 teenagers) and I stayed at the Avalon for a week in August and we definitely have mixed feelings about the experience. The Positives first: A great price for a room large enough to handle a family of 5. It makes a big difference to the budget when we don't have to take two rooms, especially with the prices in NYC for the kind of hotel you would want your family to stay in, and we were very happy with the size of the room we had. The bathroom was excellent: large, clean and in excellent condition. The room had two queens (not just doubles) and a pull-out couch in the sitting room so there was plenty of room for everyone. There were two televisions in the room, one in the sitting room and one in the main bedroom, and kids really liked having their own tv. There is free internet access on a computer in the lobby, on a first come first served basis, and my kids really enjoyed being able to talk to their friends and catch up on the latest news from home. The breakfast included in the room rate (another big plus for families) was fine. We arrived for breakfast at various times between 8 a.m. and 9:30 a.m. every morning and there was always a nice selection of pastries, bagels, muffins, fresh fruit and fruit salad, cold meat, cheese, cereals and juices. We thought that the location of the hotel was fantastic. It's just around the corner from the Empire State Building and because it's so central we were able to walk to most of the sites on our "Must See" list. The Grayline Bus Tours stop at the Empire State Building as well so it was extremely convenient. There are a number of Korean/Japanese restaurants on 32nd Street within a couple of blocks of the Avalon (one of which is open 24 hours a day and which served a very nice teriyaki salmon though the Hot Pot was dry) as well as the usual Wendy's, McDonald's, Burger King etc. for the kids. The Negatives: The queen beds were made up with double sheets so the sheets tended to "wander" in the night because they weren't large enough to be properly tucked in underneith. The pull-out couch wasn't made up when we arrived so I had to call down and ask for it to be done - a pain when we were all exhausted from travelling all day. The Avalon also had the most bizarre thing I've ever experienced - the Hotel Office had complete control over the air conditioning in our room! We froze and we sweated at the whim of the Office. I tried calling and arranging when the a/c should be turned on and off every day so we wouldn't have to keep bothering them but they didn't pay any attention. It seemed as though the a/c would just come on at odd times, morning, noon and night. There didn't seem to be any connection between when they would turn the a/c on and the actual temperature of the room. I had to call the Office and make a request everytime we wanted the a/c turned on or off and while the hotel engineer sometimes got the msg immediately, sometimes we had to wait for hours and make repeated calls. It was ridiculous. Another irritation was the lack of an ice machine for guests' use. One has to call down and request ice (with the requisite Tip for the delivery of course). We decided to do without after the first day. And for some reason, even though I told them daily that there were 5 people in the room, we always only received four towels so we had to request more every day. And finally, one evening there was large inflatable Rat stationed in front of the hotel when we returned, evidently there was a dispute between the union and the owners; an unpleasant sight and not what I wanted to see on my vacation. I'm not sure if I'd want to stay at the Avalon again. The positives were great, but the negatives, though some may seem trivial, were a constant irritation for the entire week of our stay and it seemed as though no one in the front office cared enough to make things right.

Reviews.Title: “Great Style - but lacking substance”
Reviews.Author: Shallam
Reviews.Content: My family (2 adults, 2 children) booked The Avalon because of the great Trip Advisor reviews. Our experience was not as positive as we had hoped based on these reviews. It's a stylish hotel, but the basics you expect from this standard of hotel were lacking. First, the negatives: overflowing toilet which took 3 phone calls (and a full day) to repair. Angry union staff picketing every day outside the front door. Non-functioning refridgerator. Long queues for breakfast with a very grumpy waiter. 2 towels for 4 people, with more delivered when we rang housekeeping. Pay-TV movie cut out 15 minutes before the end, which was refunded when we mentioned the problem. On the other hand, service from particular individuals was superb. Free internet access in the lobby. Great location. Clean rooms. Comfortable beds. So, would we recommend The Avalon to others, or indeed stay here again ourselves? Unfortunately, no. New York is full of boutique hotels, and I would suggest staying elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Alright for the money”
Reviews.Author: ayakeela
Reviews.Content: We actually booked the hotel through cheaptickets and got a "great" deal. I think it was more cheaptickets[-]'s fault than the actual hotel, but when we checked in, they gave us the wrong room. There were 4 of us staying at the hotel in one room and we needed 2 beds. But when we get upstairs, there was only 1 full size bed. My brother-in-law argued at the front desk for over an hour, and FINALLY they bumped us to to a bigger room, but it only sleeps 3. We made do, but the fact that they weren't as helpful as they should've been left us with a sour taste. The hotel in itself is very pretty, very clean. Loved the bathroom, it was huge! The bed was very comfy. The pull out coach is made for one tiny person. It was very quiet and we were quiet comfy. The location isn't the best, it's pretty dirty outside. But what do you expect for NYC? Would we stay there again? Maybe.

Reviews.Title: “Avalon No. 1 with us we will return”
Reviews.Author: AJBruss
Reviews.Content: The Avalon is great value - stayed with my husband and son (10 yrs old) and enjoyed the great location on E 32nd Street bewtween 5th Ave and Madison Ave... just 1 block from the Empire State building and a short walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station, and central sites. Booked this Hotel after reading reviews from other tourists on trip advisor and definately not disappointed. The search for a NY Hotel is over we will definately return here. Booked a Jnr suite - confirmed our booking one week in advance and everything was in order on arrival. Rooms spacious with lovely bathroom (reviews are correct bathrooms are big). Air conditioning worked a treat and controllable in the room. Safe Deposit in room easy to use.
