Reception staff friendly and helpful, breakfast was good, plenty to eat considering it is included in price (go to breakfast 7 - 8.30am and you will avoid rush) and dining room staff very nice and chatty. Great Delis in area if you want a change for Breakfast/lunch/or evening snack. Did a NY City tour on the 'Party Shuttle Bus' really enjoyed the day,good frmat to tour, excellent tour guides and got to see alot in a short space of time. Empire State building - we went straight after breakfast at 8.15am and did not have to que - worth the early rise - Statue of Liberty - Ellis Island all great trips. Planning a return trip - NY Great - felt very safe and relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “NY hotel”
Reviews.Author: Nottingham_UKGraham
Reviews.Content: We found the Avalon to be well positioned, good value especially for 2 families (both having 4 kids), the complimentary breakfast exceded expectations and would be happy to recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic value and brilliant locutation”
Reviews.Author: TheOHareclan
Reviews.Content: 7 of us stayed for 2 nights in The Avalon and had a very pleassant stay. The location is very central in manhattan and walking distance to Macys, Empire Statae, Penn station Madison Sq etc Staff at reception were helpful and friendly, rooms spacious and comfortable. We booked 2 rooms and each room accomodated 4 without difficulty. The 2 tvs were useful as the kids could watch different stations. Internet access was available in the lobby (free) Complimentary breakast was a bonus Would highly recommend this hotel-family friendly

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location in heart of NYC...great value!”
Reviews.Author: Frederick_Rochester
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my girlfriend here 2 nights in late July and was very pleased. The Avalon is in a great location on E 32nd Street bewtween 5th Ave and Madison Ave... just 1 block from the Empire State building (feels like it's right on top of you) and a 10 minute walk to Times Square, Grand Central Station, Rockefeller Center, and much more. The hotel was clean and the room had a lot of charm with an amazing view of the Empire State building. The staff was very polite and helpful. Used the valet parking service and was charged $29 a day which is the price for SUV's...some hotels charge as much as $50 a day. No complaints about the room at all. Only odd thing was having to call the front desk for ice....I searched in vain for an ice machine before finding out they deliver a bucket to your room. If you're looking for a nice room and don't need a pool, fitness room, spa, etc....this is your place. I was able to get the room thru Expedia for $139 a night, an unbelievable value for a nice accomodations in Manhattan. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great price!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the Avalon hotel. The room was spacious with a sitting room, bed room and LARGE bathroom. The staff was great, especially with getting us cabs in a very busy part of NYC. We had a view of the Empire State building from our room. The hotel is in walking distance from most of mid-town Manhattan. Some of the furnishings are dated, but everything was very clean. The bed was really comfortable, and the mini-bar snacks were quite affordable. The free continental breakfast had limited offerings, but was good nonetheless. Get there before 8:30 or 9:00 or it will be slim pickings! We will stay there again on our next trip to NYC. It was only about $180 per night in the middle of December.

Reviews.Title: “Saddened by my experience”
Reviews.Author: Schaffnva
Reviews.Content: I first stayed at the Avalon five years ago and have fond memories. This trip did not provide a similar experience. Overall I thought the hotel looked tired. The carpet in the lobby (right in front of the reception desk) is fraying at the seams. Things were similar for the room as well. First off, when I stepped off the elevator onto the 12th floor, I was immediately greeted by the strong smell of moth balls. The room itself, # 1204, an executive suite, was disappointing as it was showing its age as well. The bed's mattress has seen better days; the furniture in the sitting area was uncomfortable (springs busted in the chair, the couch looked horrible). The only thing I thought was good was the bathroom; the all tile bathroom is nice and HUGE. However, even that room had a problem. The drip strip on the bottom of the shower door was partially detached and maintenance never fixed the problem. How difficult is it to fix a stripped screw? None the less, I did a quick fix so we could close the door. To top it all off, the local union was on strike with a huge rat on display in front of the hotel. There is nothing more pleasant than walking through a picket line to enter a property. As for staying at the Avalon again, it is not my first choice. My fond memories from years past are heavily tainted. Management has committed the greatest sin of any business, hording the profits and not reinvesting back into the product to keep its standards high. Vincci Hotels had a golden goose but overworked the poor thing so now it is only a shadow of its former glorious self. Disappointing to say the least.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel on 32nd St”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say, pick the Avalon Hotel for your next NYC vacation. The rooms a perfectly fitted for families and the hotel itself was nice-here, it's all about the marble. I booked our one week stay on the hotel's website and it was very nice. You must remember to comfirm your stay once every week before you arrive. That way you won't have to go through all of the two-hour "I know my reservation is there" argument. The hotel's condition was like any other good NYC twelve-floor hotel. The entrance sign is big-you can see it and the beginning of the block. Check-in was easy, but plan to go out to eat or do something; your room may not be ready when you arrive. The location was excellent. The Empire State Building is close by (not to mention the great view from the 7th floor rooms), a Starbucks nearby, and plenty of small shops with everything from toys to "I Love NY" t-shirts. Our room was a deluxe suite-room 703. The rooms are very clean, quiet and extrmeley beautiful. From the marble bathrooms to the comfortable sofas, everything is good from start to finish. A note-the TVs go to the hotel's channel mannualy. So if you turn it to the news, look forward to seeing channel 3 when you come back. The elevators are clean and fast. One unusual thing-our air conditioning worked perfectly fine, not a disturbance at all during our stay. Try the doorman service and let your hands rest. This loving hotel is great and we look forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “The Avalon - Could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My extended family stayed in 3 separate rooms at the Avalon from 5/19-5/23. The rooms were adequate, but air conditioning became a significant challenge! The front desk must activate/deactivate the a/c. We had to have them activate it after arriving to our rooms.... and it ran all the time.... not necessarily a bad thing, but for some reason it sucked in cigarette smoke from the hallways or another room and our room reeked! The front desk assured us that the hotel was all non-smoking, though it appears that they still have smoking/non-smoking rooms. The smell got so bad that we had to have the mgmt shut off our a/c altogether. If it had been in the middle of July, we'd have a big problem with that! The staff was mostly friendly - except for 1 female at the front desk that seemed to be overly bothered at any request we made (see a/c comments above). Simple requests for assistance were met with resistance and rudeness. The rest of the staff were accomodating and friendly. The breakfast offered in the a.m. was good, however, limited. Finding a seat was often a challenge and they ran out of food fairly early in the a.m. Dinner at the restaurant was pricey, but decent. There are a bunch of small restaurants nearby that are a good value. The location is good if you're touring Manhattan. Its very central to just about everything. Subway access is about 3 blocks away. Free internet access was offered on 2 computers in/near the lobby - a nice touch. We probably won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel Better then the Hilton!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in June 2005. My husband and 3 small children. Huge Double beds!! Great Price for New York and a GREAT Location!!! Right in the middle of everything and if your not it's a short walk or quick metro Ride!! Tip- By the $7.00 all day Metro pass but make sure that you wait 18 minutes before trying to get through the same gate twice. Easy location off the highway and easy to get home. Quick check in and checkout and good security. We have stayed at the Times Square Hilton and this is MUCH BETTER!!!!!! We had one small problem and it was taken care of in 1 second flate!! Polite staff and very friendly. Parking was a small walk down the street but you can also get it valet. TIP- make sure your parking pass is validated before you leave the hotel. You will save money. When we go back to NY we are staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint, friendly hotel but has changed hands”
Reviews.Author: greatguglimugli
Reviews.Content: We stayed here July 1-6 and had a lovely time. Due to an ownership changeover, the restaurant was closed except for the complementary breakfast. I loved the elegant feel to the lobby area with adjoining sitting area/library. Everyone was quite friendly but surprisingly not very knowledgeable about things I wanted to do. For instance, we wanted to walk along the Brooklyn Promenade but no one at the desk had heard of it. When we got to the Brooklyn High St subway station, the Promenade was clearly marked on the map in the station. By this we saw that a different subway line would have been better. But we had a nice walk anyway. This is just one example... It was nice that the hotel was very convenient for many different subway lines and buses. For those interested, there is a nice vegan restaurant right next door. The size of the room was just right for our family of 4. However, my 17yo son was not happy with the cable TV channels available. Overall we had an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant hotel”
Reviews.Author: Getupandgotoday
Reviews.Content: Spent 7 nights in New York at the end of June, staying in the Avalon hotel on E 32nd Street. The hotel was pleasant with average sized rooms and those at the front had a superb view of the Empire State Building. Location was excellent with one block to 5th Avenue, two blocks to Macys and two blocks to the subway station. The complimentary breakfast was good and made life easier than having to go out to look for breakfast. The staff were all very pleasant. The only downside was that our room (602) was below a handicapped room with a walk in shower which leaked through into our bathroom. Not nice to have water coming through the bathroom light fitting. We complained to reception and were moved to a higher floor with no further problems. The hotel is listed on the internet as 4 star, however I would say it was a three star hotel. I would certainly consider staying here again when I come back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: Bunker_Dude
Reviews.Content: Had two seprate stays in NYC in a week. The other stay was in the Affinia Dumont (rated #2), so thought that the Avalon would be worse than them. How wrong! Had a King Suite on the 12th floor and it was ENORMOUS for NYC. Huge bathroom with Jacuzzi, small lounge ante room. Big bedroom. All clean and a bed big enough to hold your own sporting events in! Plus a view of ESB through the window. If you can get one of these suites just do it. Hear me? Just do it! You won't regret it. I will absolutely go for this next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Avalon is Your Average Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Honeymooners89
Reviews.Content: A couple of girlfriends and myself stayed at The Avalon between June 30-July 3rd, and honestly it was not as good as all the reviews had proclaimed it to be. First of all, we had much trouble getting into New York City b/c all the flights into LGA were cancelled, so we made it there a day later and the hotel still insisted on charging me for the night. I understand their cancellation policy of 24 hrs, but all flights being cancelled was beyond my control!! A little sympathy would have been nice. The rooms were smaller than they looked on the website, but nonetheless very clean. The concierge staff were nice but not as friendly as I had expected....I've been greeted nicer at stores where my money wasn't even spent. The door staff were very helpful and nice though (thanks guys!). The continental breakfast was a nice touch if you can make it there before 10am. It does get a little busy in the eating room, so go early if you can to get it fresh and first. All in all, The Avalon is a fair hotel for what you pay. Good location, clean rooms, okay service....just don't miss your flight!

Reviews.Title: “highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RHeath
Reviews.Content: I stayed here whilst attending a sporting event for 5 nights. As soon as I arrived the doorman was so lovely, he helped me to my room and then stood chatting with me for ten minutes, very interested in why I had gone over there. The hotel is right by the empire state which was excellent, it meant that everything was only a short cab ride or subway journey away. The hotel couldn't do enough for us, it was imaculate and the room was very comfy. I had the standard double for myself and it was perfect, may've been more of a squeeze had there been two of us. Our timing for breakfast wasn't the greatest, but four people squeezed up so we could join them. This hotel is highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: cmtmom
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel. Stayed in room 1207...2 double beds, pull out couch, 2 tv's. Had a litle trouble adjusting the thermostat...it stayed pretty cold. The bathroom is gigantic, and not just by NYC standards. Continental breakfast was more than adequate ...cereal, muffins, toast, bagels, boiled eggs, fruit, juices. The prix fix lunch is a great deal, too....three courses and drink for $20. Just about the best meal we had in NYC! I'd give this hotel an excellent rating if it were in a different neighborhood. I prefer the Times Square area or Central Park. However, this area seemed safe and was with walking distance of great shopping and the Theatre District. For $190/night (at a time when comparable hotels were asking $300+), this was an excellent deal. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Sweet!”
Reviews.Author: GirglKrautbichler
Reviews.Content: My teenage daughters and I stayed at the Avalon in mid-June 2005 (room 1207). The hotel is in a central location in Midtown Manhattan, a short walk from the subway station, and an even shorter one from the Empire State Building. The hotel staff has been friendly and professional, the rooms are *great* - especially the gorgeous bathroom - and the complimentary breakfast is very good. Our room had free high-speed internet, too. Nice. We really enjoyed our stay and will definitely try to get a room there whenever we're in NYC again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: Mikhal1719
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 609 at the Avalon as part of a wedding weekend. Three of us had a junior suite with two double beds and a sitting room area, separated by a large screen, with a sleeper sofa. The room was comfortable but had a long rather narrow hallway to negotiate from the door to the bathroom to the bedroom, and the view was not much to speak of. The thermostat was hard to figure out, so the first night we were too warm but finally figured out how to regulate the temperature in the room and the second night was nicely cool. The iron that came with the room unfortunately had a bad leak. When we called the front desk, someone brought up a new one within just a few minutes. This was typical of the entire staff, which was very friendly and helpful. The towels and amentities were set up for two people but shortly after we called and requested more towels, a staffer brought us several more sets of towels and enough small bottles of shampoo, conditioner, etc. for six people. The complimentary breakfast was more than adequate and the computer set up for internet access was useful, although the hotel did not have wireless capability. Overall, I would rate the Avalon excellent for its outstanding staff and fair for its accommodations, a decent value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “blew off our reservation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a room at the Avalon a few months ago based on reviews, great rate, etc for two families, 4 people in each room. It was a celebration of my 50th birthday and the weekend was planned around staying in this location. We dropped off luggage at the hotel in the am, were charged for the rooms, and told to come back later in the afternoon when our rooms would be ready. When we got there at 3:00 pm we were told we no longer had rooms- the people who were in our rooms had extended their stay. We could choose to stay in a room with one double bed or they would move us to another hotel in the Times Sq. Area. We were livid- but there was not much of a choice. when we got to the other hotel (Millenium Broadway) they did not have rooms to accommodate our two parties of four. again we didn't have much choice but to stay in two rooms with two oversize single beds each. Fortunately the rooms were very nice and the staff at the Millenium were sympathetic. Not so at the Avalon. they basically said this happens and there's nothing they can do about it. it was a disappointment and a hassle and I will never book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, 1st class”
Reviews.Author: StantheMan
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed in this Hotel for 10 nights following positive reviews on this site. We weren't disappointed!! We checked into an exec suite which was huge, clean & very comfortable. Yes, the air con was noisy but, guess what, ask to have it switched off & problem solved :o). I found the staff to be friendly & efficient and the inclusive breakfast more than adequate. The only reason I can't give full marks was because the restaurant is looking a little ' tired ' and because dinner becomes a little expensive when 18.5% gratuity is added to the bill, whereas, say Oscars at the Waldorf allow you to tip according to service. But still, generally great hotel & no qualms about recommending or staying again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Avalon!”
Reviews.Author: LegalRN
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I recently spent a week at The Avalon Hotel and we absolutely loved it! What a gem! All of the staff were so wonderful, friendly and helpful. Our junior suite room was very spacious and clean. We would highly recommend this charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “fantasic base for ny”
Reviews.Author: bidstrer74
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 908 not much of a view but then you dont exactly stay in your room when your in such a great city ,the room was a junior suite very clean and very comfortable good sized bath room iron + board for all those last minute decreases ,safty deposite box( free) in your room mini bar(you may think its expensive but its actually the same price as most bars in the area) hotel staff were freindly and helpful breakfast is basically muffins ,bagels bread, danish ,boiled eggs and fruit the norm really , but waiting for people to finish can be a drag ,but the local deli was more than accomidating if you want something different to the hotel. Based in between madison and 5th avenue on east 32 street this is an amazing base empire state builing is only i block away and macys ,times square and grand central station all walkable but the subway is located on 34th street west and 33rd street east if you dont want to walk. The avalon is an above average hotel that is clean and well maintained in a very central location with easy access to all of new york at a very good price if you can get an internet deal ! just dont forget to turn your ac off at night as it is a bit loud. hope ypu enjoyit as much as me and my wife did !

Reviews.Title: “A value for money gem in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Gamela
Reviews.Content: Have just returned from a weeks stay at the Avalon. We chose this hotel from reviews on this site. We were very pleased and surprised with the size and quality of the rooms and the bathroom, as well as all the extra features to make our stay comfortable, not to mention the view of the Empire State building from our window. The breakfast, which is included in the tariff was more than adequate. All staff we came into contact with were exceptionally pleasant and helpful, especially Nancy and Carmen at reception. We have visited New York on many occasions and feel we will never have to look for another hotel, as in future we will be staying at the Avalon, as long as we can get a booking. We feel it is really good value for money and very well situated to all Manhattan has to offer. The only reason I did not give this hotel a full score was because we found the air conditioner and the lift beside our room to be a bit noisy. Apart from this we were sad to leave this comfortable homely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “one of the best hotel i ever been in manhattan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i am from paris and was at the avalon for 8 nights in may 27 of 2005 ,it was my 10 trip to new-york and my first time in the avalon.i know the hilton and the parker meridien and many other hotels in new-york and find this one the best;my junior suite was lovely arranged and very spacious normaly hotels rooms in manhattan are tiny! very nice staff !if i ever return to manhattan i will return to the avalon;which is near everthing located in the heart of manhattan.Excellent restaurant in the hotel and excellent japanese restaurant is the neighbour

Reviews.Title: “Best choice in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: BCmo
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend & I visited NYC for our 1st time on May 5th, 2005. We stayed at The Avalon for 2 nights. I had my expectations already high as I read many reviews before I booked and saw a few pictures and out of all others I reviewed, it was the nicest at it's price. My expectations were definitely met in terms of the atmosphere of the hotel & the room. It is a small older building with European charm & the staff was welcoming. But the best thing about it was that it is smack dab in the middle of Manhatten...literally steps from the Empire State building (Midtown). You walk outside, look up, and there it is! It was easy to get to and the valet parking was very convenient (considering finding parking in NYC isn't!). We checked in and went up to our room and were pleasantly surprised with how spacious and beautiful the room was. There was only the 2 of us, so the sitting room with couch & 2nd TV wasn't required, but we still enjoyed it as we were able to sit somewhere other than our bed to watch TV. The bathroom was spectacular! All marble...2 sinks, seperated tub & shower stall. There's even a phone next to the toilet...you know...in case you run out of toilet paper! We asked for a king-size bed and got one, which is always nice. The complimentary continental breakfast was neither here nor there. Coffee not good (take a walk to Starbucks instead) and you have to be there pretty early to get anything good. Both mornings we weren't down before 9am (goes until 10am) and we were left with stale bread to toast and a little fruit and cereal (if you like cereal). But hey, maybe we shouldn't have slept so late. And hey, it's free. There was 1 little annoying thing that went on that prevented me from scoring The Avalon with 4 dots...it was the room temperature. Unfortunately, the weekend we were there was not a nice one....it was very cold and rainy, yet the staff had just happened to turn the A/C on that very same day therefore no heat! The vent was not only loud because it was right about our heads where we slept, but it was pumping out very cold air. No matter what temp we set on the thermostat, it stayed on. It took me the 2nd day (about 5 phone calls) to have them turn it off and have them supply us with a portable heater. Overall, we had a good experience and would definitely stay there the next time we visit the Big Apple!

Reviews.Title: “1st NY visit”
Reviews.Author: 24NYCVAC
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to NY, so we are not familiar with any of the other hotels there to compare this one with. We had a jr. suite facing the ESB with one queen size bed. The size of the room was quite comfortable and clean other than the furniture could use a cleaning. It had everything we wanted in the room. A safe, two tvs, coffee pot, refrig., iron and board, blow dryer, make up mirror and free newspaper during the week. My husband and I only drink decaf. coffee and the cleaning staff was nice to leave us extra every day per our request. We never had a problem with anyone bothering our personal belongings. The bed was small for us (we're used to a king size bed), but quite comfortable. The air conditioner was broke, so we just ran the loud fan all night. For us, that was not a problem as it got rather chilly at night, and we didn't need air conditioning when we were there, but for someone else, that might be a problem, especially if it's hot outside. The fact that the fan was loud was great for us as it drowned out the street noise, and we were right next to the maintenance staff elevator on the 3rd floor, so it drowned out that noise as well. We did have maintenance work on the a.c., but they were never able to fix it while we were there. We had requested a nonsmoking room and didn't get one even though I asked the front desk when we checked in if we got a nonsmoking room and she said yes. Well, there was an ash tray and matches in the room and it stunk of stale smoke (YUK). The location was good for us. The free breakfast was a nice touch (bagels, donuts, danish, boiled eggs, fruit, yogurt, juice, toast, muffins, cereal). I also liked this hotel because they did not allow pets, which I know can be a problem. I have three dogs, and they do bark when we leave them alone. Not good when you are trying to sleep with barking dogs. I liked the thought of not having to worry about that. Overall, I would recommend this hotel. It's not the best that we have stayed in, but it is far from the worst.

Reviews.Title: “New York's Best Kept Secret”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Avalon and I wasn't disappointed. Well located for our visit. The room once again excellent: sitting area with TV, two comfortable double beds, wonderful marble bathroom, very quiet. We had dinner in the restaurant and couldn't believe how delicious everything was and reasonable for NY. The staff we had contact with was friendly and quick to give service. Service in the restaurant perfect. As soon as I arrived back home I booked the hotel again for our visit in June.

Reviews.Title: “Good place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Place is pretty nice...the Junior Suites are pretty big...make sure u double check with them by phone for reservations cause i booked it online on hotel website a week before and they didn't even have it in their system when we got there(fortunately there was rooms available)

Reviews.Title: “It was Fab!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To all those people who said the Avalon was substandard I think you must be writing a review for the wrong hotel as this place was brilliant. Not only were the bedrooms and bathrooms beautiful and the location great but the staff were some of the most efficient and friendly I've ever met- particlarly Tess who works behind the bar! They could not do enough for us even after we had checked out and reallised we had left all our flight details in the room- within 20 minutes they had found them and faxed them to us. This hotel was a real find and made my first visit to New York all the better. PS-it really does look like it does in the photos!

Reviews.Title: “Put a huge damper on my wedding....need to get their act together!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First off, let me say that the rooms are fabulous for a great price. I had a big suite with a jacuzzi, two big rooms and allo the amenities for $220. However, here's a list of the problems I had at this hotel: I booked almost 20 rooms for my wedding this past weekend. Everyone was coming from out of town. First, when I showed up to check into my room, they couldn't find the reservation. Being that it was my wedding weekend, I had confirmed it a million times. After 20 minutes, they "found it." No apologies or anything for making me crazy. The lady tried to tell my mom she was "just kidding with me." I don't think so, but even so, NOT A FUNNY JOKE! Next, my family went to check into their room. For 5 people, there was one bed in the room. The staff refused to do anything about it and when my aunt started yelling at the manager, they threatened to arrest her. Next, my new husband's friends from Wisconsin came to check in only to find that their room was only available for one night instead of the 3 nights they booked. The best man had to share his room with these friends so they didn't have to find another hotel. Next, my in laws friends from Wisconsin flew in to find there was no room for them. The staff actually said they had the reservation, BUT NO ROOM!! What is this, a Seinfeld episode?!?! My father in law had to leave our rehearsal dinner to go fight with the hotel staff. After hours, they finally "produced" a room. Next, my husband's grandmother's jewelry was stolen from the room. After all this aggravation, the hotel NEVER apologized for any of their screw ups, I had to pay for our room for every night and they weren't even nice to us. My wedding was perfect but the experience at this hotel put such a damper on things----me, my family, my husband's family and our guests were just horrified at how disorganized the staff is and how THEY WERE NOT EVEN THE LEAST BIT APOLOGETIC!!! Yes, the rooms are beautiful for a good price but I would pay triple to avoid this kind of aggravation on my wedding weekend. Avoid these people......

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our first family visit to New York”
Reviews.Author: jigglypuff
Reviews.Content: It's all been said already so I will be brief . Impressive bathroom, generous accommodation for a family of four, clean and well serviced room, pleasant staff, excellent breakfast, convenient location, good value (we paid $210 per night for a deluxe junior suite for 5 nights over Easter through Quikbook), free internet access and, yes, noisy air conditioning. If we return to New York we will head here.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Avalon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were a party of twelve (4 Scottish families) staying at the Avalon and were all more than happy with our rooms. We had 3 Jr suites and a double room all with sitting areas, the double looking out to the Empire Sate building. The rooms were large and very clean. The marble bathroms were also large with 2 sinks, separate shower and bath. The hotel made you so welcome and the complimentary breakfast was ideal for starting the day! The location was great for Macys and within walking distance to Broadway Times Square, etc and subway stations were all close by. The staff were great and helped arrange transportation for us when we had problems trying to get taxis!. We would all come back to the Avalon and would recommend to anyone else wanting to visit NY with families. Its true what they say in other reviews, this is a "Little gem".

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Foss4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for 4 nights from 30th March. We had a queen suite which was fantastic. The room was very clean and spacious and the bathroom was to die for - I only wish I could've brought it home! We opted for a suite because we are a family of 2 adults & 2 teenagers. The extra room and 2 TVs was a real bonus. I would particularly recommend this accommodation for a family with children. If you haven't got lots of plans to go out in the evening, it's an ideal set up to chill out before going to bed. The breakfast was good, although the dining room did get busy on some mornings particularly the weekend. We were fortunate enough never to have to queue for a table, but others weren't so lucky. The staff were friendly on the whole, although they did blow a bit hot & cold on occasions. The best thing about this hotel is the location. It seemed to be in the right place for everything - Empire State Building, Macy's and all the shops on 34th St, Madison Square Gardens. We found it easy to walk to everywhere because of it's central location. The worst thing was the air conditioning. We had a broken belt which buzzed for 8 seconds every 6 minutes all day and all night. The engineer eventually removed the fuse and we slept well after that. From what I can gather, the air conditioning is noisy even when you don't have a broken belt but a request to reception usually sorts it out I believe. We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Avalon Hotel-- For a Great NYC Stay”
Reviews.Author: gar-meister
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the Avalon Hotel in New York City in March of 2005. This is the second year we stayed at the Avalon while attending the Big East Basketball Tournament at Madison Square Garden. It's a great location for any event at the Garden because it is a short 3 block walk...less than 10 minutes. It also a very short walk to the Empire State Building and not far from Grand Central Station. We walked to Times Square but you are talking a 10-12 block walk at that point (20-25 minutes). The Avalon is moderately priced for NYC and gives you larger than average rooms. It is not a luxury hotel but it is clean (an absolute must for our group!!), convenient and offers all we needed. We paid $169/night by booking early through Orbitz but friends who booked later only paid $209. They offer a complimentary glass of champagne in the restaurant and a complimentary continental breakfast. They also will provide comp passes to use the Bally's Fitness center located a couple blocks away. There is free high speed internet access in the rooms and a nicely stocked and moderately priced mini-bar in the rooms. The staff at the hotel was extremely polite and helpful both times we stayed there. Parking is pricey at $30/day for cars and $40/day for SUV's and Vans but it is not out of line for NYC. I like resorts but that is not why I go to NYC so I'm not looking for that in a hotel there. I was looking for a decent sized room that is clean, comfortable, convenient and reasonable priced. I found it. I'll be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Charming and highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: ChoirboyOC
Reviews.Content: At the risk of driving up their rates, which were shockingly low when I stayed in January, let me say that this is the single best combination of value, amenities and service I've found in New York. Of course you can get a five-star room that wouldn't compare, and you'll pay for it too. If your budget is too modest for that, however, NY is famous for throwing unsuspecting tourists into odious rooms in hell hole hotels without blinking an eye. I'm happy to report that this is no such place. The staff is courteous, friendly, knowledgeable and kind. I flew in on a red-eye with a request for early check-in. Even though I was paying a discounted rate, the front desk didn't hesitate to offer me an upgrade so I could get into my room right away. (I was prepared to just drop my bags and go see friends.) The complimentary drink tickets are a nice touch also. My room had an enormous pillar in the middle of it that I would have hated in a lesser hotel. But they do an admirable job of passing off this architectural blunder as quaint ambience, and I grew to like it very much. The bathroom was peerless in its price bracket, and probably a couple brackets higher. In short, this hotel is the best-kept secret in the City, and though I hate to share the secret, the least I could do in return for their treatment of me is to send some business their way.

Reviews.Title: “Avalon: Pefect for 3 of us!”
Reviews.Author: Chassy
Reviews.Content: We (parents and 22 year old daughter) stayed at the Avalon from March 10 - 14/05. As first time visitors to the city, we were very impressed with this hotel. Room (Junior suite) was large with two double beds and a privacy screen to separate the sitting area, which created a sense for our daughter of having her "own room", using the pull-out sofa ( which sleeps just one person). Freebies, including continental breakfast buffet, newspaper, internet access, bathrobe and glass of champagne were all appreciated. Room and large marble bathroom were cleaned thoroughly each day. Excellent location for subways, buses and walking (ESB, Macy's, Times Square, theatre district). We felt quite safe walking back to this hotel after the theatre, stopping at nearby Starbucks or Heartland Brewery on the way home. Only probelm we encountered was around lunch on Sunday: several staff members had confirmed that lunch started at noon. However, when our relatives arrived to join us, staff said the dining room did not open until 4 p.m! They recommended a place just a block away, which turned out to be excellent. Car service used by hotel to get us back to LGA was excellent: driver was there half an hour early, which was very reassuring. We will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Avalon for 5 days over Xmas and were really impressed. The room was huge with 2 double beds and a separate lounge area with couch, arm chair and coffee table. We even had 2 large TV's! The bathroom was large, modern and marble. The staff were very friendly and very helpful when I was trying to organise a surprise helicoptor tour of NY for my husband. Breakfast is a continental buffet with all the usual fare such as fruit, cereals, juices, toast etc. The hotel is located very close to the Empire State Building so it puts you in an excellent position for sightseeing and shopping. I would recommend The Avalon if you want a friendly, well-located, value for money hotel with rooms that are ENORMOUS by New York standards. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: Victoriaavi
Reviews.Content: The rooms were amazingly spacious and clean. Hotel staff was very courteous and helpful. This is a great location; close to the subway and within walking distance of Madison Square Garden.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, great ambiance, great food and very courteous staff. Highly recommend to anyone visiting New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you ever get the chance to go to NYC stay @ the Avalon Hotel. It is one of the nicest and classiest hotels I have ever stayed at. The reception staff are brilliant especially Carmen. The rooms are truly luxurious and spacious. The free breakfast is divine and the overall stay was magnificent. The location is excellent as it is right on 5th avenue by the Empire state. It is very central for whatever activity you chose to do while staying in NYC. We loved it so much we are returning in November.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful and stylish”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: me , my wife and two teenagers stayed here for a week in May. We had read a few negative reviews so were alittle worried. How wrong we were. The hotel was very clean, rooms were large, with a seperate sitting area. All the staff were very friendly, and the inclusive buffet breakfast was also very good. we got croissants, toast, bagels ceram cheese , tea cofee, fruit juice etc. Good location, right near to empire state building. we could not fault the hotel at all, next time we go, we will be heading for the Avalon again

Reviews.Title: “has plusses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: call_me_a_cab
Reviews.Content: I stayed there on three separate occasions. Plusses: Had view of Empire State Building (so classy!), breakfast included in hotel price, room was nice & clean, easy access to everything (but, of course, EVERY hotel in NYC has easy access to everything), cost is relatively low compared to comparably clean, "nice" hotels. Minuses: Aloof, bordering-on-rude front desk, no-one brings your bags upstairs, no-one smiles or seems like they're happy you're there to pay their salary, rooms are very, very small. I did not feel like a "guest", I felt like an unwanted visitor at Thanksgiving whose hosts couldn't wait for me to go home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jolly Explorer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Avalon Hotel for five nights from 29 January until 03 February. It was our first ever trip to New York and we were mesmorised with the choice of hotels. Using this site and reading lots of reviews we finally decided on The Avalon Hotel. We made a good choice, the hotel exceeded our expectations. We had a large (junior suite twin) room - very clean with good sized bathroom plus bath!! Room service was excellent with clean bedding every two days, free newspaper every morning, free glass of champagne upon arrival, free breakfast consisting of fresh fruit, cereal, fruit juice, muffins, bagels, tea or coffee. Friendly staff, use of the internet. We would recommend that you ask the hotel to arrange transport back to the airport - the firm they use was first class! We will return!!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME”
Reviews.Author: ATL-LSU
Reviews.Content: Booked 3 rooms at hotel on recent visit for 8 people. ALL of us were very pleased number one with the size of the rooms, the great staff, and cleanliness. I travel a lot and its very hard to please everybody but the Avalon did. The amount we paid for a jr suite compares to most NY small rooms plus u get pass to a real gym. The free breakfast is just cereal and few pasteries. Good safe location as well and the entire staff is friendly from door man to front desk to housekeeping. Another plus is rooms are almost sound proof couldnt hear anything in hallways or next door.

Reviews.Title: “Best Value-priced Hotel in NY”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights over a cold January holiday weekend. The hotel was wonderful. We have stayed in several other NYC hotels in this price range, and this was the best! The rooms were extremely large by NY standards, impeccably clean, and everything was perfect. We used the valet parking ($29/day) and it was worth it for the extreme convenience. The complimentary continental breakfast was not lavish, but the quality of the food was excellent. We got a bargain rate of $119 (before taxes) and will stay here every time we visit the city.

Reviews.Title: “Avalon was Great!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The avalon hotel was great! we stayed for 3 nights from Dec. 27-30, 2004. Great location, it's central between times square and soho. walking is really easy and the subway was safe in the day.I can't stress enough that the location was perfect. Our room was big, clean, and overall spectacular. The continental breakfast had 3 types of cereal, danishes, dounuts, bread for toast, and croisants, plus milk, coffee, and 3 types of juice. Tripadvisor.com really helped me decide, i'm a real patron and using this service was so helpful. You know it's true you really get what you pay for. The avalon was really worth every penny. I know i use great alot but i was so happy with the avalon. Being a first time vistor to new york the hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “In love with the Avalon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful time in NYC January 6-10. Our four days were packed full from beginning to end, but at the close of every day we had the wonderful joy of returning to our room at the Avalon. The staff was very helpful the night of our late arrival. The room was much bigger than I had imagined, with a very comfortable sitting area, and a perfect view of the Empire State building. We had read all the reviews about the marble bathroom, and it lived up to the billing. The complimentary paper and turn-down service was the icing on the cake. Each morning we enjoyed a delicious breakfast--no boxes of cereal or stale muffins. We dined on fresh pastries and fruit. The staff even changed the music in the dining area to Disney tunes for our 11-year-old. We had a great time. I also want to put in a word for a family-friendly, off broadway show. We had read an article in our local paper about "Under the Bridge." For a heart-warming musical that everyone will enjoy, go see it if you can. We purchased discount tickets at the TKTS outlet in lower Manhattan to avoid the crowds. We can't wait to go back -- and believe me, we will stay at the Avalon again. Thanks to TripAdvisor for helping us find this jewel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Lee_D_C
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and me stayed from the 28th Dec 2004 till the 04th Jan 2005 and found this hotel excellent. I'd read the report beforehand so was expecting unhelpful staff and noisy air con. What we found was a great hotel, albeit stuck next to a hundred chinese restaurants with helpful staff and the air con only really came on during the night once but didn't bother us, as we were so tired from all the days’ activities. The room was a very good size, cleaned every day and we were given fresh towels. The only annoying thing was (and this has nothing to do with the hotel) when I was using the computer one morning and had only been about 10 minutes and a fellow guest who was an America thought he had the given right to use the computer and told me so, I just laughed. So to sum the hotel up: nice helpful staff, clean rooms, good location, decent price and a meal in the morning to kick start the day – what more could you ask for!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avalon does not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Avalon for three days in December based on the tripadvisor reviews. I honestly thought we were staying in a different hotel, based on our experience. It was cheap by NYC standards, I suppose ($199 night, before taxes). The layout of the room we received (basically a room with a screen to give the illusion that you have a suite) was not what appeared in the web photo (which is one of the executive suites), nor what was described to me when I booked the room (which was again the executive suite). The ventilation system was so noisy that we phoned the main desk in the middle of the night to have it turned off), then froze because one of the window frames let in a huge draft. I wouldn't stay here again and frankly was a bit embarassed that I had recommended this place to my friend. She clearly was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Careful of online reservations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at the Avalon a number of times and still love the hotel itself and accomodations despite a seemingly continuous string of difficulties with online reservations. First time reserved through one of the major online hotel reservation systems. Upon arrival actually got an upgrade to what we had reserved. Nice touch! Unfortunately, the second time we again reserved through an online hotel reservation system. Upon arrival, the night manager informed us that they had no rooms. His explanation was that in the hotel business sometimes "things happen". Rather gruff. He at least refunded our money and paid for us to be housed at another hotel, so while it was a disappointment after a long day of travel, financially it worked out. The additional downside was that we were sent to the Library hotel and put in a tiny room, much smaller than what we had reserved. Third times the charm right? This time I reserved through the hotel's website thinking that even they couldn't mess up that reservation. Well, I guess they can. Upon arrival only standard rooms were available. Had another rather terse conversation with the night manager. In this case he didn't offer any compensation. I had two more reservations already in the system for trips later in the month. He told me that he would go in and put in his personal note so that we wouldn't be downgraded and did some work in the computer (I called back a week later and the reservations were only showing standard rooms, even though I had booked a King Suite and confirmed it with the night manager that night). I must be a glutton for punishment. I've reserved again, this time over the phone. We'll see what comes of it. Bottom line, it is one of the best accomodations for the price if you can get what you reserve. Be wary and confirm your room status before you arrive, then again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly okay...would not stay there again...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Avalon Dec 27 - 29, 2004. We selected the hotel based on the Frommer's guide, reviews here and price ($139 per night for a jr. suite booked directly through the hotel's website) as well as location. Location-wise, couldn't be beat. Off 5th Avenue, extremely close to the subway, near lots of restaurants. Price was great -- included a glass of champagne on arrival (nice) and complimentary continental breakfast (never did try it -- sorry) so how could we complain? The staff was really nice -- let us check in early, gave us a room with sort of a view on the 9th floor, always helpful and smiling. The cons: 1. Everything was just a little bit threadbare and worn, albeit clean. 2. The section of 32nd Street on which the hotel is located is really tattered. 3. The odor of neighboring restaurants wafted up and into our hotel room window -- YUCK! 4. The rooms were cold --- they did have portable heaters and extra blankets but it was definitely C-O-L-D. 5. Zippo water pressure in the shower. :( 6. $9 for the house chardonnay -- yes, I know this is NYC and a hotel bar but even that is ridiculous. Overall, not a bad place but not the "gem" that Frommer's makes it out to be. If you can get a rate of less than $120 a night I'd say book it.

Reviews.Title: “good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from Dec 19 to Dec 26, 2004. Very nice hotel within walking distance of almost everything. Great breakfast, quite large rooms, nice service. Only thing I was annoyed with is the charging of $1.00 for telephone calls to 800 numbers.

Reviews.Title: “What a little gem!”
Reviews.Author: MrsKnight
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this wonderful hotel from the 11th-14th November 2004, having read the reviews on this website. It really was a great hotel - the room was huge - amazing for New York, where space is normally limited! We had a fantastic view of the Empire State Building (ask for a room on the fourth floor for the best views) and the bathroom was clean and modern - and marble! Huge wardrobe, huge bed and two televisions!! We didn't eat at the hotel - there are two many other amazing places to go - but we really couldn't complain about anything (although as others have said, the air conditioning is hard to figure out!). The street on which the hotel is on is just off 5th avenue, a two minute walk from the Empire State and ten minutes from Times Square - it really is right in the middle of everything. You won't be disappointed, especially for the price. Let's hope they don't realise how good value they are and put the prices up!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Saral
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the Avalon just before midnight. On first viewing the front of the hotel and street didn't look very promising. Checked in and got a Junior Suite we had booked, check in very quick, staff a bit grumpy. Room was large by New York standards, two double beds and a separate sitting area with a two sitter settee and another soft chair. Writing table and hard chair. Room also had two TV's with a good choice of channels, two large sets of draws, a large wardrobe with iron, ironing board, safe and an umbrella. Bathroom was large, spotlessly clean, with a WC bath/shower, hand basin and plenty of room to spread toilettries out, bathroom was all marble and there were plenty of towels in all sizes. Breakfast the next morning was filling. Three kind of juices, tea, coffee, milk, three cereals, whole bananas, apples, oranges, yoghurt, cut up fruit, muffins, pastries, bagels, jams etc, sliced bread and a toaster. Coffee and tea were brought to the table everything else was help yourself. We never encountered the really nasty waitress I had heard about! There was a short wait for the table on the Sunday morning but not after this, we ate about 9am. There was free internet access just off the lobby, which was usually only in use in the morning. The hotel was well placed, one block from the Empire State Bldg, five mins walk to Macys, 14 mins to Times Square (getting stopped at every light) 2 mins to the very handy No6 subway. Most websites stated 'Hotel Shuttle' under the facilites for this hotel, but they don't deal with any shuttles and will only book you a car to JFK for $60 which is dearer than if you booked yourself, so beware. Overall I would definately stay here again, but the staff could be friendlier.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place to Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: krishanula
Reviews.Content: My mother and I take a trip to NYC every December, and this was our first stay at the Avalon Hotel. We only wish we had stayed here sooner! As you may see in other reviews, this hotel is wonderful, and the staff is very accomodating and friendly. This hotel was in excellent condition, smelled good, and the marble bathrooms were an extra added touch! The bellstaff was courteous and helpful, flagged down taxi's for us, receommended places to eat, kept our shopping bags for us even after check-out. Also, when we arrived check-in took only about 5 minutes, and they allowed us to check in 3 hrs early!! The free continental breakfast had a great selection, and they even had staff there to seat you and pour you coffee, etc. I have read other reviews which state that the Avalon is off the beaten path, but I have to disagree. I had a lovely view of the Empire State Building from my window, it was only a few very short blocks away. And Macy's is also about a 5 minute walk. If you like to shop like we do, this is an excellent place to be! I can't say enough good things about this hotel, don't be afraid to stay here, book right away!!

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - need to specify room requirement”
Reviews.Author: NYAOK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is set in a fantastic location, around the corner from the Empire State Building, across the road from Macy's, good central location. My main concern is with the reservation process - when booking through the hotel's website you will need to get a guarantee for what room required as found this difficult upon our arrival. Required 2 rooms; 1 twin room and 1 double room both junior suites. Arrived and only had 1 double and 1 standard room available. Received guarantee via email from hotel back in June 04 (stayed Dec 04) confirming rooms required, but our first night both parties were in the incorrect rooms. After numerous conversations with the front desk and the night manager, on our second night we were finally in the correct rooms. Felt front desk staff unhelpful with problem even when night manager was involved - this may have been a one off as other hotel guests were happy with service. Plus side, bell staff were fantastic, bags were sent to your room so you did not need to worry about that, rooms were good, cleaned fantastically, breakfast filling as all you can eat continential, but would advise getting to breakfast either first thing or nearer 10am as can queue to get a table. As mentioned above, the location is fantastic, a great base for sightseeing and shopping. Overall, lovely hotel but the first night problems did dampen our stay as could not relax until the second day.

Reviews.Title: “Great room, fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: louise1809
Reviews.Content: My mum and I just spent three nights at the Avalon Hotel, we were very happy with our room, two big beds, a lounge area and nice clean bathroom. The staff were excellent, gave us lots of friendly advice and help, especially CARMEN (WE LOVE YOU CARMEN!!!!) We had breakfast round the corner on madison ave, at JIMMYS (Pancakes, bacon etc etc...) and walked the one block to Empire State Building where you can get the hop on hop off buses, arrange your helicopter rides etc. Subway also very close. With regards to comments about air conditioning, it does come on in night as it resets every six hours but you just ask reception to turn it off before you retire and thats it!! My top tip for anyone visiting is go and see the Rockettes Christmas Spectacular - AMAZING!!! Dont even think about any other hotel, this one is a great rate and is good all round, just BOOK IT!!!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: default41b
Reviews.Content: Great stay at the Avalon! We had a nice room with a wonderful view on the Empire state building. Loved the breakfast buffet. And the hotel is close to metro station and 5th avenue shopping! If a complain has to be made, the staff could be kinder.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garyuk17
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Avalon for 5 nights from November 23rd to November 28th and would choose the Avalon for our next visit. Everything in the hotel is to a high standard and you don't hear a sound except for the air conditioning. We stayed in room 1006 which is very spacious and well decorated with two 28" televisions, marble bathroom, sitting area and a pretty good view if you don't look out the side windows (brick wall and water tower) but the front window (although over looks and alley) has a good view of two high buildings that were lit up in Christmas colours. The breakfast was fine to start the day exept for the waitress who never smiled and frequently spilled the tea( that is if you could get her attention) even though this was the only thing she had to do as it was a buffet style breakfast. The rooms are cleaned to a high standard every day and we could find no fault at all with the Avalon. On the last day our subway broke down causing us to miss our shuttle to the airport by 2 minutes, even though the hotel asked them to wait and then recalled them they refused to return or give us a refund for the return leg of the journey. The front desk guys did everything possible to get us to the airport, making phone calls and running outside to hail a taxi, if it wasn't for them we would still be standing there lost. Be warned about the "Newark Express Bus", bettter to stick with a taxi even though it is more expensive ($65 )but far quicker. The location of the hotel is great, 32nd street is a bit worn looking ((but totally safe)when you turn the corner and the Empire State building is right there it is "wow" also Macy's is a few minutes beyond that as is Manhattan mall which is nice but like any other mall in any city. Stick to Macy's you could be in there for days especially when they have a sale, don't forget you discount card in the hotel lobby or from Macy's visitor centre. We will definetly choose the Avalon next time we go to New York. Oh two things if you go to Little Italy try Benito II,very good food but a little busy also if you are taking the subway to South Street for the ferry to Ellis Island, make sure you are in the first 5 cars of the train or it will be chaos, you will see what I mean when you go and all the tourists running from car to car. It is quite funny in retrospect but a big hassle at the time.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded Expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 adults, 2 kids) stayed in room 1003 at the Avalon on November 23rd and 24th. It was a deluxe suite, with two queen beds, and a separate living room that was about 10x10. It had an excellent view of the Empire State Building. The bathroom was large, and had a separate tub and shower stall. It was very comfortable and quiet. There was a free complimentary breakfast, with cold cereal, muffins, fruit, and fresh melon salad. We chose this hotel based upon the good location and the positive Tripadvisor reviews, and were glad we did. It's nicer than the perfectly fine but no frills Grand Union Hotel a block east on 32nd St., where we stayed in August 2004. So if you want economy, go with the Grand Union, but if you want more room and comfort, go with the slightly more expensive Avalon.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price - not something I will tell others about.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a business trip for three nights in a junior suite during September 2004. Typical NYC tiny room - mine happened to look out on the roof of the building and was in a spot where two other rooms windows bracketed the view. Limited cable selections, pricey room service, bar very pricey for even NYC. Staff was OK, but definitely had better things to do than pay attention to front desk - not enough to complain - but noticeable twice. On the plus staff side - the front door guys were great, and the room was cleaned well. Fitness center had a sauna which is unique, but otherwise cramped with too much gear - also had bottled water in the center which is great. Popular but pricey restaurant onsite - head a few doors down for a quality cheaper diner setting - or over to the square for all American fare.

Reviews.Title: “Good deal but very bad waitress”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Hotel Avalon is a good deal for a 4 stars hotel in New York. Junior suits are very spacious. One major problem : The service for the breakfast is really bad, particularly the waitress.

Reviews.Title: “Terriffic little hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have recently returned from a shopping trip to New York staying at the Avalon. A terrific little hotel in an ideal location for shopping. We were a party of three ladies who shared a junior suite (2 double beds and a pull out sofa bed). On arrival the staff were more than helpful and we were checked in in no time. It is located only a short 10 minute walk from Macy's and the hotel provided us with discount leaflets for the store giving us a 12 o/o discount off our purchases. The subway for the R train which took us to Century 21 (a fabulous discount department store selling all the designer labels and more) was located at the end of the street. Manhattan Mall was just a five minute walk from the front door of the hotel and well worth a visit especially to KB Toys for those all important Santa orders. The rooms were warm and comfortable and spotlessly clean. Although the safe was locked on arrival we reported it to the front desk staff and it was dealt with and operating for our use within minutes of reporting it. Staff were helpful in providing take away menus for order and delivery to our room from outside Chinese and Italian Restaurants. We would recommend Lily's Chinese Take away but be careful not to order too much as the portions are large!!! Complimentary breakfast was extremely convenient enabling us to head straight to the shops after leaving the hotel. A buffet of fresh fruits, cereals, bagels, etc, and coffee and toast was a welcome start to the day. Desk staff kindly ordered a vehicle for our departure to JFK. The service was excellent with the car arriving 45 minutes early and contentedly waiting while we had our complimentary glass of Champagne in the bar. A perfect end to a perfect stay in this lovely hotel. We will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “First time in NYC”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The Avalon was recommended to us but as with all recommendations we were a little dubious as different people like different things. However, we needn't have worried as this hotel is great! It was our first visit to NYC and the location of this hotel meant we were able to get everywhere. We walked downtown to Chinatown, Little Italy, Wall St etc and uptown to Times Square, Central Park etc. Walking was fun and safe and we saw loads on the way. If we were tired we just got the 6 subway back which stopped just around the corner! The room was on the 7th floor and although it overlooked the rear yard not the street we didn't mind as it was so quiet and we had 6 really good undisturbed nights. Maids were good and we had clean towels and fresh sheets everyday. Didn't use restaurant apart from the very first morning as there are so many good places to eat. Great hotel, great place and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great find”
Reviews.Author: lovingmyholidays
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights in a junior suite. Very good price and represents great value. Junior suites are big with a screened off sitting room. Bathrooms are the full marble works. Breakfast is, unusually, included and very adequate though not served with much style: cereals, yogurt, fruit salad, juices, bagels and baked goods. Excellent location too. Only downside is the noisy aircon.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, location, price...”
Reviews.Author: BuffsDAWGs
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Avalon for 4 days last week (10/14-17) with all my family in town for my brother's wedding. Four different rooms and everyone was pleased. My DC brother negotiated a great price for us and we were very pleased with the well appointed rooms. As withh almost all NYC rooms, a little small but at this price in NY who's complaining. Wedding was at the Empire St Bldg so the location was perfect. Also close enough to the E Village, Nolita, and SoHo for the restaurants we went to. And I cannot say enough about the staff. They went way out of their way to accomodate us, even lining up 3 taxis for our crowd to get to dinner in the rain. Stay here if you can get a room and need to be in this part of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Terriffic Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Avalon the weekend of October 1, 2004. Staff was very friendly, the rooms are clean and large by New York Standards and the neighborhood is safe, clean and charming. It is also in a central and convenient location. I would stay at this hotel again in a heartbeat!

HotelInfo.Name: Avalon
HotelInfo.Address: 16 East 32nd Street, New York City, NY 10016
